Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Thus begin the words of Albucasis.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	O sons, since I have fulfilled this book for you, which is the end of the science of medicine, by whose completion in it its end has come to be, and through whose expositions and declarations, it is apparent to me that you will complete that which concerns you with this treatise, which is a part of the operation by hand, so it is surgery.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	Because the operation by hand is spread throughout our realm and in our time deprived of all, while the science of it greatly perishes, its visions are obscured, and nothing remains of it except a few small descriptions in the books of the ancients, which alter most things and lead to those errors and hesitations that are hidden within their minds, and the strength of the art is prolonged.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And it appears to me that you will enliven that through the arrangement of this treatise in accordance with the way of exposition and declaration and abbreviation; and so that the forms of the tools of cautery and other instruments of the work come through addition of the declaration, and through preparation of them, which cause is necessary.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	But the cause for which no good artist is attained by his hand in our time is that the art of medicine is long, and that its performer must be exercised in the science of anatomy, which knows the parts of members and their forms, and the conjunction and separation of them; and has the knowledge of bones, nerves, and sinews, and the number of those, and their exit; and of the pulsating veins and the quiet ones, and the places of their issuing.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And because of that Hypocras says that by name is much, but in the work little, and especially in the art of the hand.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	But we have already said that in the introduction of this book; for whoever is not learned in what we have said about anatomy is not evacuated so that he does not fall into error by which men will die, as I have seen many of those, for some are formed in this science and throw themselves from it without knowledge or experience.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	For I saw a foolish and experienced doctor open an abscess of scrofula on the neck of a woman, and cut some arteries of the neck so that much blood flowed, and the woman died under his hands.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And I saw another doctor who, when he was called, pulled out a stone from a man who had a process in his state, and the stone was great, and he came to him and took out that stone with a piece of the bladder, and that man died on the third day.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And I called upon extracting that one, and I saw that because of the size of the stone and the disposition of the patient I knew he would die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And I saw another doctor who took stipends from a duke of our land for surgery, and thus he did on a black slave whose leg was fractured; and prepared by his ignorance, extracted the fracture over the wound with powders and splinters with strong compression, and did not allow the wound breath.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	And he bandaged it according to his desires, and he lay for several days and commanded that I loosen the bandage, and so he was for many days and commanded that I loosen the bandage; and he stayed like this until the thigh and leg were apostemated, and came to perdition.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And I was called to him, and I prepared to loosen the bandage, and there was tranquillity and relief from his pains.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	But indeed the corruption was confirmed in the member, so that I could not restrain it and the corruption did not cease to wander in the member until the patient perished.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And I saw another doctor who perforated a cancerous abscess, and it was ulcerated for several days, until the malignancy of it grew great with its lord.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	The which cause is that the old cautery is pure of melancholic humor, and it does not come to it from iron in any way, but that it be in a member who suffers so that it comes from all.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And because of that, sons, it is necessary for you that the operation by hand be devised in two ways: so is in operation to him who is associated with health, and in work to whom it is perilous in the greatest dispositions.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And I have already exhorted that in every place of this book where there is an operation in which error and fear come; so that it is necessary for you to guard that and leave that, so that the foolish do not find a way to speak and discourage you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	And thus take your weapons with solicitude and with protection of God, and your patients with facility and firmness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And use the better way through the grace of God that they may go to health and glorious success, and lay those terrible diseases of difficult cure, and display your weapons from that which makes you fear, so that solicitude in your faith and in your name does not abandon you: for it remains to your glory, and beyond in the world to your sanctities.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	Gaulish already said in some of her warnings:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	Do not heal wicked illnesses, so that wicked doctors are not named.
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And I have devised this book according to three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	Begins the division of the book, and first of the first part.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter ordered from the head into feet, in the forms of the instruments and the tools of cauteries, and what is necessary in the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The division of the second part.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter, of bleeding and piercing, and of cupping, and of wounds, and of extraction of thorns and similar things, all capitoloized and ordered in the forms of the instruments.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	Division of the third part.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter, of restoration and dislocation, and of cure of torture and of similar things; capitoloized from the head into feet, and of the forms of the instruments.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	Of cautery with fire and acute medicine and remembrance of the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	With that begins the treatise of all the book.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	That I may tell you the quality of the elements of that cautery and of its pains, and in which complexions cautery is prohibited.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	Then I say that the word of the quality of the element of cautery and of its pain is long and prolix, and subtle through science, and secret hidden; and many wise have spoken much about it, and they have been disagreed about it, and for me a little of their words is enough, fearing prolixity.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	And thus I say that cautery confers universally on all complexions which are by matter or by its matter, excepting two complexions, which are cold complexions.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the cold and dry complexions by matter, they are disagreed; for some say that cautery is beneficial to it, and others say the contrary of that, that cautery is not convenient in an illness which is by quality and dryness, for fire's nature is quality and dryness, and it is convenient that an illness be cured when cold and dry.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And he says the contrary of that, that cautery is done benefit in all illnesses cold and dry which we see in the bodies of men, for when you compare the body of man and its moisture to the complexions of fire, you rub the body of man dry.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And I say through his word that experiment that one has already seen me several times to be discovered.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	However, we do not believe that anyone should come to this who is not experienced and practiced in the chapter of cauteries by recent exercises, and has known the diversity of complexions of men and the disposition of diseases in their bodies, and the causes of those, and their accidents, and the space of time of those.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	But in other complexions, there is no fear over them, especially in cold and moist diseases; for all doctors have agreed on those, and are not disagreed on using cauteries on them.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	And know, children, that the secret of healing by cautery with fire and of its goodness is that cauteries with medicine that burns are when fire is simple, whose action does not reach except to the member which is cauterized and does not affect another member adjusted to it except with a small injury.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	But the action of medicine that burns reaches to those members from which it is distant; and it makes difficult healing come strongly in the member with disease, and strongly it drives it out.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	But fire, through its sublimity and the goodness of its substance, does not do that except to make superfluous; And it is known to us by experience and by longevity of service of study on the truth of causes; And because of this I am excused from the length of speech. And if it were not that I was not read in my free time in this pause with you, a secret hidden with fire, and the quality of the operation of it in bodies and its expulsion by which diseases are expelled, with philosophical speech demonstrated, which would be acute in your ears.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	And know, children, that they disagree on the time when it is convenient to do cauteries, and they pause the best time in spring.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	And I say that cauteries are convenient in all times, because the harm by the accidental time is submerged in the benefit of what is drawn by cautery, and especially if the cautery is for pain or of necessary pains, strong and fiery, which do not suffer delay so that evil comes from them, which is greater than a little harm coming through time.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	And therefore do not fear in your ears, o children, that which is not judged except by the common people and foolish doctors; It is that to that disease which is healed by cautery there is no reduction of time at all, and they pause on the consequence of it.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the cause is not as they think it is, because cautery is only in place of medicine which alters the complexion and dries up the humidities which are the cause that pain comes.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	But cauteries are superfluous over medicine by willfulness of their strength and power of their operation, and greatness of their Lord.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	And it is possible that his disease will return at some time, according to the complexion of the patient and the location of his disease, and its power, and what is prepared in his body by the accumulation of superfluities in him, and what comes to him in his acquisition in foods and like those causes; But that disease in which cautery is administered is a subtle disease in a member with few superfluities and humidities, as well as cauterization of a tooth for pain and likeness to that, it is possible that the same pain will not return in him, but this happens little.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	And popular speech is that cautery is the last remedy of medicine; And it is a true saying, not that they understand in it, because they think that there is no healing that benefits from medicine or anything else besides cautery.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	And the cause is contrary to that; And the intention that cautery is the last remedy of medicine is only when we administer the methods of healing in some diseases, and those medicines do not confer it, and especially at the end of the cause we administer cautery to them, and it benefits that.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And from here we see that cautery is not the last remedy of medicine according to the intention which the vulgar and foolish doctors understand it.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	And the ancients said that cautery with gold is better than cautery with iron, and they did not say that except for the equality of gold and sublimity of its substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And they said that the place of cautery does not make brawn, although that is not absolutely true, because I have seen that it only happens in some bodies and not in others; And cauterization with that is good and better than with iron as they say; But when you do cauterize with fire with gold, it is not declared to you, because it is ignited according to the quantity that you want for the rust of gold, and because it prepares to receive friction; And if you adjust it on fire, some leaves are heated so that the gold-smith can pick them up with the occupation of that.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And because of this, cauterization with iron is done to us more lightly and closer to rectitude of operation.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	And I have ordered this chapter on cautery according to chapters, and I have ordered those of the head into the feet, so that they ask me what they want from it.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	Of cauterization for headache caused by coldness and moisture.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cauterization confers with humidity and coldness on the servant accident of which there are two causes; It is a cause of soda and multitude of fluxes, called rhachitis, from the parts of the ears and the nostrils flowing, and multitude of sleeping, and pain in teeth, and of the golaryro, and universally of all disease that comes through friction, as well as paralysis, stroke, and like in those diseases.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The form of this cauterization is this: that first you command the patient to be evacuated by laxative medicine for three or four days, according to the strength of the patient and his age and habit.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And then command that he should shave his head with a razor, and then make him lie between your knees on a low bench, and let him rest his feet on your lap.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And then pause the edge of your palm above his nose between his eyes.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	But however, when the place of your middle finger is reached, sign that place with your thumb, and then ignite the cautery olive, of which this is the form:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And then pause that over the place marked with your thumb, in such a way that it descends, and while your hand is pressed little by little, you revolve that.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	And then lift your hand lightly and look at the place, and if you see some quantity of the head removed, as well as the quantity of hair, then lift your hand again, and if it does not return with that iron, with another, if it is chilled, while that is seen by the eye what I have said to you.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And then take a little salt and dissolve it over the place and let him lick that for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	And then pause upon it the cloth soaked in vinegar and let it lie on it while the ash of the fire is destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	And then heal the place with tetrapharmacon unguent while it is healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And they said that when the Roman plaster is open, as many meals are poured onto the brawn, because it is better and more beneficial.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	And they said that the tendon should be cauterized within the bone, and the cautery should be held within it while some part of the nature of the bone is burned.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	And then it should be wiped with that which is astringent to the bone, and then healed.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	Others say that with the cautery it reached the bone, as the strong pressure on the bone made the bone break, and this is the form of small aphecata.
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	And they believe that from that location the vapor from the head expires.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	And if the ulcer has been open for a long time, it should be treated until it is healed and consolidated.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	But I have not seen these two types of cautery at all, except in a few cases out of fear; and for me, it is better that he be saved, if possible, because the head is devastated by the solution of continuity as we have testified in other members, especially when the patient's head is of a frail nature.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	And the first type of cautery is safer and better for me, and I use it both ways to save lives.
Capitol segon.	Chapter two:
Del cauteri del cap.	Of cauterization of the head:
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When in all the head occurs a chronic and long-lasting pain and this is prolonged in the patient, and he uses garlic and leeches and scabies and plasters and poultices and bandages and hot stones and similar things, especially if he has already been cauterized with a cautery but none of those remedies benefit him, then consider that if the patient's head is of a strong creation in its nature, and not frail, and you find a great deal of coldness there, then cauterize it again with another cautery beneath that one a little.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	Then cauterize the top of his head with a cautery until the scalp is split open.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	The scalp split open and the quantity we have recounted discovered and cauterized with a cautery in the back of the head in the place which is called a vessel — and it is that place in which the ventouse is stopped.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And press your hand there and do not discover the bone, because through this the patient feels great pain unlike all other cauterizations of the head.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	And I say this cautery in its place, because the cautery with which you cauterize the horns of the head and the occiput is a more subtle cautery than that with which the middle of the head is cauterized; and this is the form of it:
Capitol ters.	Chapter three:
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	Of the cauterization of not antique emigration:
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When a strong pain in the front of the head or a pain extending to the eye, the head should be evacuated with medicated cleansing agents, and the other cure should be administered, which I have described in the diseases of the head; and if all fails, cauterization is done in two ways: either cauterization with an acute burning medicine, or with iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	But cauterization with a burning medicine is to take a piece of charcoal, and to scorch it and put the ends of it on both sides of the head.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	Then cut the site of the pain in the temple with a sharp-pointed lance until it is done underneath the scalp, so that it is hidden.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	And then press on it with a descent constriction, and let it remain there for three hours; and then remove the charcoal and treat the wound with cotton soaked in wine or vinegar until the location turns purple.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then heal that with ointment once it is healed.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you want to do this with some burning medicines which I have written about in the two treaties on burning medicines:
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	But the cauterization with iron according to this manner: heat the cautery of which this is the form:
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	and it is called a peg-like nail, because the head of it is like the form of a peg with some curvature, and in the middle of it is a small protuberance.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	Then rest your hand on the site of the pain — so that the nail is not burned underneath — and rotate the iron little by little with speed.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	And if the amount of it that is burned by the thickness of the scalp as far as the size of the nail, and raise your hand so that the artery underneath is not burned, so that no flow of blood comes.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then moisten cotton in salt water and place that on the site, and let it remain for three days; and then place cotton moistened with wine, and heal with ointment once it is healed.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	And if you want to cauterize with the tip of the scalpel according to cautery, and beware of cutting the artery in this not-ancient emigration:
Capitol quart.	Chapter four:
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	Of the cauterization of antique emigration:
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	When you cure emigration with what we have said about the preceding cure, and what we have said in the divisions of diseases, and the cure does not benefit, and you see that the disease which does not suffice it is what we have said about the first cautery with medicine or the cautery with fire, then where you ignite the cautery-scalpel until it turns white, then indicate on the site of the pain with a line the length of which is the size of your finger, or however much; and having pressed your hand there for an outlet and strengthened that there, pierce the artery within and enter into the bone.
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	However, it is necessary for you to guard against the continuance of the mandible, which is damaged by chewing, and that the joint not be burned and the nerve which controls that, and that no spasm ensue.
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	And if it is about the custody and care of the flow of blood from the artery which has burst, because there is danger in the burst of it, especially to him who ignores what he does and is not skilled and experienced; let the operation be done at the beginning.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	And I will come with a reminder of the regimen for accidental blood flow from an artery according to its own manner in your free book.
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And if you see that this disease does not suffice this cautery and the body of the patient tolerates it, cauterize in the middle of the head as we have recounted, and heal the wound once it is healed.
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	And if you want to administer the cautery which we have said in the chapter on stretching of an artery with cautery having two edges, it is better and more appropriate cauterization.
Capitol .v.	Chapter five:
De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	Of the cauterization of the pains of ears.
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	When in the ear there is pain from cold and it is cured by lactic causes and with the other cure which we have said in the division, and the pain does not cease, then ignite the cautery, and this is the one which has the name puncta, of which this is the form:
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	Then pierce it with the point and let it be guided around all of the ear as it is rotated, or in the circuit of whichever one if the pain is in either one.
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	Lengthen you with the cautery of the root of the ear little by little so that it tests the place with feeling.
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	And if the cautery of ten points in all the ear, and which one, then heal the sites once they are healed.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter six:
De cauterizacio de turtura.	Of the cauterization of torture:
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	Torture which is cured and cauterized with spices which come from phlegm, according to what we have said in the divisions of diseases.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	Avoid cauterization with the species which comes from dryness or by spasm of the nerve.
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	When you cure that species of torture with herbs and poultices and compresses, and your cure does not confer, then where you cauterize the patient with three cauteries: the first pierces the root of the ear, the second a small one underneath the temple, and the third pierces the junction of two lips.
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	And apply your cautery to the opposite side of the sick person, because softness does not appear except on the side where there is an appearance of healing.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	And the way of cauterizing is that you cauterize with the cautery on the right side of the upper part of the ear, and in the temple another, the length of which is according to the length of the finger toe, and place your hand holding the cautery until half the thickness of the hair has been burned.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	And this is the form of the cautery, and it is a special instrument of the surgeon, the form of which is shown in front of the table.
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	However, more subtle is that one a little like this; and cover what is in it of superfluous thickness a little.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	Then treat the area with what is before it has been processed until it is healed.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter .vii.
De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.	Of cauterization of ancient apoplexy.
Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot.	When apoplexy is old and you treat it with what we have said, and your medication does not work, and the patient does not have a fever, then cauterize him with four cauteries: on all the horns of his head; and with cautery in the middle of his head, as we have said; and cauterize him in the neck.
E la manieyra del cauteri es fayta segon que es desus dit.	And the manner of cautery is done according to what has been said above.
E ja es cauterizat sobre la boca del estomac; e es mays derier; e aprop sia curat am aquo que procezeys.	And it has already been cauterized over the mouth of the stomach; and it is more behind; and let it be cured with what processes.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter .viii.
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	Of cauterization of oblivion made by flame.
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	Let large jars and pills be given to the patient in the beginning by the servant who cleanses them.
E aprop ras le cap tot del malaute e pausa sus le coguot de lu emplaustre de cetre descrit en le tractat dels emplastres.	Then scrape all of the patient's head and place on his neck a poultice of cedar described in the treatise on poultices.
E pausa aquel alcunas veguadas, quar aquel es manieyra de cauteri.	And apply it several times, for that is the way of cautery.
E fay aquo segon aquel meteys orde le qual ja he dit.	And do that according to what medicine orders which we have already said.
E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col.	And if he heals well by those, and if not, then do to him three cauteries in the back part of his head, which descend from the highest part of his head into the lowest part of his neck.
E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	And place between each cautery the thickness of a finger, and treat the cautery with what has been said.
Mays si tu vos addicio e le malaute es aquo tollerant, lahoras fay a lu cauteri en le mieg loc; e si voys major addicio, lahora cauteriza aquel sobre les dos corns.	But if you want to increase it and the patient can tolerate it, then do cautery in the middle of his head; and if you see greater increase, then cauterize him on both horns.
Aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat; e sia le cauteri olivar segon la forma denant donat.	Then treat that until it is healed; and let the cautery be olive-colored according to the form given before.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter .ix.
De cauterisacio de parazili e de mollificacio de tot le cors.	Of cauterization of paralysis and of softening of all the body.
Cove que tu procesiscas en mondificacio del cap am jerras e am aquo que havem dit; e aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap, e am cauteri sobre totz les corns del cap, e am cauteri sobre la deriera partida de lu, e am tres cauteris sobre les spondils del col.	Let the servant cleanse his head by jars and what we have said; and scrape the patient's head, then cauterize him with cautery in the middle of his head, and with cautery on all the horns of his head, and with cautery on the back part of him, and with three cauteries on the vertebrae of his neck.
E si es necessari en la malautia de mollificacio del cors de trops aquel e les malautes tollerantz e la malautia es fort, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e dererament am cauteri entro que sia comborit de la codena mot de lu, e aleva la tieua ma.	And if it is necessary in the softening of the body's paralysis that he tolerates and the illness is strong, then cauterize him with four cauteries on the vertebrae of his back, and finally with cautery until half the thickness of the hair has been burned, and raise your hand.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat, e aquest sia cauteri olivar.	Then treat that until it is healed, and let that be an olive-colored cautery.
Capitol .x.	Chapter .x.
De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	Of cauterization of epilepsy.
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	The epileptic is not cauterized unless the epilepsy is due to phlegm.
E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.	And so let the servant cleanse his brain with herbs and with the other treatment which we have said in the division when the patient is large and tolerates the exception of medicines.
E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.	And if the patient is a child who does not endure medicines, then let the servant administer to him healing drinks and masticators, before meals, with good food.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en le mieg loc del cap segon la manieyra precedent, e am autre cauteri en le occiput de lu, e sobre quascun corn del cap sieu cauterisa.	Then scrape the patient's head, and then cauterize him with one cautery in the middle of his head according to the preceding manner, and with another cautery on the back of his head, and cauterize on each horn of his head.
E si le malaute es fort e es tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteris les quals he ditz, en havent paraliticament e mollificacio del cors sobre les spondils del col e les spondils del dos.	And if the patient is strong and tolerates it, then cauterize him with cauteries which I have said, having paralysis and softening of the body on the vertebrae of the neck and the back.
E sia cauteri olivar segon qu’es precedit.	And let it be an olive-colored cautery according to what is preceded.
Mays si le malaute es enfant, lahoras pausa cauteri subtil segon aquesta manieyra.	But if the patient is a child, then apply a subtle cautery according to this manner.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter .xi.
De cauterizacio de melencolia.	Of cauterization of melancholy.
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	When the causes of melancholy are corrupted humidities and thick phlegm, then cauterize him with the cauteries which we have said in having paralysis.
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	And if the cause of melancholy is excess phlegm declining into melancholy, and the patient' body is cold, then let him drink what cleanses his brain according to what has preceded in the division.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.	Then scrape the patient's head, and then make a decently twisted bandage of it over the circle, and place that on the middle of his head.
E le malaute sia sesent cayrat, e sia tengut de tota partida.	And let the patient be in a sweat, and let him be held in every part.
E aprop pausa liniment; et es pus digne de boder antic de ovelhas.	Then apply a liniment; and it is more worthy of an old ram of sheep.
E escalfa aquel sobre le foc per calefaccio temprada per mesura, le qual le dit sufferta quan es mes en lu.	And let that be heated over the fire with moderate heat, which he endures when it is within him.
E aprop vuo’ aquel en le mieg loc del cap de lu en le cercle, e leysa lu entro que sia enfregidat.	Then apply that in the middle of his head on the circle, and let him be within until he is deflated.
E fay aquo am le malaute en tota semmana una veguada, am le autre regiment de lu bo entro que sia sanat; o si vols, cauteriza aquel fazen petitz puntz segon lo mays de lu, sino que tenguas la ma am un cauteri ayssi ordenat: aquesta es specia de cauteri la qual humecta le cervel am equalitat.	And do that to him once every week, with his other regimen well within until he is healed; or if you wish, cauterize him making small points according to his temperature, but have your hand on a cautery otherwise ordered: this is a special cautery which moistens the brain equally.
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	Then apply that cloth wrapped in wool or in flannel of wool.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter .xii.
De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	Of cauterization of water descending into the wound.
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	When you have declared the beginning of water in the wound by the signs which we have said in the division, then begin and give to drink what cleanses his head, and guard it from all humidities.
E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	And let that boil in water in a pot for several days.
E aprop comanda a lu que raza le sieu cap, e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap; e aprop cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre dos templas si es le comensament de ysement de aygua en dos huels, o de la un latz si es comensamen de l’aygua en un huel.	Then command him to wash his head, and cauterize him with cautery in the middle of his head; and cauterize him with two cauteries on two temples if there is the beginning of water in two wounds, or on one side if there is the beginning of water in a wound.
Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.	Enter with cautery all the veins and vessels which are beneath the skin; and let the cauteries be as long in length as the temples are wide.
E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	Guard against blood flow when he is cauterized; and if you see from him blood flow, or stop it with some medicine, which is to you possible.
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	And come to know by experience which is in extraction of vessels and with incision of those, and guard against flow of blood.
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	And some vessels are cauterized beneath the bones at two cauteries produced by the end.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter .xiii.
De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	Of cauterization of ancient tears.
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.	When tears from the eyes are chronic and flow through the veins and arteries that are in the obvious place on the head and it is confirmed that this is caused by excessive phlegmatic humors, then cauterize with a cautery the one which we mentioned in the chapter on water entering the eyes, and with a cautery in the middle of the head and with two cauteries below the temples, and with two cauteries below the bones.
E si indigeyses de addicio, lahoras cauteriza aquel en tot latz de la coa del huel sobre la extremitat del sobrecilh am petit cauteri.	And if there is a need for more cautery, then cauterize all around the eye socket above the eyebrow with a small cautery.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter 14
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	On cauterization for nose bleeds.
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	When you treat someone with what we have said in the division and your treatment does not help, then prepare and give the patient enemas for three nights; then shave his head and cauterize the middle of his head with a small cautery made from olive oil.
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	Then cauterize the top of the nose with two cauteries above the eyebrows under the hair, a little one.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And be careful with the cautery so that you do not burn the area.
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	This is the form of the cautery made from cloves.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter 15
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	On cauterization for softening the eyelids of the eyes.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid of the eye is softened due to illness or humidity, then cauterize that eyelid with a cautery made from this lunar cautery; and this is its form:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you, cauterize that above the two eyebrows a little with two cauteries all around, and let them be extended from the temples.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	And let the length of each cautery be according to the size of the eyebrow.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	And do not press too hard with your hand on the cautery, but according to the amount that the upper part of the eyelid is adhered.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter 16
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	On cauterization for the eyelid of the eye when hairs turn to the inside and poke the eye.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the hairs of the eye turn inside and poke the eye, there are two ways to treat it: either with a cautery made from fire or with a burning medicine.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If you treat it with fire cautery, order the patient to open his eyes so that you may cut off the hairs at their roots, while they are prolonged and curling; and if he pokes his eye, then you should compress his eye with a bandage so that it is not damaged until the hairs have grown back.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	Then when they have grown back and curling, then place the patient's head in your lap, and apply a sign with ash on the eyelid of his eye with a sign, the shape of which is like that of a dead leaf; let the beginning of this sign be close to the hairs.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	Then place cotton soaked in white vinegar or in mullein tea on the eye.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	And heat the cautery, of which this is the form:
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	Then cauterize over the figure which you have marked, little by little, in small spots, until the surface of the eyelid which is like that of a myrtle leaf is completely burnt and appears properly.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	And a sign of the health of your work is that you see the eyelid of the eye already contracted and the hairs of it elevated above the puncture of the eye.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	And so elevate your hand and lay that for three days, and then place on it a poultice with a bandage until the scar is healed.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then treat that with ointment until it is healed.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	But if the hairs return for any cause and the eyelid is softened again, then do the cautery over that area again as you did first.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	But if the hairs are under the eyelid, then cauterize that area so that it is elevated to its natural place and is curling and the hairs do not poke the eye.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	But the cautery with burning medicine is that you order the patient to open his eyes so that the hairs are prolonged and curling; and then let it be made of linen the shape of a myrtle leaf.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. .i., o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	And then take of soap with aconite one ounce. [ missing text ] Take that and mix it with honey, and then make that into a poultice so that it is not too loose; and apply that on the linen which is made like a myrtle leaf, and place that on one eye or both eyes; and let the patient's head be in your lap.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	And hold the end over the medicine and press that a little and do not harm him until the patient feels the biting of the medicine, for it bites like fire.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	And when you perceive that it bites, then take away the medicine and moisten that with your finger; therefore when the biting ceases, then remove the medicine and wash the eye with water; and then consider if you see the eyelid already lifted as it is washed by fire or by incision, for then it is well; and if it returns to that of the medicine on the area where the medicine has not bitten and does not turn black until your operation is healed and the eye is contracted.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	And then place on it a poultice with a bandage until the scar of the abrasion is healed, and then treat that with ointment made from defininicum or another one until it is healed.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	And it is necessary for you that after your operation to be careful with great diligence that in the eye does not fall any of the medicine; and if the eyelid after a few days becomes softened and for some reason the hairs poke the eye, then repeat your medicine over that area which of the eyelid became softened and just as you did at the beginning, and compress it until it is healed.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	And this is the shape of the myrtle leaf.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	And know that the eyes of men are diversified according to their magnitude and smallness, therefore according to that is made your contraction.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	And do not moisten the end of the wand in water for that person to whom it is taught in this art.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter 17
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	On cauterization for a fistula that is in the tear duct of the eye.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you treat a fistula with what we have said in the divisions of illnesses and your treatment does not help, then do that you cauterize that according to this way: order the patient to place his head in your lap, and let him hold his head by someone between his hands in such a way that it is not harmed or moved with his head.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	Then place on the eye of him cotton soaked in white vinegar or in mullein tea.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	And heat the cautery, of which this is its form:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	which shall be hollow, like a straw or a feather, from one end of which the cautery is made.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if you see that it penetrates into the other end.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you want to be drawn out like a tent.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	But what is hollow is better for your work.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	And then press the fistula if it is open, and draw from it pus and dry that.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it is not open, then open it and extract the swelling of it.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	And then place on it the cautery that is well kindled, and hold your hand over the eye to prevent the patient from moving or the patient being disturbed, and then place the cautery on the grays of the eye and touch that.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	And if at the beginning of your cautery you perceive that it has entered into the bone, that is good; and if not, then repeat the cautery one or two times, if necessary; and leave it like that for three days, and then place over that spot a poultice and surround it with a dried ointment until it is healed.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	But if eleven days have passed and it has not healed, then place over it a sharp, corrosive medicine until the bone is uncovered and is scraped according to what is convenient in its chapter.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	And there is another way to do cauterization of a fistula, which they first said: enter into the location of the fistula and cover it; and then pause in that fissure a subtle caustic of which its form is made of. And pour into that the quantity of one ounce of molten lead; and hold your hand with the caustic with good retention, and do not harm the patient so that the molten lead does not reach the hole of that; and cover what you pause over the hole of the patient with a cloth soaked in vinegar or water, for the lead will adhere to the location of the fistula and heal it through marvelous healing.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	And if the fistula is healed with what we have said about cauterization and treatment, that is good; and if not, then it is necessary to administer a nasal speculum and reduce the fistula into the cavity of the nose according to what will come in its proper place.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter 18.
De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	Of cauterization of the slit of the penis.
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	Many times, slits occur in the labia, and mostly in children's labia.
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	Therefore, when you heal those slits with what we have said in the divisions and your treatment does not benefit, then light the small knife cautery according to this form that is enclosed:
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	And let its cavity be according to the subtlety of the knife.
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	Then pause that gently in those slits until the cautery reaches the bottom of the slits.
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	And then heal that with bandages until it is healed.
Capitol .xix.	Chapter 19.
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	Of cauterization of a fistula in the mouth.
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When in the root of the uvula or on the palate or on the roots of the teeth there is an ulcer and it becomes swollen, and then it is broken, and then it becomes old, and the ulcer and a fistula are made, and you heal that and your treatment does not benefit, then when you light the cautery according to the amount that is received in the fistula, and then put that lit iron into the hole of the fistula, and hold your hand so that the hot iron reaches the bottom of it, and do that one or two times; and then heal that with what we have said about treatment until it is healed.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	And therefore, if the wound is healed and healed, that is good; and if not, then it is necessary to discover the place and remove the rotten bone according to what will come in its chapter.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter 20.
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	Of cauterization of teeth and of softening of the gums.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the gums are softened by humidity and the teeth are hurt, and you heal those with medicines and they do not help, then put the head of the patient in your lap, and then light the cautery, the form of which will come here soon, so that you place the quinin over the tooth and insert into that the lit cautery quickly, and hold your hand a little so that the patient feels the heat of the fire reaching the root of the tooth.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	And then lift up your hand, and then repeat the cautery several times according to what you want.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	And then the patient should rinse his mouth with salt water and hold it for an hour, and then spit it out, because the hurt tooth is hardened and the softened gum is tightened and the corrupted humidity is dried up.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter 21.
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	Of cauterization of toothache.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When toothache is from coldness, or in it is swollen or red, or the cure with medicine does not help, then cauterization in that is according to two ways: either cauterization with cow's bile, or cauterization with fire.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	Cauterization with bile is that you take cow's bile and boil it in a iron pot, and then take the tip and wrap it in a piece of cloth, and then dip that tip in the boiled bile and place it quickly on the painful tooth so that it is made cold.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	And then repeat that several times until the virtue of the fire reaches the root of the teeth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	And if you wish, dip wool or cloth in the bile, and place that on the painful tooth, and hold the lit iron over that so that the iron reaches the bottom of the cavity of the tooth.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	But however, cauterization with fire is that you attend to the iron needle or wire, and let it have some thickness and the acuity of the fire not reach the mouth of the patient.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	And then light the cautery, and place that on the tooth and hold your hand so that the cautery is made cold; and do that several times because the pain is increased or in that day or the next day.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	And let the patient fill his mouth with good bile and hold that for an hour, and then spit it out; and this is the form of the cautery.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	And cauterize with what you want according to what is possible for you.
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	And this is the form of the needle:

De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	Of cauterization of hernia.
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	When hernia is of phlegm and cold humors and does not become hard with digestion by medicines, and you see the digestion of those lightly, then you light the cautery so that its form is as follows, having two tips so that it produces smoke from one tip while the cautery is lit from the other tip, and place that lit cautery on the hernia once, and if it does not help, do that again until it reaches the bottom of the hernia.
E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit. Capitol .xxiii.	Chapter 23.
De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	Of cauterization of voice hoarseness and of ale constriction.
Quan las humiditatz veno sobre le quanal del pulmo, e majorment quan aquo es am fregiditat de compleccio, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia evacuat al comensament am medicinas laxativas, e aprop cauteriza aquel deves la razit del golayro en le loc depremegut.
