Sia la extramitat de lu ferr triangulada, e·l fust de lu sia prim extenuat entro a la extremitat ayssi cum vezes assi.	Let the end of the rust be triangular, and its stem be first extended into the extremity just as it is.
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le os, e sia aquel prop del lacrimal; e alongua la tua ma un pauc del huel, e aprop revol la tua ma am le tribo entro que penetre tot le os, e aquel sente le malaute per asso que atroba vent yssir per so quan te la sua ma.	Then place it upon the bone, and let it be near the tear; and lengthen your hand a little from the hole, and then revolve your hand with the file inside so that it penetrates all of the bone, and the patient will feel it through his touch when air exits through him.
Donc lahoras restaura le loc am medicinas stipticas exsiccantz ayssi cum t’e eyssenhat.	Then restore the area with astringent medicines that dry up just as you have healed.
Donc cum nays la carn e·l loc es endurazit, lahoras la materia la qual effundia a las partidas deforo retorna al nas, donc aquo es pus leugier sobre le malaute.	Then when the flesh and the area are hardened, then the matter which gushed out of the orifices returns to the nose; therefore there is pus on the patient.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter 20.
De reduccio de la eminencia del huel.	On the reduction of the eminence of the hole.
Quan le huel emineys am la sua totalitat e no accideys en le vezement nocument ni diminuacio, lahoras cove que laxas le malaute, e aprop que·l segues, e aprop que pausas ventozas en le cervitz ses scarificacio e succa per bona succaccio; e aprop pausa sobre le huel liniment le qual sia fayt de acatra e aloe e enses e sarcocolla, e aprop strenh le emplaustre sobre le huel am motz polvils.	When the hole protrudes in its entirety and no harmful occurrence nor decrease happens, then you shall let the patient be at rest, and afterwards what follows: you shall place windings on his neck after scarification and suck out with good suction; and then place a liniment over the hole which is made of pitch, aloe, myrrh, and mastic, and then strengthen the bandage over the hole with powdered herbs.
E la manieyra dels polvils es que prenguas draps de li leons motz, e quascun drap sia duplicat en quatre plecs; e fay de aquels motz.	And the manner of the powders is that you take dry cloths of linen threads, and each cloth be folded into four folds; and make those into threads.
E aprop pausa aquels la un sobre le autre segon la quantitat de la qual ha le huel necessitat.	And then place those one over the other according to the quantity for which the hole has need.
E aprop strenh sobre aquels am drap dur am fort strictura; e itera las ventosas am succio ses scarificacio; e aprop osta las ventosas e leyssa le huel streyt le dia e la nueyt.	And then strengthen over those with a hard cloth and strong binding; and repeat the suction with scarification; and remove the windings and let the hole be tightly bound during the day and night.
Mays si entretant le liguament es mollificat, lahoras cove que sia mot streyt.	But if meanwhile the ligament becomes soft, then you shall let it be looser.
E aprop osta le liament aprop le dia e la nueyt ayssi cum havem dit.	And then remove the bandage during the day and night just as we have said.
E si vezes le huel ja esser redusit, bo es, e sino, lahoras itera le emplastre am les polvils e la strictura e las ventosas entro que sia sanat.	And if you see that the hole has already been reduced, good; and if not, then repeat the bandage with powders and binding and windings until it is healed.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter 21.
De la inscizio de la eminencia de la tunica uvea.	On the beginning of the eminence of the venous membrane.
Quan endeve disrupcio en la tunica uvea, e aprop es eminent e procezeys fora las palpebras ayssi cum un gra de rasim, e es orrazada la forma de home per aquo, e vols aquo inscidir, lahoras la operacio en lu es ayssi cum havem recomtat, que tu entrometas la agula en la razitz de la uvea de la partida dejos en la partida desus, e aprop met la agula autra en la qual sia fil doble de la part del lacrimal, e fay aquela penetrar e leyssa la primieyra agula segon la sua disposicio; e aprop inscideys le loc del fiel doble e leva am aquel la partida de la uvea en le circuit de la agula, e strenh aquela mot.	When a disruption occurs in the venous membrane, and it is prominent and protrudes out of the eyelids just like a grain of sand, and assumes the shape of a man through that, and wants to enter into it, then the operation upon it is just as we have recommended: you shall introduce the needle into the root of the vein at the part below, and then place another needle in which there is a double thread from the part of the tear, and make that penetrate and let the first needle be according to its disposition; and then insert the hole of the double thread and lift with it the part of the vein in the circuit of the needle, and tighten that thread.
E aprop extratz la agula e pausa sobre le huel lana infusa en album de huou e leyssa entro que cayha le fil am la uva.	And then withdraw the needle and place over the hole wool infused in white vinegar and let it be until the thread falls with the vein.
E aprop cura le huel am aquo que conforte aquel entro que la plagua sia sanada.	And then cure the hole with that which comforts it until the wound is healed.
E alcunas veguadas aduna de tota partida am cercle de drap entro le huel ajuste eminencia gran, e aprop sia perforat am le spatum subtil que vengua al preon del huel, e corra la humiditat albuginea, e descen le huel e intra tantost.	And sometimes gather from all parts with a circular cloth around the hole where there is great eminence, and let it be penetrated by the spatulate instrument that comes to the root of the hole, and run the white moisture, and descend the hole and in the meantime.
E aprop strenh entro que sia sanat.	And then strengthen until it is healed.
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter 22.
De curacio de alconati.	On the cure of hawks.
Aquesta malautia que es apelada alconati no es sino sania la qual es ajustada en le huel semblant a aygua dessendent e no es aquela.	This sickness which is called alconati is nothing other than putridity which is adjusted in the hole similar to water and is not that.
Mays la manieyra del obrar en ela es que fasses le malaute sezer sobre la sela aparelada e dreyta, e aprop pren le cap sieu en las tuas mas de doas partz e mau aquel entro que veias la sania pervenir a las partidas dejos, e aprop sia siccada e no descenda, e sia ostat le lum, e·l malaute veia las causas ayssi cum vezia.	But the manner of acting upon it is that you make the patient sit on the seat prepared and straightened, and then take his head in your hands from both parts and hold him so that you see the putridity coming to the parts below, and let it be dried up and not descending, and let the light be blocked, and the patient will see the causes just as he saw them.
E si no descendra en jos, sapias que es aygua.	And if it does not descend below, you shall know that it is water.
Mays si no es preparat le descendement a la sania am aquo que havem dit, lahoras fay le malaute sezer entre las tuas mas e aprop pren spatum subtil e fen am aquel sobre le pannicol cernent un petit deves la continuacio de la conjunctiva am la tunica cornea en la corona (entro al loc vuet), entro que sia fora-getada la sania.	But if the descent of the putridity is not prepared with that which we have said, then make the patient sit between your hands and then take a spatulate instrument and press it upon him over the membrane covering a small part in the continuation of the conjunctiva with the venous membrane in the corona (within the hole), until the putridity is expelled.
Donc cum es fora-getada, lahoras tu distilla en le huel aygua cauda en la qual has mesclat mel o aygua en la qual ja has bulit fenugrec e mel.	Then when it is expelled, then you distill into the hole water mixed with honey in which you have steeped fenugreek and honey.
E aprop sia curat am las autras causas entro que sia sanat.	And then let it be cured by the other causes until it is healed.
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter 23.
De la curacio de la aygua descendent del huel.	On the cure of water descending from the hole.
Ja havem dit las specias de la aygua en la divisio e qual conveneys a perforar am sermo declarant, lahoras aquel segon la sanetat.	We have already said the spices of the water in the division and what agrees to penetrate with serum according to the health.
Lahoras cove que tu fassas sezer le malaute entre las tuas mas sobre un cayrat e lia le sieu huel sa, lu mot stringent.	Then you shall make the patient sit between your hands over a cowl and let him incline his hole down, he tightening it.
E aprop pausa prop de la palpebra del sieu huel la tua ma senestra, si le huel en le qual es l’aygua es le huel senestra; o am la tua ma dreyta, si le huel es le dextre.	And then place your left hand near the eyelid of his hole, if the hole in which there is water is the left one; or with your right hand, if it is the right one.
E aprop am la tua ma dextra pren almagda, si le huel es senestre; o am la tua ma senestra, si le huel es de dreyt.	And then with your right hand take almonds, if the hole is left; or with your left hand, if it is right.
E aprop pausa la extremitat de almagda prop de la corona per la grossesa del ray en le album del huel de part del mendre lacrimal, e aprop enpelleys almagda am vertut e revol la tua ma am aquel.	And then place the end of almonds near the corona by the thickness of the vein in the white of the hole from the part of the tear, and press almonds with force and revolve your hand with it.
E aprop penetre en le album del huel e sentas que almagda ja es pervenguda a causa vueda.	And then penetrate into the white of the hole and feel that almonds have already come to a seen cause.
E cove que sia la masura del cami de almagda al preon la mesura del spazi le qual es de la pupilla entro a la fi de la negror, e es la corona del huel; quar tu veyras am aquel pupilla am la visio de l’huel per la clartat de la tunica cornea.	And let the measure of the path of almonds to the root be the measure of the space which is from the pupil to the end of the blackness, and is the corona of the hole; for you shall see with it the pupil through the clarity of the venous membrane.
E aprop pausa almagda entro al loc en le qual es l’aygua, e aprop tu la atira en jos una veguada aprop autra, e donc si la aygua descen tantost, lahoras vetz le malaute aquo sobre le qual huebre la sua vista tantost, e almagda en le sieu huel.	And then place almonds within the hole where there is water, and then you shall draw it down a little, and therefore if the water descends immediately, then you shall see the patient over which he breaks his sight immediately, and almonds in his hole.
E aprop repausa se un pauc; donc si la aygua es descenduda, lahoras tu depausa aquela autre veguada abantz que almagda ne sia getada.	And then rest a little; therefore if the water is descended, then you shall draw it down again before almonds are pressed.
E donc quan es sicada e no descen, lahoras tu extrat almagda am facilitat, e revol am aquel la tua ma pauc a pauc, e aprop dissolveys en l’aygua un petit de sal clara de gemma e am aquela lava le huel dedintz; e aprop pausa fora le huel coto o stopa o lana infusa en oli rozat e album de huou e ligua am aquo le huel sa.	And then when it is dried up and not descending, then you shall withdraw almonds with ease, and revolve your hand a little at a time over it; and then dissolve in the water a little of fine salt of jewels and wash the hole within; and then place outside the hole cotton or felt infused in rose oil and vinegar with honey on it.
Mays nos e aquels que so de nostre temps pause sobre aquel comi trissat am album de huou.	But we and those who are of our time shall pause over that come fried in white vinegar.
E si no obezeys a tu almagda al intrament de l’huel per la sua duricia — quar es alcu dels homes del qual le huel es dur mot —, lahoras cove que prenguas le spatum le qual es nompnat alberid del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if it does not obey you with almonds at the instrument of the hole because of its hardness — for it is hard in some men — then you shall take the spatulate instrument which is called albertite, of which this is the form:
E donc perfora am aquel aquela conjunctura, e no ultimes la tua ma en le trauc, e no es si no que fassas via ad almagda loc subtil.	And then pierce that joint, and do not finish your hand in the wound, but only to make way for a subtle place.
E aprop entromet almagda segon que havem dit.	Then apply the salve as we have said.
E deves le compliment de la tua obra, sia preparat al malaute dormitori descentment fayt en le qual dorma sobre le sieu dos en mayson tenebrosa, e sia prohibit de totz movementz .	And when you have finished your work, prepare the patient's bedroom in a darkened room where he sleeps on his back with all movements prohibited.
E pausa en la natura de lu aquo per que sia linida la sua natura, e no maugua le sieu cap a la partida dreyta ni senestra de tot.	And put in the nature of him that which makes the nature of his body smooth, and do not harm his head on either the right or left side at all.
E sia le liament segon la sua disposicio entro al tertz dia.	And the bandages should be according to his disposition within the third day.
E aprop deslia aquel en aquela maysso tenebrosa e exproha la freol vista, e fay li vezer alcunas causas, e aprop retorna le liament entro al dia .vii.	And then release him from that darkened room and show him the free light, and let him see some causes, and then return the bandages within seven days.
E no cove que fassas aquo en la hora de las curacios o tantost aprop la infusio.	And don't forget to do this at the time of the cure or immediately after the infusion.
Habantz cove que tu alienes aquo per so quar la aygua puega leugierament per gran e vehement de reguardament.	Have someone move that so that the water can easily and gently flow through it.
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras cove que deslias le huel denant le vii dia, e rectifica aquel am aquo que ceda apostema.	But if pus occurs, then remove the bandages on the seventh day, and correct that with something that reduces pus.
Lahoras tu absol la vista de lu e pausa sobre la cara de lu oral per le qual sia regit le vezement de lu dejos lu per alcus dias, lu existent en la mayszo tenebrosa.	Then you open his vision and place on his face an oral orifice through which he breathes so that he is regulated for several days in the darkened room.
E aprop sia gitat de aquela mayzo gradantment e conversa8 en las suas causas.	And then let him walk gradually and converse about his causes.
E sapias que in alchatea no es excusat le discipol de visio alcunas veguadas, e lahoras tu sias ardit sobre la operacio.	And know that in some cases the disciple of vision is not excused from seeing some sights, and then you are eager about the operation.
E ja es pervengut a nos de alcu de aquels les quals so al Artach , e alcu disse que fayt foc en al Ayrac magdaam perforat am le qual es succada la aygua.	And now it has come to us from some of those who are in the Artach, and one said that there was fire in Ayrac when a woman's eye was pierced and water was sucked out.
Mays empero yeu non e vist degu en la nostra terra le qual haia perfeyt aquo, ni e aquo legit en alcu dels libres dels antics; e es possible que aquo sia novel.	But indeed I have not seen it in our land, nor have I read about it in any of the ancient books; and it is possible that this is new.
E aquestas so las formas de las specias de magdaan per que sia sobre aquelas aquel le qual ignora aquelas:	And these are the forms of the species of women so that it is over those on which he ignores:
E sian faytas de eram o de ferr propriament, e sian las extramitatz de lor am aquesta subtilitat triangulada, la extremitat aguda ayssi cum aquela es la forma.	And they are made of gold or iron properly, and their extremities are with this triangular subtlety, the acute extremity like that is the shape.
Capitol .xxiv.	Chapter .XXIV.
De la curacio de carn nada en le nas.	Of the cure of a nosebleed.
Quan en le nas so nascudas carns diversas ajustadas de las quals es alcuna causa la qual es assemblada a scorpio de motz pes, o a polip peys; e aquesta malautia es apelada polipus quar es a semblansa de aquel peys representat.	When in the nose there are various growing meats which is some cause that is assembled to scorpion of words, or to polyps; and this disease is called polyps because it is like that pee represented.
E de lu es carn cancrosa, lapadea, de fusca color; e de lu es que es carn leon no de color fusca.	And it is cancers of meat, lumpy, of dusky color; and it is that there is no lions' meat of dusky color.
Donc en aquela que es en aquestas carns leon no fraudulenta ni cancroza, cove que fassas le malaute sezer entre las tuas mas e posat al solelh, e huebre las nars de lu, e picoys le tieu onci en aquelas carns.	Therefore in that which is in these meats of lions not fraudulent or cancerous, you should make the patient sit between your hands and expose to the sun, and open his nose, and pick the meat with your finger into those meats.
E aprop extrat aquela a las partidas deforo, e aprop inscindeys aquo que has comprehendut de aquelas am spatum agut subtil de la una partida entro que sapias que tota la carn ja es ostada; que si roman de lu deguna causa de la qual la abscisio es possibla, lahoras tu ratz aquo am la un dels estrumentz subtils am facilitat entro que de lu romangua denguna causa.	And then extract that to the parts of a hole, and then light it with what you have understood from those by sharp spatum of one part within which you know that all the meat is already torn out; for if he bleeds from it any cause for which the abscision is possible, then you rate it with one of the subtle instruments with ease within so that he does not bleed any cause.
Mays si senhoreja am sanc o accida apostema caut, lahoras tu pausa a lu aquo que cove; o es dels apostemas malignes, lahoras tu coyta e cauteriza aquel entro que sia abscindit sanc e sian ostadas las cavas totas.	But if it bleeds or occurs pus, then you place in him what you should; or it is of malignant pustules, then you cut and cauterize that within so that bleeding has stopped and all the holes are closed.
E aprop sia getatz en le nas aprop la inscizio vi agre e aygua o vi.	And then let there be placed in his nose properly vinegar and water or wine.
Mays si le nas es ubert e de lu procezeys humiditat entro al palat, lahoras sapias que ja es sanat.	But if the nose is open and from it processes humidity within the palate, then you know that he has healed.
Mays si la humiditat no penetra segon que cove, lahoras tu sapias que dedintz lu es carn nada en los pus sobiras osses de las nars als quals non es pervengut abscizio.	But if the humidity does not penetrate according to that, then you know that within him is meat growing in the nose, the bones of which are not come off.
Donc lahoras cove que entromitas fiel de li al qual sia alcuna grosseza, e nuza en lu motz nuzes, e pausa entre quascun nutz la quantitat del dit o mens, e engene le malaute e entromet una extremitat del fiel en le nars am lo ray o am autra causa la qual es a lu possibla.	Therefore then you should put the gall of the chicken in which there is any thickness, and insert it into his nose words, nuts of the words, and place between each nut the quantity of a pea or less, and insert the patient's finger and put one end of the gall in the nose with the thumb or another cause that is possible for him.
E pus que aquo aura fayt, que atire le sieu odorament entro que pervengua a las canals de las nars, e sia eyssit sobre le sieu golayro, quar tropas veguadas le semblant ad aquesta accio fan les enfantz a las scolas, e es leugiera causa ad aquel que ho vol far.	And then after that is done, that he breathe his odorant into the passages of the nose, and let it sit on his gullet, for troops of sight make children in schools, and it is a light cause to him who wants to do so.
E aprop pausa las dos extramitatz del fiel, una extremitat que iesca sobre le nas et l’autra que romangua en le nas, e aprop aministra serratura de carn am les nuzes que so en le fiel, e fay aquo entro que sapias que las carn ja so am les nuzes del fiel.	And then place the two extremities of the gall, one end that hangs over the nose and the other that pierces into the nose, and then administer meat with the nuts that are in the gall, and do this until you know that the meats already are on the nuts of the gall.
E aprop extratz le fiel, e pausa en le nas aprop la abstraccio del sanc una calgua , e fay aquo per tres dias o mays entro que l’enguent corrodo tot aquo que es romas de las carns.	And then pull out the gall, and place in the nose properly an abstraction of blood a lump, and do this for three days or more until the meat has run off from the meats.
E aprop en la fi de la causa, pausa en le nas una canula de plom per alscus jorns entro que sia sanat.	And then at the end of the cause, place in the nose a cannula of lead for several days until it is healed.
Mays si endigeys de curacio que exsique, usa de aquela.	But if you see that there is no healing from the cure, use that.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument a capipurge fazedor am le qual son distillatz olis e medicinas en le nars:	And this is the form of the instrument to cleanse with which are distilled oils and medicines in the nose:
E fay aquo de argent o de eram, la qual sia semblant a una petita lampesa uberta, ayssi cum petita conqua, e le meat semblantment.	And do this of silver or gold, which is like a small open vase, like a little cone, and the meat similarly.
E si vols, fay una canula clausa ayssi cum cana, e la cancula del estrument a capipurge fazedor e sia plana, descuberta; a la qual sia manubre en lo derier de lu, am le qual tenguas aquela quan escaufas en lu oli o aquo que tu vols dels sucs e de las causas suctiblas.	And if you want, make a closed cannula like a reed, and the cannula of the instrument to cleanse is flat, uncovered; with which you handle in his behind, with which you have that when heated in him oils or water that you want from the sucks and the causes suctionable.
E aquestz capipurgi es precios: recipe de enforbi de castor, de balayra blanc, de giengiebre, e piletre de safra, de pebre lonc, de escafragia, de epetum de spic ana unc. vi cumfizeys am suc de bleda e de caul, e sian faytas pillulas, e sia destemprada una pillula am aygua tebeza, e sia gitat en las nars del malaute jasent envers.	And these cleanses are precious: take of beaver' s testicles, of white vipers, of ginger, and pepper long, of saffron, of galingale, of spikenard, of aniseed, and one ounce of frankincense. You mix with honey and juice of bloodwort and of cauld, and the pills are made, and a pill is tempered with water tepid, and let it be inserted in the nose of the patient lying on his back.
Capitol .xxv.	Chapter .XXV.
De theyls natz en las extramitatz del nas.	Of the thills in the extremities of the nose.
Motas veguadas es nat theyl en las extramitatz del nas, e es magnificat e omentat en alscus dias entro en que mot es leg le reguardament de lu.	Many times there is pain in the extremities of the nose, and it is magnified and swollen for several days until it is taken off the guard of him.
E per aquo cove que tu inscidas aquel en le comensament de la apparissio de lu, e erediques tot aquel.	And then you should insert that in the beginning of his appearance, and you remove all that.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc o cauteri o medicina comburent la qual estia en loc de lu.	And then place over the place a cautery or burning medicine which is in the location of him.
Mays si es tardada la sua inscizio entro que sia magnificat, lahoras considera si es lapificat, dur, de fusca color e de pauc sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel am ferr quar es apostema crancos; quar motas veguadas ad aquel que inscideys aquesta apostema endeve per lu granda malicia sobre aquel le qual aquel havia.	But if its abscission is delayed so that it is magnified, then consider if it is lappified, hard, of dusky color and of little sentiment, then do not touch it with iron which is pustule cranios; for many times when you insert this pustule for him great malice over that from whom he had.
E si le apostema es de leon tocament e no es de fosca color, e vezes que inscizio es possibla en tot aquel, lahoras evacua le malaute e inscideys aquel senes temor, e cura le loc am aquo que exsique e costrenh entro que sia sanat.	And if the pustule is of meat touch and not of dusky color, and it is possible that abscission in all that, then evacuate the patient and insert that senseless, and bind the location with what bleeds and tightens so that it is healed.
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter .XXVI.
De sutura del nas e de las labias e de la aurelha quan la continuitat es dissolvuda per plagua o per semblantz.	Of the sewing of the nose and of the lips and of the auricle when the continuity is dissolved by water or similarly.
Sapias que quan accideys solucio de continuitat en una de aquestas cartillages, pauc confereys en aquela operacio sino en alcus homes.	You know that when there occurs solution of continuity in one of these cartilage, few confer in that operation but in some men.
Donc cove, quan endeve ad alcu alcuna causa de aquelas, que consideres si es plagua fresca am le sieu sanc, e lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Thus, when for any reason at all you see a fresh wound with its blood, then you stitch together the two lips of the wound and then heal that part which is inside.
E si las labias de solucio de continuitat so ja separadas, e quascuna es fayta sana, lahoras cove que tu excorjes quascuna partida de la sua codena apparent entro que n’iesca sanc.	And if the lips of a wound that is already separated are both healed, then you must open up each part of its flesh so that blood can come out.
E aprop ajusta las doas labias am sutura e strenh aquelas, e sobre aquelas pulveriza sanc de drago e enses trissat, e pausa sobre la polvera una pessa de emplaustra diafinicon, o de alcu autre dels emplastres consolidatius, e leyssa aquel liat per dos jorns o per tres, e aprop deslia aquel e permuta aquel emplaustre e leyssa aquel entro que·ls fiels per si sian abscinditz, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then stitch together the two lips with a thread and strengthen them, then powder the wound with dragon's blood and cut up herbs, and place on this powder an ointment called diafinicon or another of the consolidating ointments, and let it remain there for two or three days, and then remove this ointment and change the ointment and leave it there until the wounds are healed by themselves, and then heal them with an ointment.
Mays la manieyra de la sutura es que tu agregues la solucio de continuitat o am agulhas ayssi cum havem recomtat en la sutura del ventre, o agregua la solucio de continuitat am fiel ayssi cum a tu e fayt saber.	But the way of stitching is to join together the cut or with a needle as we have recommended in the stitching of the belly, or join the cut with fat just as you and your father have done and make it known.
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter 27.
De extraccio de aquela causas que veno en las doas labias en las partidas dedintz.	Of the extraction of those causes that come from both lips in the parts within.
Motas veguadas endeve a motz homes en las partidas dedintz de las suas labias alcus apostemas durs semblantz a gras de errs, e alscunas de lors son mendres e alcunas son majors.	Many times we see in many men in the parts within their lips some hard growths similar to grainy err-like growths, and some of them are smaller while others are larger.
Donc cove que tu convertas las labias e fendas quascuna de aquelas duricias de tota part, e aprop la abscizio umpliscas le loc de sagi trissat entro que·l sanc sia restrengut, e aprop sia lavat am vi agre e sia curat le loc am aquo que es stipticitat, entro que sia sanat.	Thus you should turn the lips inside out and cut each of those hard growths from every part, and then stop the bleeding by filling the wound with cut sage, and wash it with wine and heal the place with something astringent until it is healed.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter 28.
De inscizio de la carn ajustada en las gengivas.	Of incision of the flesh attached to the gums.
Granre de veguadas nays sobre la gengiva carn ajustada la qual les antics apelero albulus, adonc cove que tu suspendas aquela am onci o que tenguas aquela am las forfecs e inscidas aquela deves la sua razit, e leyssas la sania correr o le sanc.	Many times there is on the gum a growth of flesh which the ancients called albulus, therefore you should suspend it with tweezers or forceps and cut off that growth at its root, and let the pus run out or the blood flow.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc sagi trissat o autra polveras stipticas o excicativas.	And then place on the wound cut sage or other astringent or drying powders.
E si aquela carn retorna, lahoras inscideys aquela segundariament, e cauterisa aquela, quar aprop le cauteri no retornara.	And if that flesh returns, then cut it off again and cauterize it, for by cauterizing it will not return.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter 29.
De razo de dentz am ferr.	Of extraction of teeth with forceps.
Quan en la superficia de las dentz de las partidas dedintz e de las de foro e entre las gingivas so ajustadas escorsas aspras, legas, e alcunas veguadas son de nigradas e son faytas citrinas o vertz entro que a la gingiva ve per aquo corrupcio e son faytas las dentz legas.	When on the surface of the teeth in the parts within the gums and between the gums are rough, hard sores, some of which are blackened and are made yellow or green by corruption and the teeth become bound.
E donc cove que tu fassas sezer le malaute entre las tuas mas e pausar le cap de lu en le tieu se, e ratz las dents en las quals apareysso aquelas escorsas e causas semblantz arena entro que de lor no romangua deguna causa, e aquo fay de la negror e de la citrinitat e de las autras entro que sian mondificadas.	And so you should force the patient to open his mouth and place his head in your lap, and cut the teeth where those sores appear, and get rid of the causes that appear like sand so that no cause remains hidden within them, and this will be done for the blackness and the yellowing and the others so that they are cleansed.
Donc si es ostat aquo que es en aquelas del comensament de la razio, bo es; e sino, lahoras tu itera la razio sobre aquelas al autra dia e al segon e al tertz entro que vengua al derier stament en aquo que tu vols.	And so if this is done at the beginning of the cause, that is good; and if not, then you should repeat the cause over them on another day and on the second and third until it comes to the final state that you want.
E sapias que las dentz han necessitat de motz rezoris de diversas formas e de motas figuras segon que es preparat a la tua operacio.	And know that teeth have a need for many pliers of various shapes and figures according to how they are prepared for your operation.
E per so quar le razori am le qual la dent es raza de la partida dedintz es autre del razori am le qual es ras entre las dentz segon autras formas, e aquestas formas de razoris sian deves tu preparadas las quals veyras tantost:	And so the pliers with which the tooth is cut from its root is another than that with which it is cut between the teeth according to other forms, and these forms of pliers should be prepared by you as soon as you see them:
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter 30.
D’eradicacio de dentz.	Of extraction of teeth.
Cove que tu cures la dent de la sua dolor am tot engen e tardes en tota eradicacio de lu, quar no es denguna causa que suplisqua la veguada de lu quan es eradicada, quar es sustancia sublima entro que es excusacio en la eradicacio de lu.	You who should cure the tooth of its pain with every effort and delay in total extraction of it, for there is no cause that exceeds its appearance when it is extracted, for it is a sublime substance that is an obstacle to extraction.
Mays cove quan le malaute es forsat aquela dent eradicar, que fermament deves tu sia certificat quala es la dent dolent, quar motas veguadas la dolor descep le malaute e cuga que sia en dent sana, e tu eradicas aquela e aprop la dolor no cessa entro que la dent malauta e dolent sia eradicada, quar nos ja havem vist aquo per operacio dels barbies.	But when the patient is forced to have that tooth extracted, then you must be certain which is the aching tooth, for often the pain deceives the patient and seems to be in a healthy tooth, and you extract that one and the pain does not cease until the aching and ill tooth is extracted, for we have seen this by the operation of barbers.
Donc cum deves tu es sertificat qual es la dent dolent, e que o sabes be, lahoras cove que tu scarifiques en le circuit de la dent am spatum en le qual sia alcuna vertut, entro que sia dissolvut de la dent de la gingiva de tota partida, e aprop mau aquel am les tieus ditz, o am forfexs subtils al comensament petit a petit entro que aquela concucesquas.	So when you are certain which is the aching tooth, and you know it well, then you should scarify all around the tooth with a spatula in which there is some medicine, so that it is dissolved from the gum all around, and then pull it with your fingers or with thin forceps little by little until you loosen it.
E aprop alogua en lu fortz tenalhas grans per bona loquacio o estuptura fort, e pausa le cap del malaute entre les tieus denolhs que be le tengues que no·s maugua, e aprop tratz la dent segon rectitut en manieyra que no trenques aquela, ni al malaute major dolor no dones.	And then hold it firmly with strong fingers or a strong grip, and place the head of the patient between your knees so that he does not move his head, and then pull the tooth according to the straightest way without breaking it, nor giving great pain to the patient.
E donc si no es foro-getat, lahoras pren un de aquels instrumentz, e met aquel dejos lu de tota part am facilitat e esforsa la remocio de lu ayssi que es feyt al comensament.	And so if it is not loose, then take one of those instruments and put it under it from every side with ease and force the removal of it just as it was done at the beginning.
Mays si la dent es trauquada o corrosa, lahoras cove que tu comples de drap aquel trauc e estrenguas aquel am la extremitat de ray subtil per so que no sia trinquada en la hora de la tua constriccio sobre aquela am tenalas.	But if the tooth is split or hollowed out, then you should fill that crack with cloth and tighten it with the tip of a subtle needle so that it is not cracked when you constrict it with your fingers.
E cove que tu obres exquesitament am scarificacio en le circuit de tota part de la gingiva e guarda mot la tua fortaleza que no trenques aquela e romangua partida de lu, e retorne sobre le malaute per la malicia que sia majo que la primieyra dolor de lu.	And you should open completely with scarification all around the gum and guard your strength so that you do not crack it or tear a part of it, and return to the patient because of the malice so that his first pain is minor.
E guarda te que no fassas aquo que fan alscus ignorantz barbiers en lor fistinacio e audacia sobre la eradicacio de lor, ses que no aministran aquo que nos havem recomtat; quar motas veguadas fan venir sobre les homes malautias grans las quals son pus dificils que sian trinquadas, e las razitz de lor remaugudas totas, o alcunas de aquelas, o que extrayguas aquela am alcus osses de la mandigula ayssi cum motas veguadas havem testificat.	And take care that you do not do what some ignorant barbers do in their foolishness and audacity in extraction of them, for they do not administer what we have recommended; for often they bring upon men great diseases which are difficult to cure because they crack them or pull out bones from the jaw just as we have often testified.
E aprop la eradicacio de lu sia lavada la boca am vi caut o vi agre am sal.	And then the extraction of it should be washed with wine or wine vinegar and salt.
E si endeve fluxs de sanc per aysso, ayssi cum motas veguadas endeve, lahoras trissa alcuna quantitat de zegi e aspergeys sobre la plagua, e si no confereys aquel zegi, cauteriza.	And if then it bleeds through that, then take some quantity of pyrite and spread it over the wound, and if it does not agree with that pyrite, cauterize.
La forma de las forceps e tenalas subtils am las quals es mauguda la dent al comensament sia de longua extramitat, de breu manubre e gros, per so que no sian doblatz quan am aquels deves obrar.	The form of the pliers and tweezers with which you have cut the tooth at the beginning should be of long length, short handle, and thick, so that they are not bent when you operate with them.
E sian ayssi cum vezes de gros manubre entro que quan estrenhas am aquelas no sian dobladas, sian breus extramitatz.	And they should be as thick as a finger's length so that when you tighten them they are not bent, and they should have short handles.
E sian faytas de ferr de India descentment faytas de dreytas extramitatz, e en las extramitatz de aquelas sian dentz de las quals las unas intron en las autras e estrenhan per constriccio descent fort, e alscunas veguadas las extramitatz de aquelas sian la forma del bec d’un auzel le qual ha nom ciconia, so es guanta, e son de fort constriccio.	And they should be made of Indian iron wrought with hammer and chisel, and in the tips of them there are teeth which some enter into others and tighten with great constriction, and sometimes the tips of those are shaped like the beak of an owl which is hooked, and it is strong.
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter 31.
De erradicacio de dentz e d‘estraccio dels osses de las mandibulas trincadas.	Of extraction of teeth and pulling out of the bones from the jaws that are cracked.
Quan deves la eradicacio de dent le qual es trinquat roman alcuna causa, lahoras cove que tu pauses sobre le loc coto am boder per un jorn o per dos entro que·l loc sia mollificat; e aprop entromet algesti o tenalhas las extramitatz de las quals so asembladas al bec de un auzel apelat ciconia o guanta, la forma de las forceps:	When you should extract the tooth which is cracked for some cause, then you should place over the site a poultice for a day or two until it softens; and then insert a hook or tweezers in its tips which are joined together like the beak of an owl called ciconia or hooked, the form of the pliers:
Las extramitatz de lor sian faytas dedintz ayssi cum lima o alfagi.	Their tips should be made inside with a file or chisel.
E si no obediys a tu a eyssiment am aquestas forceps o tenalas, lahoras cove que tu caves sobre la razit e descrobas tota la carn e entrometas le instrument le qual ha nom atali, so es palanca petita del qual la forma es aquesta:	And if you do not listen to me and use these forceps or tongs, then you will need to cut into the root and remove all of the flesh and insert the instrument called an awl. This is a small lever whose shape is as follows:
E sia de breu extremitat grossa un petit, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	And it should have a blunt end that is slightly thick, and not be bent so that it does not break.
Donc si per aquo la razit es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, ajuda te am aquestz autres instrument dels quals aquestas son las formas: la forma del primier instrument es de triangulada extramitat en la qual sia alcuna grossesa:	Therefore if through this the root is perforated, it is good; and if not, assist yourself with these other instruments of which these are the shapes: the shape of the first instrument is triangular at its end in which there should be some thickness:
La forma del segon instrument es que sia de triangulada e de pus subtil extremitat.	The shape of the second instrument is that it should have a triangular and very thin end.
E ja so ajudatz am aquest instrument havent dos ramps del qual aquesta es la forma aprop la seguent:	And you are already assisted with this instrument which has two claws, whose shape is as follows:
e am autres instrumentz les quals precidero en rasura de dentz; quar juvament es fayt am aquest instrument le qual es asemblat a onci gran, e aquesta es la forma:	and with other instruments which are used in tooth extraction; for it is done with this instrument which resembles a large needle, and this is its shape:
de la triangulada extremitat torta o curta, la qual sia alcuna grossesa, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	of the triangular bent or short end, which should have some thickness, and not be bent so that it does not break.
E otra sapias que·ls instrumentz de las dentz motz so e semblantment les autres instruments.	And another thing: the instruments for removing teeth are similar to other instruments.
Mays le artifexs savi e subtil en l’art, atroba per si mateys segon aquo que a lu significa la operacio e las malautias diversas; quar son de las malautias a las quals les antics no diysero ni pausero propri instrument, per las formas de diversas specias.	But the wise and skilled artist in this art finds for himself methods according to what the operation and various illnesses indicate to him; for there are diverse illnesses to which the ancients did not attribute nor assign a specific instrument because of their varied forms.
Mays si es trinquat l’os de la mandibula o dels autres osses de la boca, o si poyreys, lahoras sia pes curat sobre aquel en son loc am aquo que es a lu convenient dels instrumentz e de las forceps las quals havem dit en la extraccio de las razitz de las dentz, e ajuda te am gesti del qual aquesta es la forma:	But if the jawbone or other bones in the mouth are broken, or if there is pain, then it is fitting that the foot should be cured in its place with whatever of the instruments and tongs we have mentioned for tooth extraction, and assist yourself with a gesture whose shape is as follows:
E sia en lu alcuna grosseza petit a petit, e sia instringida o tenguda am la boca per que no evasesca o fuga entro que l’os de tot sia foro-getat; e aprop restaura le loc am medicinas convenientz ad aquo.	And there should be some thickness added to it little by little, and it should be pressed or held in the mouth so that it does not escape or leak out until all of the bone is perforated; then restore the area with appropriate medicines.
Mays si en l’os es petita poyredura, lahoras ratz aquel de aquela poyredura e de la sua negror, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But if there is a small wound in the bone, then scrape away the wound and its blackness, and cure it until it is healed.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter .xxxii.
De la cura de las dentz eminentz sobre las autras.	Of the curing of teeth that protrude above the others.
Quan las dentz so eminentz no segon lor cors natural per aquelas la forma es laga, e majorment quan endeve a las femnas, e majorment a las piuselas venerablas; donc cove que tu consideras: si dent es nada aprop autra dent, e no es possibla sarradura ni linament de lu, lahoras radica aquela; mays que no sia annexa am autra dent, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am aquest instrument del qual aquesta es la forma; e es semblant a morr de porc, e sia feyt de ferr de India de extramitat mot aguda.	When teeth are prominent not according to their natural form, especially when it happens in women and especially in elderly women, then you should consider: if the tooth is next to another tooth and it is not possible for there to be a hole or groove made in it, then extract that tooth; but if it is attached to another tooth, then insert that with this instrument whose shape is as follows; it is similar to a pig's jaw, and it should be made of Indian iron with an acute end.
E sia la tua inscizio am la qual inscideyses aquela en trops dias per la duricia de la dent, e que no sia comauguda autra de las dentz.	And your incision should be with which you insert that into it for several days because of the hardness of the tooth, and that it does not affect any of the other teeth.
E si es dent eminent expausat a limadura, lahoras lima aquel am lima de ferr de India del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if there is a prominent tooth that has been sharpened, then file it with an Indian-iron file whose shape is as follows:
E sia tot de ferr de India e·l margua eysament; e sia de motz menutz puntz ayssi cum lima am la qual son faytas agulhas, am la qual la dent sia limada pauc a pauc en motz dias am fecilitat, per so que no sia autra dent comauguda e caga.	And it should all be made of Indian iron and the edge should be even; and it should have very fine points like a file with which needles are made, with which the tooth is filed little by little over several days with ease, so that no other tooth is affected or breaks.
E aprop lineys aquela en la fi, e ratz aquela am alscus razoris.	Then smooth it in the end, and scrape away at that with a razor-sharp knife.
E si es dent del qual una partida es trinquada e lideys la lengua, lahoras cove que tu limescas aquel entro que l’aspretat de aquela fraccio sia ostada e engualhada, e sia aplenada per so que la lengua no ledesca ni la paraula no corrumpa.	And if there is a tooth of which one part is broken and it hurts the tongue, then you should smooth that until the sharpness of that fracture is blunted and smoothed out, so that the tongue is not hurt or speech impaired.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter .xxxiii.
De restauracio de dentz maugudas am fiel de aur o de argent.	Of the restoration of broken teeth with gold or silver.
Quan accideys a las dentz devant concussio e remossio per percussio o per cazament, e le malaute no pot strenher sobre aquo que manga, e tu has curat aquel am medicinas stipticas, e no ha valgut la tua curacio, lahoras per so que no cagan es engen en aquelas que sian strengudas am fiel de aur e no de argent, quar argent se fa vert e aprop se poyreys aprop alscus dias, mays aur nul temps no es mudat.	When it happens to teeth that they receive concussion and removal due to impact or being knocked out, and the patient is unable to hold down food, and your cure with astringent medicines has not helped, then so that they do not become rotten there should be made in those that are strengthened with gold and not silver; for silver becomes black and then rots after a few days, but gold never changes color.
E sia le fiel en tal subtilitat e grocesa segon la quantitat que puesca entrar entre las dentz; e la forma de la reccio es que prenguas le fiel e pren lo doble de lu entre doas dentz sanas, e aprop que cresques am doas tortuositatz del fiel entre doas maugudas, o si’ una o motas, entro que pervengua la tela a la dent sana del autra partida.	And the gold should be in such thinness and thickness according to the amount that can enter between the teeth; and the shape of the filling is that you take the gold and place twice as much between two healthy teeth, and then that it grows with two curves of the gold between two broken ones, or if one or several, so that the fabric comes to the healthy tooth on the other side.
E aprop itera le teyssiment entro a la partida de la qual comenciest, e strenh la tua ma am facilitat e savieza entro que no sia mauguda.	Then repeat the filling into the part from which you begin, and strengthen your work with ease and skill so that it is not broken.
E sia la tua striccio am la qual strenhas le fiel deves las razitz de las dentz que no evasesca.	And your filling should be so that you strengthen the gold over the roots of the teeth so that it does not leak out.
E aprop inscindeys las extramitatz del fiel superfluens am las forceps o tosoyras, e agregua aquelas en quascun loc am gesti, e converteys aquelas e las occulta entre la dent sana e la dent mauguda, per so que no fassa lesio a la lengua.	And then cut off the excess gold with tongs or tweezers, and add those to each location with a gesture, and smooth them over and conceal them between the healthy tooth and the broken one, so that they do not hurt the tongue.
E aprop leyssa aquela ayssi streyta cum roman.	And then let it be sealed as tight as possible with Roman pitch.
Mays si es desliada o rumpuda, strenh aquela o aquelas am autra fiel en tal manieyra en tot son temps.	But if it is loose or broken, strengthen that or them with other gold in the same manner at all times.
E aquesta es la forma de las dentz e la figura de la rectacio de doas dentz sanas e de doas maugudas, ayssi cum vezes aquestas liadas:	And this is the form of teeth and the figure of the filling of two healthy teeth and two broken ones, as they are bound together:
E quan se fa que retorno una dent o doas aprop le cazement de quascuna en lors locs, e sian recrescutz ayssi cum havem recomtat, e que remauguan.	And when a tooth or teeth return to their place after being knocked out and are grown back as we have described, and they become broken again.
E no fa aquo sino bo artifexs e savi.	And it does not happen unless by a wise and skilled artist.
E alcunas veguadas es aptat alcuna causa dels osses de vaca, e es fayt de lor ayssi cum forma de dent, e es pausada en loc en le qual defayl la dent, e es strengit ayssi cum havem dit, e reman e serveys am aquel per lonc temps.	And some have become apt for some cause of cow bones, and it is made into the shape of a tooth, and it is placed in the location where the tooth failed, and it is strengthened as we have said, and remains and serves with that person for a long time.
Capitol .xxxiv.	Chapter .xxxiv.
De inscizio del liament le qual ve en la lengua e prohibeys loquela.	Of the incision of the ligament which appears on the tongue and prohibits speech.
Aquest liguament le qual ve dejos la lengua alcunas veguadas o es natural am le qual hom nays, o accidental e accideys per plagua la qual ja es consolidada.	This ligament which appears beneath the tongue in some people is either natural or happens accidentally due to a wound and has already healed.
E la operacio en lu es que huobres la boca del malaute, le sieu cap existent en le tieu se; e eleva la sieua lengua, e aprop inscideys aquel liament nervos segon la latitut entro que sia solvuda la lengua de la sua recencio.	And the operation on it is that you open the mouth of the patient, you see his jawbone beneath; and lift up his tongue, and then insert that nervous ligament according to its width so that the tongue is released from its binding.
Mays si en aquela es alcuna duricia o denodacio, e aquo es stat per consolidacio de plagua, lahoras tu gieta unci e scindeys aquel per la latitut entro que aias inscindit le liament e sia dissolvuda la nodacio.	But if there is any hardness or knotting in it, and that is standing due to the healing of a wound, then you pierce it with a needle and cut it according to its width so that you have cut the ligament and the knotting is dissolved.
E guarda te que no sia fayta fissura en le preon de la carn e que scindas aqui arceria e vengua flux de sanc.	And be careful that there is not made a crack in the membrane of the flesh and that you split the artery and blood flows out.
E aprop sia lavat le vestigi de la inscisio am ayguaros o am vi agre o am aygua frega; e aprop pausa dejos la lengua licini; so es meca la qual tengua le malaute dejos la lengua en quascuna nuoyt per so que no sia consolidat autra veguada.	Then wash the traces of the incision with rosewater or with wine vinegar or with pure water; then place the tongue in its socket, so that it is not moved from its socket again until it has healed properly.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, pausa sobre le loc vetriol trissat; mays si le sanc ventz, lahoras cauteriza le loc am cauteri lantiginos le qual conveneys ad aquo.	But if blood flows out, place vitriol on the spot; but if the blood oozes out, then cauterize the spot with a caustic that is appropriate for it.
E aprop aquel cura am las autras causas entro que sia sanat.	Then that is cured with the other causes so that it is healed.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter .xxxv.
De extraccio de ranula dejos la lengua.	Of the extraction of a ranula beneath the tongue.
Alcunas veguadas accideys dejos la lengua apostema asemblant a nomla petita prohibent la lengua de la sua operacio natural; e fort leu es magnificada entro que huempla la boca.	Sometimes it happens under the tongue an apostema resembling a wart that prevents the tongue from its natural movement, and when it becomes enlarged so that it fills the mouth.
E la operacio en lu es que huebras la boca del malaute sesent devant le solel e considera le apostema.	And the operation on him is that you open the mouth of the patient facing the sun and consider the abscess.
E si tu le vezes de fusca color o de negra, dur, al qual le malaute no atroba sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel quar es cranc.	And if you see it dark in color or black, hard, and the patient feels no pain in it, then do not touch that place.
E si es declinat a blancor, en le qual es humiditat, lahoras tu met le onci en lu, e inscideys aquel am spatum subtil, e inscindeys le de tota partida; e si sanc te ventz en la hora de la tua operacio, lahoras tu pausa desus zegi trissat, so es vetriol, entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	And if it turns white, with moisture in it, then insert the needle into it and pour in some subtle vinegar; and if blood comes out during your operation, then place a wound pack over it that is made of vitriol, until the bleeding stops.
E aprop retorna a la obra tua entro que lo haias trayt am compliment de lu, entro que sia lavat am vi agre e sal; e cura aquel am l’autra curacio ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	Then return to your work on it until it is healed with pleasant wine and salt; and cure it with another cure until it is healed.
Capitol .xxxvi.	Chapter 36.
De extraccio de apostema de doas aurelhas e de aquel que es nada en le golayro e de las autras apostemas.	Of the extraction of an abscess from two ears and that which is in the throat, and of other abscesses.
Quan endeveno en le golayro godat, so son glandulas las quals son asembladas algodat, las quals accideysso deforas e son nompnadas doas aurelhas, las quals quan tu las curas am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no es sanat, lahoras tu considera si le apostema es dur, de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel am ferr.	When an abscess occurs in the throat, there are glands which are clustered together like cotton; these are driven out and are named two ears; when you cure them with what we have said in the division, and they are not healed, then consider if the abscess is hard, dark in color, of little feeling, then do not touch that with iron.
E si es de roga color e la razic es grossa, lahoras no toques aquela am ferr per le flux del sanc; abantz layssa aquel entro sia madurat, e lahoras o tu trauqueras aquel, o sira romput per si.	And if it is of red color and the root is thick, then do not touch that with iron for fear of the flow of blood; before you leave it, let it become mature, and then either you will cut it out or it will burst by itself.
E si es de blanqua color, radon, e la razit de lu es subtil, lahoras aquel es que cove esser inscidit.	And if it is of white color, soft, and the root of it is subtle, then that is what should be pierced.
E la operacio en lu es que consideras, denant la tua operacio, si ja ha repausat le apostema de lu caut am repaus complit o si es deminuit am alcuna deminucio; e lahoras fay sezer le malaute denant le soleyl, e·l cap de lu sia en le tieu se, e huebre la boca de lu, e le servidor prenent entre las suas mas prema la lengua de lu dejos am instrument mot noble del qual aquesta es la forma:	And the operation on him is that you consider, before your operation, if the abscess has rested on him completely or has diminished by any diminution; and then make the patient face the sun, his head in your lap, and open his mouth, and the servant holding his hands take hold of his tongue with a noble instrument of which this is the form:
E sia fayt de argent o de aram, e sia subtil cum cotel.	And it should be made of silver or bronze, and be subtle like a needle.
Donc cum tu premes am aquel la lengua e es mostrat a tu la apostema, e catz sobre aquel le tieu vezement, lahoras pren onci e fica aquel en l’amenla, e tira aquel a las partidas defora tant quant podes.	So when you press with that the tongue and it is shown to you the abscess, and you put over that your vision, then take needle and pierce that in the hollows outward as far as you can.
Otra aquo que tiras alcuna causa de las tunicas, e aprop incideys aquela am instrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	Another is that you draw out some cause from the membranes; then cut that with an instrument of which this is the form:
e es asemblat a forceps, empero las extramitatz de lu son corvadas, ayssi que l’orrifici de quascuna de aquelas es en le endreyt del autra, mot agudas, le qual sia de ferr indi enbegut.	It is like tweezers, except that the ends of it are curved so that the holes of each of those are in the direction of the other, very sharp, and it should be made of iron heated in vinegar.
Mays si aquest instrument no es a tu present, lahoras inscideys aquel am spatum del qual aquesta es la forma de lu: E sia agut de la una part, no agut del autra part.	But if this instrument is not available to you, then pierce that with vinegar of which this is the form of it: And it should be sharp on one side and blunt on the other.
E pus que has inscidit una mella, inscideys l’autra segon aquesta meteyssa manieyra de inscizio, e aprop la inscizio le malaute guarguarise de aygua frega	And after you have pierced one membrane, pierce the other according to this manner of piercing, and then let the patient gargle with water.
Mays si endeve flux de sanc, guarguarise aygua de decoccio de scorsa de milgrana o de fuelha de mirtra e semblantz ad aquel de las causas stiptiquas entro que·l flux del sanc sia restreyt, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But if blood flows out, then gargle with water of decoction of the rind of pomegranate or of bay-leaf and alike to that of the causes astringent until the flow of blood is stopped, and then cure that until it is healed.
E alcunas veguadas naysso en le guolayro autras apostemas otra aquelas doas aurelhas, e inscideys aquelas segon que yeu e dit en la inscizio de doas mellas engualment.	And sometimes in the throat there are other abscesses besides those two ears, and you pierce those according to what we have said in the piercing of two membranes equally.
E yeu ja fu medicat una femna de apostema le qual era nat en le golayro de lu, le qual apostema tendia a color fusca, de pauc sentiment, le qual ja havia claus le golayro de lu, e la femna respirava am meat streyt, e ja havia prohibit a lu comestio e beure de aygua, e ja era pervenguda a la mort si mays agues stat per un dia o per dos.	And I had medicated a woman of an abscess which was in her throat; the abscess had turned dark in color, of little feeling, and it had closed up her throat, and she was breathing with difficulty, and she had forbidden herself food and drinking water, and she was coming near to death unless she had stayed for one or two days.
E l’apostema ja tant havia pugat que havia mezes dos ramps entro que eyssiro per dos traucs.	And the abscess had pushed so that it had made two bumps within that they were pus for two months.
Donc yeu me cuytegui fisturalment e fiquegui en un de lor onci, e tiregui aquel, e atirada es de lu gran porcio, e aprop yeu incidigui aquela de on comprendegui del autre trau, e aprop yeu obrigui la boca de lu, e compremegui la sua lengua, e aprop yeu fiquegui le onci en aquela apostema.	So I cut him up with a scalpel and inserted one of them in it, and pulled that out; and there came out of him a great portion, and then I pierced the other side where I understood the other pus was, and then I bound his mouth, and held down his tongue, and then I put the needle in that abscess.
E aprop yeu abscizi gran partida de lu, e no corria de lu sino un pauc de sanc.	And then I cut away a great part of it, and not much blood flowed out of him.
Donc absolut es le guolayro de aquela femna, e comensec tantost beure aygua, e aprop presec vianda, donc yeu no cessegui inscidir de aquela apostema motas vetz per lonc temps, e succesia apostema en loc de aquel, le qual inscizia entro que es prolonguat aquel.	Then the throat of that woman was absolutely open, and she began to drink water at once, and then she ate food; therefore I did not cease to pierce that abscess many times for a long time, and the abscess occurred in the place where that one was, which was prolonged.
Donc yeu engen agui e cauterizegui le guolayro de lu, donc astec de addicio; e aprop yeu perambulegui e no saubi que fec Dieus de aquela aprop mi.	Then I cut and cauterized her throat, therefore the addition of that; and then I walked around and did not know what God had done to that; therefore my marvel grew at that.
Capitol .xxxvii.	Chapter 37.
De inscizio de huvela quan es apostemada.	Of the piercing of the navel when it is abscessed.
Quan catarr deysen a la huvula, e es apostemada e es longa, lahoras ela es nompnada perpendicular; e si es en la partida dejos grossa e redonda, e lahoras ela es apelada buba.	When there is pus in the navel, and it is abscessed and long, then it is named perpendicular; and if it is thick and round in the lower part, then it is named buba.
Mays quan es curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio, e no comfereys la tua curacio, e eyssament ja vezes que apostema caut ja es ostat de lu e es subtil, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquela que es agreguadas redonda; e si es ad aquela longitut, e es sanguina, de fusca color o de negre, e no es a lu centiment, lahoras cove que tu temtes la inscizio de lu, quar en aquela es temor sobre le malaute.	But when it is healed with what we have said in the division and does not comply with your cure, and you see that the abscess cauterized is last in him and is subtle; and if it is to that length, and it is blood-red, dark in color or black, and there is no feeling in it, then beware of piercing it, for there is fear over the patient.
E quan tu vezes aquela segon la manieyra que yeu he dita de la sua blancor e longuesa, que tu fassas sezer le malaute e premas la lengua de lu am instrument del qual procesic la sua forma e aprop fica le onci en la nuva, e tira aquela en jos e inscideys aquela am un de dos instrumentz les quals e ditz en la inscizio de dos mellas.	And when you see that according to the manner which I have said of its whiteness and length, that you make the patient and press his tongue with the instrument of which I have described the form; and then put the needle in the new one, and pull that down and pierce that with one of two instruments of which I spoke in the piercing of two membranes.
E cove que no inscidas aquela sino aquo que es ajustat sobre le terme natural ses addicio, quar si tu inscides de lu mays, lediyras le sieu parlar.	And beware that you do not pierce it unless what is adjusted over the natural term with its addition, for if you pierce further, you will cut his speech.
E aprop la inscizio, usa de aquo le qual havem recomtat en la inscizio de dos mellas, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And after piercing, use what we have recommended in the piercing of two membranes, and cure that until it is healed.
Mays si era le malaute espaventat per la inscizio de lu, cove que use de engen en la cauterizacio de lu ses temor, e la manieyra del cauteri en lu no es sino am aygua aguda, e es que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop prem la lengua de lu am le instrument le qual havem dit, e aprop pren de l’aygua la qual havem dita en le capitol de cauterizacio, e comfeys am aquela caus viva, e pausa aquela no spessa ni subtil, e de aquela omple la concavitat de l’estrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	But if the patient is frightened by the piercing of him, beware that you use a needle in cauterizing him without fear, and the manner of the cautery in him is not but with sharp water; then let the head of the patient be in your lap, and then press his tongue with the instrument of which we have spoken, and then take the water which we spoke of in the chapter of cauterization, and comply with that living cause, and pause that not thick nor subtle, and of that fill the concavity of the instrument of which this is the form:
Sia la extramitat de lu conquavitat en la qual sia pausada la medicina ayssi cum la conquavitat de culher de ray, e pausa le strument am la medicina sobre la vula, e·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu latz per so que corro saliva o musellage de la boca de aquel per la intrinscequa medicina, per so que no deyssenda de aquela deguna causa sobre le golayro de lu e que ledesca aquel.	Let the hollow of it be concavity in which is stopped the medicine likewise with the concavity of spoon of rosewater, and pause the instrument with the medicine over the navel; and let the patient jaw over his lap so that run saliva or mouth mucous membrane of that medicine, so that no other cause on the throat of him and that you lead that.
E aprop te la tua ma am la medicina, e exprem aquela sobre la uvula per l’espazi de miega hora entro que vegas aquela esser denegrada e sedada per la mordicacio de la medicina.	And then hold your hand over the medicine, and squeeze that on the uvula through the space of a half-hour until you see it blackened and subdued by the biting of the medicine.
E si vols, prengues coto e envolopes aquel sobre la extremitat del ray, e submergeys le coto en la medicina, e entrometas le ray am le coto en una canula de sobre entro que·l coto adheresca en aquela canula, e fay aquo tantas vetz entro que consiegues aquo que vols de la cauterizacio de la uva, e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela se seccara e cayra aprop tres dias o quatre.	And if you want, take a needle and wrap that over the end of the rose water; then submerge the needle in the medicine and insert the rosewater into a tube so that the needle adheres in that tube, and do that as many times until you achieve what you want from cauterizing the grape; then let it be blackened as it dries and falls after three or four days.
E si indigeysses que iteras la medicina, itera aquela, e aprop la cauterizacio abstergeys en le circuit de la uva am coto enbegut en boder, e mondifica am aquel aquo que es en le circuit de lu de la medicina, e sia lavat am aygua frega, e sia curat deforo am embrocacio, e dedintz am guarguarismes entro que sia sanat.	And if you feel that the medicine should be repeated, repeat it, and then cauterize it by wiping it with a cotton swab dipped in wine, and cleanse it with the water that was used to dissolve the medicine, and wash it with warm water, and treat it from the outside with embrocation, and on the inside with healing remedies until it is healed.
E aquesta especia de curacio es pus salva que inscizio e pus long de temor.	And this kind of treatment is more safe than incision and less painful.
Alcunas veguadas es curada la uvuola am aquo que es pus subtil que cauteri e inscizio, quar es curat am subfumigacio en aquesta manieyra: recipe calament, ysop, origua, ruda, scicados arabic, camamilla, broyda e semblant ad aquels de las erbas, e ajusta totas aquelas causas, o alcunas de lor, en una ola, e sian submergidas am vi agre, e bulhan; e la ola sia be lutada am lut decentment, e sia en le mieg loc de la ola un trauc, sobre le qual sia pausat un instrument conquau de aram segon aquesta manieyra; sia fayt de argent o de aram.	Sometimes, ulcerations of the uvula are healed with something more subtle than cauterization or incision: take myrrh, hyssop, oregano, rue, Arabic thorns, camomile, brot and similar to those herbs, and mix all these ingredients, or some of them, in a bowl, and let them be soaked in mild vinegar; and the bowl should be covered with a decent lid, and there should be a hole in the middle of the lid, on which an appropriate hollow instrument made of silver or brass is placed; it should be fashioned out of silver or brass.
E sia entromesa la extremitat en la boca del malaute entro que la vapor poge a la uvula sobre la quanula, entro que la uvula sia mot ofuscada.	And the end of this instrument is inserted into the mouth of the patient so that the steam reaches the uvula, where it is very fogged up.
E aprop itera sobre aquela motas veguadas entro qu’es secca, e guarda te que no fassas aquesta curacio al comesament de l’aveniment de apostemas, quar trop ajustaria en le apostema, e no cove que tu fassas aquo, sino deves la declaracio de apostema de lu caut.	And then repeat this process several times until it is dry, and be careful not to perform this treatment during the rising of humors, for it would cause too much pressure on the swelling; instead, wait until the swelling has subsided before cauterizing it.
Mays si no es a tu present aquest instrument, lahoras pren una cana e compon en la extramitat de lu un clos de huou, per so que la boca del malaute sia comborida, quar le closc del huou prohibeys la vapor comburir la boca.	But if you do not have this instrument at hand, take a reed and attach a ball of wool to its end, so that it fits into the mouth of the patient; for the wool prevents the steam from burning the mouth.
E aquesta curacio es bona am salut.	And this treatment is good for health.
Capitol .xxxviii.	Chapter 38.
De extraccio d’espinas e de aquo que adhereys en le golayro e de las autras causas.	On the extraction of thorns and other objects that stick in the throat, and on other causes.
Motas veguadas adhereys en le guolayro o spina de peys o alcuna autra causa.	Sometimes, there are things stuck in the throat or a thorn from the foot or some other cause.
Adonc cove que tu extraguas aquo que de aquels es apparent, sobre le qual catz la vista, pus que tu premes la lengua am instrument denant solelh, per so que a tu sia declarat aquo que es en la guola.	So you must pull out whatever is visible, using an instrument in front of the tongue, so that it can be seen clearly what is in the throat.
E aquo que no apar e es a tu occultat en le guolayro, cove que tu fassas vomir le malaute denant que la vianda sia degerida en l’estomac, quar fort leu la causa annexsa le golayro sira foro-getada per vomit; o que deglusia le malaute una pessa de nap o de razit de laytuga o un boci de pa sec; o prengua una pessa de sponga marina sequa leon, e lia aquela fortment am fiel, e aprop le malaute transglussia aquela, quar cum perve al loc en le qual so spinas e es extrahuda, lahoras so foro-getatz.	And if there is something hidden in the throat that cannot be seen, the patient should be made to vomit before the food has time to digest in the stomach; for often the cause of the throat lies hidden in the throat and is dislodged by vomiting; or let the patient eat a piece of bread or a leaf of lettuce or a bite of dry bread; or take a piece of dry sea sponge, soak it in vinegar, and then swallow it, for when it reaches the place where the thorns are stuck, they will be dislodged.
E mays pren una anguila e be am fiel liada, e sia dedintz mesa e soptament sia extrayta; o pren un porr e soptament le metas e soptament l’en tratz.	Or take an eel and dip it in vinegar, and let it lie there until it is soft, then swallow it, for it will be driven into the place where the thorns are stuck, and they will come out; or take a needle and push it in and pull it out.
Mays si no so foro-getatz am aquelas causas las quals havem ditas, lahoras husa de un instrument de plom segon aquesta forma:	But if they are not dislodged by these means, then use a lead instrument shaped like this:
E sia pus gros que ray un petit, e en la extramitat de lu sia conquavitat la qual tu entrometas en la sua guola am facilitat.	And it should be thicker than a little finger, and at its end there should be a cavity which you insert into the patient's throat with ease.
E el aga le sieu cap elevat en sus, e guarda te que·l tocament del sieu os de la gola, per so que endevengua a lu cos e am aquela que enpellesca le os o la spina, o que aquel le metge am la sua ma.	And let the patient tilt his head back, and be careful not to touch his throat bones, so that he may pull on it or press on the bone or thorn with his hand, or that the doctor do so with his hand.
Mays empero que·l malaute aquel entrometa es miels, per la sua sciencia del loc de la causa annexa e enpellisca en jos, e tira la sua ma am le instrument en sus, tot aquo segon la quantitat la qual es a lu preparada entro que sia foro-getada.	But the patient himself should do this, for he knows best where the cause is located and can press it down from above while pulling up on the instrument, according to the amount by which he is able to relax; then it will be dislodged.
Capitol .xxxix.	Chapter 39.
De extraccio de sancguisugua annexsa al golayro.	On the extraction of a blood clot from the throat.
Quan es medicada sanguisugua am aquo que havem dit en la divisio de la curacio am medicinas e no comfereys, considera lahoras en le guolayro del malaute al solelh, pus que tu aias compremuda la lengua de lu am instrument le qual a tu havem recomtat.	When there is blood clotting after we have described the treatment with remedies and they do not work, then consider the throat of the patient on the upper surface, for you must examine his tongue with an instrument which we have recommended.
Donc si tu vezes la sancguisugua, extratz aquela am onci petit o am gesti subtils decentment.	So if you see the blood clot, remove it with a small needle or with a thin, decently pointed instrument.
E si no es a tu possible estrayre am aquel, lahoras pren una canula concava e entromet aquela en lo guolayro del malaute, e aprop pausa en la concavitat de la canula un ferr ignit, e fay aquo tantas vetz (entro que la sancguisugua sia morta e se osta del guolayro) e abstengua se le malaute tot lo jorn de aygua.	And if you cannot remove it with that, then take a hollow, curved tube and insert it into the patient's throat; then place a red-hot iron in the cavity of the tube, and do this as many times as necessary (until the blood clot is dead and comes out of the throat), and the patient abstains from water all day.
E aprop prengua una veyria plena de aygua frega, e obra la boca de lu en aquela, e lava la boca am aquela; e no trasglucia de aquela alcuna causa e maugua l’aygua una hora aprop autra am la sua ma, quar la sancguisugua tantost cum sent l’aygua catz.	And then take a sponge soaked in warm water, and wipe the patient' mouth with it; and do not drink anything else for an hour or more, wiping his mouth with the sponge every now and then, for as soon as he feels the water, he will spit out the blood clot.
Mays si no es foro-getada am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras subfumigua le malaute am cimetz o am assafetida per le instrument le qual havem recomtat en la sufumiguacio de uvula.	But if it is not dislodged by what we have recommended, then smoke the patient' mouth with camphor or asafetida through the instrument which we have recommended for smoking the uvula.
Fay aquo, so en quar cayra.	Do this, according to how bad it is.
E es un’autra manieyra de operacio en sufumiguacio de aquela, es que tu prenguas una ola en la qual sian carbos ignitz e la ola sia cuberta am una cobertora en le mieg de la qual sia un trauc, e sia compausat en aquel trauc la extremitat del instrument; e aprop dega desus la subfumigacio; e pause le malaute la sua boca en la extremitat de la canula, e claugua la sua boca per que la subfumiguacio no sia foro-getada entro que sapias que la subfumigacio es pervenguda a la sancguisugua, quar la sancguisugua tantost cayra.	And there is another way of smoking it: take a bowl in which are burning coals and the bowl is covered with a cloth, and in the middle of the cloth there is a hole, and place the end of the instrument in that hole; then smoke the patient; let the patient tilt his head back so that the smoke reaches the blood clot, for when he feels the smoke, the blood clot will come out.
E si no catz, lahoras tu itera la subfumiguacio motas vetz, e abstengua le malaute de beure, e mange causas saladas e alhs, e no begua aygua, e ayssi necessari es que am aquest regiment sia fora-getada.	And if it does not work, then repeat the smoking many times; and let the patient abstain from drinking, and eat salt and vinegar, and do not drink water, and with this regime it will be dislodged.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument am le qual es trayta sancguisugua del guolayro quan es vista; e es semblant a forceps ayssi cum vezes, sino quar es en lu alcuna curvitat:	And this is the shape of the instrument with which blood clots are extracted from the throat when they are seen; and it is similar to forceps except that it has some curvature:
le qual sia mesa al guolayro, e la extremitat de lu es semblant a bec de ciconia, que es guanta, en la qual es aspretat de lima, per so quar, quan comprem alcuna causa, aquela no leyssa.	which is inserted into the throat; its end is similar to a stork's beak, which is hooked, and on it there is an aperture, so that when we press down on any object, it does not slip.
Capitol .xl.	Chapter 40.
En le qual es la suma del sermo en apercio de apostemas e en seccio de lor.	Here is the sum of the discourse on the diagnosis and section of abscesses.
Les apostemas so motas specias, de motas manieyras, segon que ve rememoracio de lor, de quascuna en aquest libre.	Abscesses are of many kinds, according to what we remember of them, of each one in this book.
E so diversas en perforacio e seccio de lor per doas manieyras, de las quals la una es per la specia de apostemas en si meteys; e per aquo que comprem de las humiditatz.	And they differ in their piercing and sectioning by two means: one is for abscesses in themselves; and the other is for those caused by moistness.
E la segonda manieyra es prop les locs en les quals accideys del cos, quar le apostema accident en le cap es autra de la apostema accident en le cul; e le apostema en le loc carnos accident es autra del apostema accident en junctura; e a quascun de lor es son juguament per operacio.	And the second way is according to the places in which they occur: for an abscess in the head is different from an abscess in the buttock; and an abscess in a fleshy place is different from an abscess in a joint; and each of them is treated differently by sectioning.
E mays de apostemas so alcunas las quals cove que no sian perforadas sino aprop maturacio de la sania en aquels o compliment de lor.	And there are some abscesses which need not be pierced, but only mature with poultices on them or their complement.
