So autras apostemas les quals cove que sian traucatz quan son cruzes, e no son maturatz segon lor compliment, ayssi cum apostemas que son propdas a las juncturas, quar apostema quan ve prop junctura, lo esser de lu es prolonguat entro que·s poyreys aquo que es en le circuit de lu, e fort leu son corromputz les liamentz o les nervis de aquela junctura, per que es fayta causa de contraccio de aquel membre; o es apostema prop de membre principal, e si tu tardas la perforacio de lu entro sia madurat nosira al membre principal; o es prop le cul, donc perfora aque no-madurat; e no cove que·l perforas cru, de no-complida degestio, sino aquel que es prop del cul, per so que no poyresca le preon de lu e sia elonguat a las partidas dedintz del cul, e sia fayta fistula, o que sia fayt en le terme de lu que no sia sanat.	And other abscesses are those which are not punctured unless they are mature with poultices on them; and if they are near a joint, the flesh around it is prolonged as the pus is discharged from it, and it causes a contraction of that member, or it is near an important member, and if you delay piercing it until it is mature, then it will affect the main member; or it is near the buttock, so do not pierce it unless it is mature; or it is near the anus, so do not pierce it unless it is completed, lest it affects the parts within the anus, or it is made in the end of it that it is not healed.
Mays cove que tu sapias la hora de la perforacio de la apostema, e aysso es quan es maturat.	But know that you know the time of the puncturing of the pustule, and also when it is mature.
E sapias que es madurat quan es la cedacio de la dolor e la cessacio de la febre, e aprop la diminucio de la rogor e de la pulsacio, e la acuitat del cap del apostema, e les autres senhals.	And know that it has matured when there is a decrease in pain and fever, and also a decrease in redness and pulse, and the tip of the pustule becomes blunt, and other signs appear.
E quar cove que sapias la perforacio cazer en le loc pus dejos del apostema e de pus venient de curacio de la eminencia.	And know that the puncturing should take place in the most lower part of the pustule, and also when pus comes out from the healing of the eminence.
E perforacio tostemps sia per le lonc de la carn o del cors, si las apostemas son en las partidas de las mas o dels pes, e en loc dels lacertz, de las cordas dels nervis, de las arcerias; e, al derier, en totz locs enguals en les quals no es reflecio; quar en aquels que so reflectitz, usa de perforacio segon aquel membre.	And the puncturing should always be done lengthwise along the flesh or body, if the pustules are on the hands or feet, and in places of the joints, of the tendons, of the nerves, of the veins; and, lastly, in all places alike, in which there is no reflex; for in those where there is a reflex, use puncturing according to that member.
Mays quan le apostema es en loc carnos, lahoras miels es que leysses la perforacio de lu entro que sia confermada la digestio de lu segon compliment, ayssi quo havem dit; quar si tu perforas aquel denant aquo, es prolonguat le cors del poyre de lu e de mota sordicia, e fort leu las labias de lu so enduradas e la profunditat de lu.	But when the pustule is in a fleshy place, it is better to let the puncturing be done after the digestion of it is confirmed, as we have said; for if you puncture it before that, the body of it is prolonged, and much filth comes out, and its lips become hard and deep.
Mays alcus apostemas so perforatz segon la latitut de la carn o del cos deves la necessitat, o segon aquo del qual lo membre indigeys.	But some pustules are punctured according to the breadth of the flesh or body, as need requires, or according to that member which feels pain.
E cove que administres petita perforacio , e·n les apostemas grans gran perforacio e ampla o motas seccios segon la diversitat de la grandesa dels apostemas.	And you shall give a small puncturing in the great pustules, and a large and ample puncturing or many small ones according to the diversity of the sizes of the pustules.
E autras so dels apostemas en les quals cove que la codena sia conquavada e sia encidida, quan es fayta ayssi quo pan e fayta es en terme que ja stigua, ayssi cum aquel que accideys en trops de dubelec e de bubos.	And others are of pustules in which the cord is hollow and cut, when it is made thus that bread and is made in a term that it was already, as with that which happens in trots of dublec and of buboes.
E de aquels so que so insciditz am seccio havent tres angles; e de aquels es en le qual es inscidit ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirtra, ayssi cum las apostemas dels angonars.	And of those are in which it is cut with three angles; and of those is in which it is cut thus as the shape of a leaf of myrtle, as well as the pustules of the armpits.
E de lor so en les quals es administrada seccio redonda e seccio lunar, e semblantz ad aquels.	And of them are in which round incisions and lunar incisions are administered, and resembling those.
Mays aquel al qual no es cap ayssi cum son apostemas leons superficials, cove que tu perforas aquel am perforacio superficial, o plana tant solament.	But to him to whom it is not thus with his pustules, superficial or flat incisions are made only to the superficial ones.
E cove quant le apostema es gros e ya ha colligit mota sania, que perfores aquel e no te coytes que extraguas tot le poyre en aquela hora; habantz extratz de aquel una partida, e aprop opila le apostema entro al autre dia, e aprop extratz una partida major, e aprop fa aquo motas veguadas segon graduacio entro que sia foro-getat.	And when the pustule is large and has already collected much pus, you shall puncture it and not be afraid to extract all of its pus in that hour; have extracted a part of it, and then close up the pustule until the next day, and then extract a larger part, and do this several times according as there is a discharge.
E majorment si·l malaute es de freol vertut, o femna prens, o enfant petit, o viel en decrepitut, quar l’esperit animal motas vetz es resolvut am la egressio de la sania, e fort leu mor le malaute, e tu operte les.	And especially if the patient is of a cold nature, or a pregnant woman, or a small child, or an old man in decrepitude, for the animal spirit is many times dissolved by the discharge of pus, and the patient dies soon after, and you operate on them.
Don guarda aquest capitol am gran cautela, e aprop la tua perforacio en la qual perforas aquestz apostemas, cove que abstergescas las plagues e consideras donc si la plagua del apostema es pauca, o es una seccio plana, lahoras tu aministra las qualguas de li o de coto antic; e si le apostema es gran, e las fissuras de la perforacio son motas, lahoras cove que tu pauses meca en quascun trauc entro que pervenguan ensemps.	So keep this chapter with great caution, and then your puncturing in which you puncture these pustules, wash the wounds and consider therefore if the wound of the pustule is small, or a flat section, then you shall administer the which of oil or of old vinegar; and if the pustule is large, and the fissures of the puncturing are many, then you shall pause with your fingers in each crack until they come together.
E si en le apostema es abscindit una partida de la codena o has concavada aquela en le circuit, lahoras cove que tu la complescas de coto viel o de fil fayt de drap de li, ayssi cum quan has traytz pans o razizos, ses humiditat; e strenh aquel entro al tertz dia; e aprop proceseys aquel e cura le am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And if in the pustule a part of the cord is cut off or you have hollowed it around its circuit, then you shall complete it with old vinegar or with thread made of linen cloth, thus as when you treat boils or ulcers, without moisture; and strengthen it on the third day; and then process it and cure it with that which you use for ointments until it is healed.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc en la hora de la operacio tua, lahoras tu aministra aygua frega e vi agre en les quals mules un drap de li, e pausa aquel sobre le loc del fluxs del sanc motas veguadas.	But if there is a flow of blood in the hour of your operation, then you shall administer water and vinegar rubbed together with a linen cloth, and place that on the place of the flow of blood several times.
Mays si persevera le fluxs del sanc, lahoras cove que tu aministres regiment e curacio e polveras las quals he recomtadas en motz locs de aquest nostre libre e de divisio.	But if the flow of blood persists, then you shall administer medicine and cure it with powders which I have recommended in many places of this our book and division.
Mays si es en temps de hivern, e·l loc de la apostema es loc de motz nervis, lahoras cove que tu enfundas pulvils en vi e oli caut, e pauses aquels sobre les locs.	But if it is in the winter time, and the place of the pustule is a place of many nerves, then you shall pour powder into vinegar and hot oil, and place that on the places.
E si es en estiu, e les locs son carnoses, lahoras cove que tu pauses pulvils enbeguts am aygua e oli o am vi e oli, e tot aquo sia freg entro que sia le ters dia, ayssi cum havem dit, e lahoras cove que tu deslies le apostema e abstergescas aquel e aministres en la curacio de lu aquo que a lu conveneys entro que sia sanat.	And if it is in the summer, and the places are fleshy, then you shall place powdered herbs moistened with water and oil or vinegar and oil, and do this every third day as we have said, and then open up the pustule and wash it and administer to its cure that which is convenient to it until it is healed.
E aysso es aquo que es necessari de la cognicio de la curacio de apostemas universalment, mays segon la via de distinccio ja he dit de tot apostema en qual manieyra es via de la cura de lu per capitols singularment.	And thus is what is necessary of the knowledge of the cure of pustules universally, but according to the way of distinction I have already said of each pustule in what manner is the way of its cure specifically.
Capitol .xli.	Chapter 41.
De seccio de apostemas les quals veno en la codena del cap.	Of incisions of pustules which come in the cord of the head.
En la codena del cap petitz apostemas, e so de specias de nodes les quals conteno tunicas que so a lor factz ; e las specias de lor so motas.	In the cord of the head are small pustules, and they are of species of knots which contain membranes that are made to them; and the species of them are many.
E de lor son pingas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditat semblant a lima.	And from them are bumps, and from those is contained moisture resembling lime.
E de aquelas so las quals conteno humiditat semblant a pols, et asemblantz a lor; e de aquelas so que son lapideas, durs.	And from those are which contain moisture resembling powder, and resembling them; and from those are which are scaly, hard.
E en la seccio de totz, e en la extraccio de aquels no es temor, cum deves la exteccio de aquels no fa contrariat arceria.	And in the section of all of them, and in the extraction of those there is no fear, as you must extract them it does not contradict the artery.
E la operacio en seccio de aquels es que tu esproes aquels am instrument la forma del qual ve aprop aysso, le qual es apelat entromes, entro que sapias que contengua.	And the operation in the section of those is that you express those with an instrument the form of which see below, the one which is called entromes, knowing that it contains.
Quar si aquo que conte es humiditat, lahoras scindeys aquel am seccio segon la longitut per seccio superficial segon aquesta forma:	For if what it contains is moisture, then split that one with an incision according to its length by a superficial incision according to this form:
E comensa en la seccio de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G. Donc cum la humiditat es evacuada, lahoras tu excoria aquela pel que conte aquela humiditat, e no leysses de aquela alcuna causa de tot, quar tropas veguadas retorna, si roman de aquela alcuna causa.	And begin in the incision of line .B to line .G. So when the moisture is discharged, then you scrape that one by which it contains that moisture, and let there be no cause of any, for repeated incisions return if there is any cause from that one.
E aprop submergeys coto en enguent egipciach, si es present, e sino, en aygua e sal; e umpleys am aquel la plagua e layssa aquel entro ad autra dia, quar am aquo corrodeys tot so que es romas de aquela pellicula.	And then immerse vinegar in Egyptian ointment, if it is present, and if not, in water and salt; and fill that with that the wound and let that stay until another day, for by that you corrode all that is broken of that membrane.
E aprop itera sobre aquel coto am enguent egipciach segondament e tersament si indigeyses de lu, entro que·t comfides que no y haia romas alcuna causa de aquela pellicula; lahoras cura la plagua am enguent entro que sia sanada.	And then apply ointment to that one again secondly and thirdly if it needs it, knowing that you are confident that there is no cause of that membrane; then cure the wound with ointment until it is healed.
E si apostema conte nodi gras, lahoras tu inscideys aquel segon aquesta forma:	And if the pustule contains a knotted vein, then you shall cut that one according to this form:
am seccio havent forma de crotz, e geta oncis entre doas labias de la seccio e scorsa aquel de tota partida, e esforsa la tua vertut en extraccio de la tunica la qual conte aquel.	By incision having the shape of a cross, and cut hooks between two lips of the incision and scrape that one throughout its length, and apply your strength in extracting the membrane which contains that.
Mays si a tu arceria fa contrarieta, lahoras fay aquo que yeu t’e recontat primieyrament.	But if your artery opposes you, then do that which I will tell you first.
E semblantment fay en le apostema lapificat de seccio e de curacio segon que a tu havem dit; e seccio sobre apostema lapificat es pus leugiera, quar es de pauc sanc e de pauca humiditat.	And similarly do in the pustule suppuration of incision and cure as we have said; and incision on suppurating pustule is less bloody, for it is of little blood and little moisture.
E alcunas vetz so alcus de aquestz apostemas les quals so en le cap en alcus homes am los quals de tot no es humiditat; la qual causa es quar yeu inscindigui sobre un apostema en le cap de una femna vielha e atrobegui le apostema ayssi cum peyra sorda, aspra, blanqua, la qual no podia esser trinquada, e si a alcu fos am aquela percussit, plaguera aquel.	And some times some of these pustules are in the head in some people with whom there is no moisture; the cause of which is that they have hit upon one in the head of an old woman and rubbed the pustule thus with a hard, rough, white pebble, which could not be touched, and if it hit any person, it would blister.
Mays en les autres apostemas accidentz en le cap otra aquest no es aquest capitol, ayssi cum les apostemas que veno als caps dels enfantz e deves las razitz de las aurelhas, mays la seccio de aquestz totz sia seccio superficial.	But for the other abscesses in the head or elsewhere that are not included in this chapter, as well as the abscesses that occur on the heads of children and from the roots of the ears, the incision of all these should be superficial.
E pausa la perforacio de aquels de la partida pus bassa de lor per so que sia alleujat le cos de la sania a las partidas pus bassas.	And make the incision in those with the lower part of the pus so that it drains the body of the pus to the lower parts.
E aprop cura aquelas am aquo que conveneys ad aquel de curacio.	Then treat those with what is convenient for their healing.
Capitol .xlii.	Chapter 42.
De seccio de scrophulas las quals accideyso en le col.	Of the incision of scrofula which happens in the neck.
Motas veguadas endeveno aquestas apostemas en le colh e en las aysselhas e en les angonars; e alcunas veguadas accideyso en las autras partidas del cos.	These abscesses often appear on the neck, armpits, and groins; sometimes they occur in other parts of the body as well.
E so aquelas que accideysso en le colh, e so motas que so engendradas entre lor, e tota scrofula de aquelas es dintz la sua tunica propria, e ayssi cum en les nodis e apostema del cap, ayssi cum havem recomtat.	And some are generated among them, and all scrofula of these is within their own membrane, as well as in the nodes and abscesses of the head, as we have described earlier.
E las specias de aquestas scrophulas son motas, quar de aquelas so alcunas lapideas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditatz, e de aquelas so malignas las quals no obeseysso a curacio.	And the kinds of these scrofula are various: some are stony, and some contain humidity, and some are malignant and do not respond to treatment.
Donc en aquela la qual tu vezes de bona disposicio en le Tocament, de la qual la color de aquo que es manifest es propda a la color de la codena, e es mauguda a tota partida, e no es annexsa am le nervi del colh, ni am las venas, ni am la arceria, e no es preonda, cove que tu inscidiscas aquela am siccio superficial de la partida desus a la partida dejos del cos de la linha de .G. entro la linha de .B., e scorja aquela de tota partida, e exten dos labias de la codena am onci, o am motz oncis si has necessitat de aquels, ayssi cum havem dit en las apostemas del cap, e extratz aquela petit a petit.	Therefore, when you see one of good disposition in the Touchment, whose color of what is manifest is close to the color of the cord, and is swollen all over, and is not attached to the nerves of the neck, or to the veins, or to the artery, and is not deep, you should investigate that with a superficial cut from above the line of 30 degrees to below the body of the line of 24 degrees, and score it from all sides, and stretch out its lips with a hook, or with several hooks if you have need of them, as we have said in the abscesses of the head, and extract it little by little.
E es mays cautela que no sia inscidida la vena o nervi.	And it is more careful that the vein or nerve not be cut.
E sia le spatum no mot agut, que no ajuste a tu la tua ma am inscizio, o que enquiete le malaute, e que inscidas aquo que no es necessari inscidir; quar si inscideysses vena o arceria e prohibeys tu de la tua operacio, lahoras pausa en la plagua vetriol trissat o autras polveras las quals ostan fluxs de sanc, e estrenh la plagua, e layssa aquel entro que·s repausa la acuitat de la apostema e sia mollificada la plagua e comense esser poyrida.	And be careful that the spatula not be very sharp so that it does not accidentally touch you with the incision or disturb the patient, and make an incision only where it is necessary to do so; for if you cut a vein or artery and forbid yourself from your operation, then stop the bleeding with vitriol triphate or other powders which stop blood flow, and close up the wound, and leave that which rests beneath the keenness of the abscess and let the wound be softened and begin to discharge pus.
Quan le sanc es abscindit.	When the blood is abstained.
Donc retorna a la tua operacio entro que l’aias complida.	Therefore, return to your operation until you have completed it.
E aprop inquireys am le tieu dit indic si es romas alcuna causa de las autras petitas scrophulas, donc inscideys aquelas e munda aquelas.	And then inquire with your finger if there is any cause of the other small scrofula; therefore, cut into those and clean them.
E si es en la razit de la scrophula gran vena, cove lahoras que no inscidas aquela scrophula de la sua razitz.	And if there is a great vein in the root of the large scrofula, then you should not cut that scrofula from its root.
Abantz cove que lies aquela am fiel doblat fort e que leysses aquela entro que caia per si ses nocument.	But before you let it fall by itself without causing harm.
E aprop omple la plagua de coto vielh le qual tu has ja submirgit en enguent egipciac, e aprop cura aquel.	Then fill the wound with old cotton wool which you have already saturated in Egyptian ointment, and then treat it.
E si inscides aquela scrophula tota, lahoras cove que tu ajustes las doas labias de la plagua e cuzas2 tantost pus que no y ha romasa deguna superfluitat.	And if you have cut the whole scrofula, then you should grasp the two lips of the wound and suck gently until no more superfluity remains.
Mays si tu vezes que haia romasa superfluitat per la grandeza de la scrofula, cove que tu entendas a inscidir la razit de aquela, e astrayra aquela e aministra sutura e aquo que es dit.	But if you see that there is superfluity due to the greatness of the scrofula, then understand how to cut its root and drain it and administer the appropriate treatment and what is said.
E aquela de las scrophulas que conteno humiditatz, perfora aquela am perforacio superficial aqui la on appar a tu le loc de maturacio de lu, e pausa perforacio de aquo que siec le pus bas del cos, ayssi cum havem dit.	And that of the scrofula which contain humidity, pierce it with a superficial cut where you see the site of its maturity, and make an incision so that it drains the pus to the lower parts of the body, as we have said.
E aprop aministra perforacio, calguas am enguent e semblantz ad aquels, per so que corroda aquo que es romas de la corropcio.	And then administer a piercing, leeches with ointment and plasters to those, so that it corroses what is left of the corrosion.
E aprop quan tu vezes la plagua ja esser mundada, lahoras tu cura aquela am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanada.	And then when you see the wound already cleaned, then treat that with generative flesh ointment until it is healed.
Capitol .xliii.	Chapter 43.
De seccio del pilhot del apostema accident dintz le guolayro.	Of the incision of the boil of an abscess within the gullet.
Diyssero les antics aquesta seccio en le epilhot, e no vist alcu hom en nostra terra que aquela aia fayta.	The ancients wrote about this incision in the pilhot, and we have not seen anyone in our land who has performed it.
E aquesta es la inscriptura del sermo de aquels.	And this is the inscription of their language.
Mays en les homes haventz esquinencia, cove que sia esquivada la extraccio del epilhot, cum per aquo no sia fayt juvament per so quar totas las venas e las majors del malaute so aqui.	But in men who have squintiness, so that the extraction of the pilhot is avoided, lest all the veins and the major nerves of the patient are cut here.
Mays en aquels que han apostemas cautz en la boca o guolayro o dos aurelhas, quan la malautia no es en la cana, cove husar de la seccio de epilhot a fugir la perdicio la qual es fayta per perfocacio.	But in those who have abscesses cauterized in the mouth or gullet or two ears, when the malady is not in the cane, use the incision of the pilhot to avoid destruction which is made by piercing.
Donc cove quan volem aquo, que inscidam le epilhot dejos tres cercles dels cercles del epilhot, o quatre am petita seccio per la latitut en aquel que es entre dos cercles per quantitat, que la seccio sia en ciphac, no en la cartillage, e aquest loc es convenent a seccio, quar es privat de carn e les vayselhs de sanc de lu son luhen.	Therefore, when we want this, let us cut the pilhot below three circles of the circles of the pilhot, or four with a small incision for width in that which is between two circles by quantity, and let the incision be in the diaphragm, not in the cartilage, and this site is appropriate for incision, for it is deprived of flesh and the vessels of blood from it are drawn out.
E si le metge es pauruc, cove lahoras que extenda la codena del golayro am onci, e aprop fenda la codena entro que pervengua a la canal, mays evite les vaysels de sanc si vetz de aquelas alcuna causa.	And if the patient is fearful, then let him stretch out his gullet with a hook, and then split the membrane so that he might reach the canal, but avoid the blood vessels if he sees any cause for doing so.
E aprop inscida li ciplach segon que havem recomtat; e es significat sobre la seccio de la canal per le flacma le qual es de aquela eyssit am aquo que es de lu disromput e per la abscizio de la votz.	And then cut the ciplach according to what we have described, and it is significant about the incision of the canal by the flame from which it has issued and by the abstention of voice.
E layssa la plagua uberta per alcun temps.	And leave the wound open for a certain time.
Donc cum la hora es remauguda en la qual perforacio es temuda, agregua doas labias de la codena de la plagua, e cus aquela sola ses la cartillage.	Therefore, when the hour is reduced in which the piercing is feared, join together the two lips of the membrane of the wound and cut that only to the cartilage.
E aprop administra medicinas que fan naysser la carn entro que sia sanat.	And then administer medicines that cause flesh to grow within so that it may be healed.
E diyssec Albucasis que la summa del sermo le qual havem recomtat, exposicio no es sino que veias que alcus de aquetz apostemas ja han opilat lo guolayro del malaute, e le malaute es vengut entro a mort, e le ale de lu es entresecat, e alcus van a inscidir le epiglos per so que respire le malaute sobre le loc de la plagua per alcuna respiracio, e sia salvat de mort.	And Al-Bucasis said that the sum of our speech which we have described is this: some of those abscesses in the gullet of the patient have been cauterized, and the patient has come to death, and his throat is constricted, and some want to cut the epiglottis so that the patient might breathe over the site of the wound by any respiration, and he is saved from death.
E per aquo comandero layssar la plagua uberta entro que sia consumida la malicia de la malautia; e es la malicia de lu per tres dias; e donc lahoras comandero cosi la plagua, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And therefore they commanded to leave the wound open until the malady of the malady is consumed: and its malady lasts for three days, and then they commanded to close the wound, and treat it until it is healed.
E aquo que yeu he vist per mi meteys, es que una sirventa pres un cotel e mesec le en le sieu golayro e inscidic am aquel una partida de la cana del pulmo, e yeu fu apelat a la curacio de lu, e atrobegui la mugen ayssi cum es mugit del moridos, e descubrigui la plagua e atrobegui le sanc le qual era yssit de la plagua petit.	And what I have seen by my eyes is that one woman served a man and cut him in the gullet and made an incision on it of the pipe of the lung, and he was called to his cure, and when he opened the mouth, blood flowed from the wound just as it did from the dead, and he uncovered the wound and drew out the blood which was flowing from the wound.
Donc yeu fo confessat que aquela no havia inscidit vena ni guidegi, e le vent yssia de la plagua, e curegui aquela entro que foc sanada.	Therefore, he confessed that she had not cut a vein or artery, and the wind came out from the wound, and he treated it until it was healed with fire.
E no accidic a la sirventa si no rauquiera en la votz, e aprop alcus dias retornec ad miloracio de las suas dispozicios.	And he did not accuse the servant unless he had raged in the throat, and then some days later he returned to his sickness of his own disposition.
E ara dic yeu que en la seccio del epilhot no ha temor.	Now he says that there is no fear in the incision of the pilhot.
Capitol .xliv.	Chapter 44.
De seccio sobre apostema le qual accideys en le golayro defora, e es apelat hernia del golayro.	Of the incision upon an abscess which occurs in the gullet outward, and is called a hernia of the gullet.
Aquest apostema nompnat hernia del golayro es apostema gran segon la color del cors, e es mot en las femnas.	This hernia of the gullet is a great abscess according to the color of the body, and it occurs in women.
E es segon dos manieyras, quar o es natural o accidental.	And it occurs in two ways, for it is either natural or accidental.
E en le natural no es engen de curar.	And in nature there is no cure for it.
E l’accidental es segon dos manieyras del qual la un es semblant a nodes grasses, e l’autra manieyra es semblant apostema le qual es fayt per nodacio de arteria, e en aquel es temor.	And the accidental is according to two methods, of which one is like fatty nodes, and the other method is like an abscess, which is caused by a knot in an artery, and in both there is pain.
E no cove que·s fassa presumpcio a lu cum ferr sino en aquel que es petit.	And do not place pressure on him with a needle except in the case of one that is small.
E tu proha aquel e investigua aquel am le dit, e si atrobas lu semblant a nodi gras, e no es suspendut am alcuna de las venas, lahoras tu inscideys aquel ayssi cum les nodes, e extratz aquel am aquo que conte lu de la pel e bursiclam; e sino, lahoras es perscrutat tot le sieu esser, e aprop cura le loc am aquo que cove de curacio entro que sia sanat.	And you should examine him and investigate him as I have told you, and if you find it to be like a fatty node, and it is not suspended by any of the veins, then you should cut into that just as you would with nodes, and remove that along with what contains it from the skin and bursa; but if not, then you should probe throughout his body, and then treat the area with something that will promote healing until he is healed.
Capitol .xlv.	Chapter 45.
De seccio de las specias de nodes.	Of the section of the species of nodes.
Dels nodes so motas specias e yeu ja he dit totas las specias de lor en la divisio.	There are many species of nodes, and I have already described all of their species in the division.
E cove que yeu recomte assi la diferencia entre node e exitura cum fassa dubitacio.	And one should also count the difference between a node and an abscess as causing doubt.
Donc yeu dic que am exitura es caliditat e febre e dolors vehementz entro que es sedada la ebullicio de la superfluitat; e es complida putrefaccio que lahora cessa la febre, la dolor e la calor.	Therefore I say that with an abscess there is heat and violent pain until the ebullition of the superfluous matter is relieved; and it is complete putrefaction when the fever, pain, and heat cease.
Mays am node no es caliditat ni febre ni dolor, e conte aquel ciphac leon le qual es al u sac propri.	But with a node there is no heat or fever or pain; instead it contains the lion's tooth which is in its own sack.
E es segon la color del cors, e le comensament de lu es cum un ceze e es fayt ayssi cum vace, sia major o minor, e son segon dos specias, quar o so grassas e conteno humiditat, e las colors de la humiditat son motas, segon que yeu diyssi en la divisio.	And it is according to the color of the body, and its beginning is with a lump and it is made in this way with vacua, either greater or smaller, and they are according to two species, for some are fatty and contain moisture, and the colors of moisture are many, as I described in the division.
Donc cove, quan pervenas a la curacio de node, que exprohes aquel e inquiras aquel al comensament am sturment le qual es apelat intromes, segon que vindra la sua forma en le capitol le qual es aprop aquest.	Therefore, when you come to the cure of a node, probe it and pierce it at its beginning with an instrument called a probe, according to its form as it will appear in the chapter which is next.
E es manieyra de inquisicio de apostemas e de totz nodes, e es que tu prenguas aquest sturment e entromet aquel en le loc pus humit le qual atrobas en le apostema, e tu revolveras les tieus ditz am aquel petit a petit entro que sapias que·l sturment ja ha penetrat la codena.	And it is the manner of inquiry into abscesses and all nodes; take this instrument and insert it into the most moist part which you find in the abscess, and twist your fingers with it little by little until you know that the instrument has penetrated the membrane.
E aprop ultima la tua ma segon la mesura de la grandeza del apostema, e aprop extratz le entromes e considera aquo que es yssit en le vestigi de lu.	Then finish with your hand according to the measurement of the size of the abscess; then withdraw the probe and consider what has come out in its track.
E si es fora-getada la humiditat corrent, de qualque color sia, lahoras tu le inscideys am seccio superficial segon que he dit en les autres apostemas.	And if the moisture runs out, of whatever color it may be, then you should cut into it superficially as I have said in the other abscesses.
E si del vestigi de l’intromes no hieys humiditat, lahoras sapias que es gras.	And if no moisture comes out from around the probe, then know that it is fatty.
E secca sobre lu am seccio havent forma de crotz segon aquesta forma:	And dry it with superficial incisions in the shape of a cross according to this form:
ayssi cum t’e ensenhat, e suspen aquel am oncis, e excorja la codena de tota part am facilitat, e guarda la pel o sac, si podes, sobre aquel e extraguas aquela sania am le node.	thus with what you have been taught; suspend that with pins, and scrape the membrane away from all parts with ease, and guard the skin or sack, if possible, over it, and withdraw that pus along with the node.
Mays si es romput en la operacio, no es possible extrayre aquela sana, e motas veguadas endeve aquo, e lahoras tu la extratz a pessas entro que de lu no romangua denguna causa.	But if it is ruptured in the operation, it is not possible to withdraw that pus; instead do so at intervals so that no cause remains behind.
Quar si de lu roman denguna causa, pauc o trop, le node retorne segon le mays.	For if any cause remains behind, little or much, the node will return according to the most.
E si tu vezes que de lu roman alcuna part petita, lahoras comple la plagua de alcunas polveras corrosivas agudas e strenh la plagua, e pausa sobre aquela que sede apostema caut, e cura aquel del autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And if you see that some small part remains behind, then complete the wound with some powdered corrosive drugs, and bind the wound tightly, and place something hot over the abscess, and cure it by another method until it is healed.
E si es node gran, lahoras tu cus las doas labias de lu e cura aquel am aquo que encarna.	And if it is a large node, then cut both lips of it and cure that with what it was incarnated.
Mays si vena pulsatil es a lu contraria, o no-pulsatil, lahoras tu coyta e huemple le loc de zegi trissat que es vetriol e leyssa aquel streyt per dos dias o per tres entro que·s poyresca la plagua e que repause la ebullicio del sanc; e aprop retorna a inscindir aquo que es romas del node.	But if it comes with a pulsating vein, or not-pulsating, then you should cut and fill the area around it with powdered vitriol, and let that rest for two or three days until the swelling of the blood subsides; then return to cutting what is ruptured of the node.

De la cura de las mamillas dels homes las quals so asembladas de femnas.	Of the cure of men's breasts, which are similar to those of women.
Alcunas veguadas so infladas las mamillas de alcus homes deves le compliment del dormir cum comensan esser pellutz, e aprop so infladas las mamillas, e so asembladas las mamillas de las femnas, e romano apostemosas, lejas.	Sometimes the breasts of some men become enlarged due to a change in sleep habits when they start to grow hair, and then their breasts become swollen, resembling those of women, and they become roman-like.
E ad aquel que avoreys aquo, cove que inscidisca aquelas am seccio lunar segon aquesta forma, de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G., e aprop excorja la groceza tota, e aprop uempla la plagua de medicament encarnatiu, e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am cosidura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And when you examine that, cut it with a lunar incision from line B to line G, and then completely remove the growth, fill the wound with medicated plaster, sew together the two lips of the wound, and heal the patient.

But if the breast sags towards the sides and becomes soft like a woman's due to its size, then cut it in two along its sides with two lunar-shaped incisions, so that each half contains the other, as the longer line contains the shorter one, from line B to line G. Then remove the cord between the two lips of the wound, cut out the fat, and administer what we have said about sewing and powders, which are necessary in the cure, until it is healed.
E si tu non conpleysses la inscizio de aquo que cove inscidir per la inquietut del malaute, e per flux de sanc, lahoras cove que huemplas la plagua de coto submergit en enguent corrosiu e layssa aquel entro que aquo corroda que es romas de la grayssa, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if you do not complete the incision of that which must be cut for the restlessness of the patient and the flow of blood, then fill the wound with cotton soaked in corrosive ointment and leave it until it corrodes what is rotten inside, and then cure the patient until he is healed.
Capitol .xlviii.	Chapter 48.
De perforacio de apostemas que veno dejos le titillic.	Of piercing abscesses that come from below with itching.
Aquetz apostemas que veno dejos le titillic so de las specias de scrophulas, durs, las quals conte una pel que es sac.	Those abscesses that come from below with itching are of the species of scrofula, hard, and they contain a bag full of pus.

Capitol .xlix.	Chapter 49.
De seccio de apostemas que accideysso per arceria o per vena.	Of incisions of abscesses that happen through an artery or vein.
Quan arceria es rompuda, e la codena es consolidada la qual es sobre aquela, lahoras motas veguadas accideys apostema E les senhals per les quals es conoguda que imflamacio e apostema sian per la arteria o per vena: quar quan apostema es per arceria es lonc agreguat en le preon del cors; e que quan inpelleysses le apostema am les tieus ditz, sentes en lu quays sia stridor.	When an artery is broken and the vein is collapsed above it, then many times there is an abscess that happens through an artery or vein: when an abscess happens through an artery, it is long drawn out into the depth of the body; and when you push on the abscess with your fingers, you feel a sound in it that indicates stridor.
E aquel que es per vena es redon al manifest del cors.	And when it happens through a vein, it is round to the surface of the body.
E seccio sobre aquest apostema es error, e majorment en aquel que es dejos las aysselhas, e en les angonars, e en le col, e en motz locs del cors; e es mot gran, donc cove que la sua curacio am ferr sia esquivada, e aquel que es en las extramitatz, o al cap, cove que sia evitat.	And incision on this abscess is dangerous and especially in that which is below the armpits, and in the groin, and in the neck, and in many parts of the body; and it is large, therefore its cure by cautery should be avoided, and especially in that which is at the extremities, or to the head, it should be avoided.
Mays sobre aquel que es de lor per imflacio de l’orrifici de la arceria, scindeys en la codena seccio en le lonc; e aprop huebre la seccio am uncis e aprop la arceria, e deliura de las tunicas entro que sia descuberta.	But if it is due to inflammation of the orifice of the artery, cut an incision in the vein along its length; and then open the incision with pincers and the artery, and loosen the tunics so that they are uncovered.
E aprop met sobre aquel agulha e fay aquela penetrar entro al autre latz, e estrenh la arceria am fiel doble en dos locs, — la qual causa yeu a tu eyssenhegui en extraccio de doas arcerias les quals so en les templars.	And then put an awl on it and make it penetrate to the other side, and tighten the artery with a double-fold ligature in two places, which will cause you to push it out from both temples.
E aprop punh le loc le qual es entre dos liamentz am spatum entro que yesca le sanc tot que es en lu, e sia dissolvut le apostema.	And then plug up the hole between two ligaments with a spatula so that all the blood in it is stopped, and the abscess will be dissolved.
E aprop administra curacio en la qual es engendrat poyre entro que caian les liamentz; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz convenientz ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	And then administer cure in which pus is engendered within so that the ligaments fall down; and then cure it with suitable ointments until it is healed.
E si es apostema per seccio de vena, lahoras cove que tu tenguas am la tua ma aquo que es a tu possible del apostema am la codena, e aprop intromet la agulha dejos le loc le qual tu has tengut dejos la tua ma, e fay aquela penetrar; e sia en aquela fil doble entro que tu extraguas aquel del autre latz, e aprop ligua le apostema am bo liament segon que yeu he dit a tu en le liament de uva4 de doas partz am doas extremitatz del fil.	And if it is an abscess through an incision of a vein, then you should hold with your hand what is possible for the abscess over the vein, and then insert the awl below where you have held with your hand, and make it penetrate; and there will be a double ligature within so that you draw out from the other side, and then tie the abscess with a strong ligature according to what we have said to you in the ligature of two parts with two ends.
Mays si temes que extraguam le fil, lahoras entromet le fiel am aquela agula dejos tot le apostema deves la inscizio de la agulha primieyra, e strenh les tieus fiels en quatre locs.	But if you fear that drawing out the ligature, then insert the needle below all of the abscess after the incision of the first needle, and tighten your fingers in four places.
Aprop secca le apostema en le mieg loc de lu entro que quan es yssit aquo que es en lu, lahoras tu inscideys la superfluitat de la codena, e layssa aquo que de lu es liat.	Then dry up the abscess in its middle part where it has risen so that what is in it is pushed out, and then insert the superfluity of the vein, and leave what is inside it.
E aprop pausa sobre lu pulvil le qual has submergit en vi e oli, e aprop administra la curacio la qual es fayta am calguas e enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then place on it powder which you have soaked in wine and oil, and then administer the cure that is made with cauterizations and ointments until it is healed.
Capitol l del apostema le qual accideys per torcio de nervis.	Chapter 50 of the abscess which happens through torture of nerves.
Ayssi cum accideys apostema en arceria e en vena, e semblantment accideys apostema en les nervis quan accideys en lor percussio o accideys per trebal superfluable, e per semblantz.	As it happens in an artery and vein, and similarly, an abscess happens in nerves when they happen in their compression or happen through a superfluous strike, and similarly.
E es fayt le mays de lu en les locs dels adjutoris o del talo, o en tot loc en le qual so maugudas las juncturas.	And it is done to them in the places of the joints or in the talons, or in any place where the joints are crushed.
E es apostema greu, e es asemblat a la color del autre cors, e es en las majors de lu disposicios ses de lor e quan es streyt am vehementia, sent en lu le malaute semblant stupor.	And it is a severe pustule, and is similar in color to the rest of the body, and there are six of them on his body, and when they are pressed with force, the patient seems stunned.
E no es apostema agreguat en le preon del cors, e per so es dejos la codena, e el es maugut a tota partida e no va a las partidas denant ni detras.	And the pustule is not located in the chest area, but below the neck, and he is painful all over his body, and does not want to move forward or backward.
Donc aquo de aquels que es en las juncturas no cove que sia envasit am ferr, quar fort leu endevenguera contracio.	Therefore, for those who have the pustules in their joints, it is not necessary to use a cautery of iron, since they will soon recover on their own.
Mays aquel que es en le cap o en le front fen la codena am spatum.	However, if the pustule is on the head or forehead and affecting the eyes, treat it with spathum.
Mays si es apostema pauc, lahoras te aquel am les forfecs e abscindeys aquel de razitz.	But if there are few pustules, then cut them out with forceps at their roots.
E si es gran, lahoras tu le suspen am unci, e excorja aquel, e aprop osta aquel; e ajusta la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if it is large, then open it with a scalpel, and clean out the wound; and stop the bleeding with a tourniquet, and stitch up the wound; and dress the wound so that it may heal.
Capitol .li.	Chapter 11.
De seccio de apostema le qual accideys de cheil que accideys al ventre.	Of the section of a pustule which happens to the jaw, which happens in the belly.
Endeveno ad alcus homes motas veguadas en les ventres de aquels e en las autras partidas del cors de aquels theils les quals son apelatz funguals per similitut de aquels am funges, dels quals la razitz es subtil e·l cap de aquel es gros; e ja las labias de aquels so conversas, e es de aquels que es petit, e es de aquels que es mot magnificat.	It happens to some people that they get spots on their bellies and other parts of the body, which are called warts due to their resemblance to mushrooms, whose roots are subtle but whose tops are thick; and indeed the lips of these people become withered, and it is found in those who are small, and also in those who are greatly magnified.
E yeu ja e vist un, e en le ventre de lu eran dos theils les quals eran mays a funges semblantz, e no era diferencia entre aquels blancs, de menuda razitz.	And I have seen one like this, and on his belly were two things which were most similar to mushrooms, and there was no difference between them and white ones, except that their roots were thinner.
E ja las labias de aquels eran enversadas e se fendian, e humiditat corria de aquel tot temps.	And indeed the lips of these people were withered and cracked, and moisture flowed from them all the time.
Donc yeu inscidegui aquels e atrobegui en la un en pes quays xviii unc. e l’autre quays vi unc.	Therefore I cut into one of them and found in its inside a stone weighing 15 ounces. And the other one weighed 6 ounces.
E la operacio en la inscizio de lor es que consideres lahoras si·l malaute es humit, e la color de atheil es blanca, humit, de subtil razitz; lahoras tu le inscideys am spatum lat, e sian en la presencia tua cauteris en le foc, quar motas veguadas deves la seccio de lu es expellit mot sanc; e si te ventz le sanc, cauteriza aquel.	And when you cut into it, consider whether the patient is humid or dry, and if the color of the stone is white, humid, and of thin roots, then open it with a broad scalpel, and let it be cauterized in the fire, because much blood will flow from the wound; and if the blood flows, cauterize it.
E si vezes le malaute pauruc e temeros, guarda te de inscizio am ferr; mays lahoras pren fiel de plom recent fayt, e strenh am aquel atheil, la manieyra del qual es aquela que havem dita; e leyssa aquel per dos dias.	And if you see the patient is fearful and frightened, be cautious about cutting with iron; but instead take fresh lead ore, and apply it to the stone in the manner we have described; and let that sit for two days.
E aprop ajusta en la strictura del fil de plom; donc, no cesses strenher le plom granre devetz en theil, entro que sia abscindit e cayha per se ses trebalh.	And then tighten it in the grip of the lead wire; therefore do not cease to press down on the large lump until it is cut off and falls away by itself.
Mays si theil es de grossa razitz, lahoras en la inscizio de lu es alcuna causa de temor e de paor, e majorment en aquel que es en le ventre.	But if the stone has thick roots, then in the cutting of it there is a cause for fear and dread, especially in that which is in the belly.
Mays possibla es que tu inscindas la maytat de lu , e aprop cauteriza aquel per que no retorne.	But it is possible that you can cut only half of it, and then cauterize it so that it does not return.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanada la plagua.	And then dress the wound so that it may heal.
E guarda te que tu no presumas inscidir theil le qual es de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, de leg reguardament, quar aquel es absi cancros.	And beware of cutting a stone which is of dusky color, of little feeling, and with little regard to the body, because that one is full of cancer.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio de cranc aprop aysso.	And I will bring up the memory of a certain cranium.
Capitol .lii.	Chapter 12.
De curacio de eminencia del umbilic.	Of the treatment of protrusion of the navel.
Eminencia del umbilic es fayta per motas causas; o per fissuras del ciphac le qual es sobre le ventre, e yeys de lu la tela o budel segon que endeve en las autras rupturas; o per sanc le qual flueys de vena o de arceria segon que es denant dit, o per ventositat coarctada en lu.	Protrusion of the navel is caused by many things; or by fissures of the diaphragm which is above the belly, and from it the membrane or intestine, depending on where the other ruptures are; or by blood which flows from a vein or artery according to what is before us, or by constriction of the intestines within it.
Mays si es per fissura del ciphac e per yssiment de la tela, lahoras la color del apostema es semblant a la color del cors; e es leon ses dolor, e aprop appar de divers situament.	But if it is by a fissure of the diaphragm and loosening of the membrane, then the color of the pustule is similar to that of the body; and there is little pain with it, and indeed it appears in various places.
E si es per egressio del budel, lahoras le situament de aquel am lu de aquo que havem recontat, de mays vehement diversitat, e cum tu premes aquel am les tieus ditz es occultat, e aprop retorna; e fort leu es am lu so, e es magnificat mot deves le introt de banh e vehement trebalh.	And if it is by protrusion of the intestine, then its appearance will be as we have described, with more violent variation, and when you press it with your fingers, it hides itself, and then returns; and soon it is found again, and is greatly magnified due to bathing and violent exertion.
Mays si per humiditat, lahoras es leon e no es occultat quan premes am la tua ma, ni es constrengut, ni es cregut.	But if it is by moisture, then there is little pain and it does not hide when you press it with your hand, nor is it constricted or crushed.
E si es per sanc, lahoras am aquestz senhals apareys le apostema a negror declinant.	And if it is by blood, then there appear with these signs the pustule inclining towards blackness.
Mays si es per carn nada, lahoras es apostema greu, gros e dur, e es ficat segon una quantitat.	But if it is by dry flesh, then it is a severe pustule, large and hard, and is fixed according to its amount.
Mays si es per ventositat, lahoras le tocament de lu es leon.	But if it is by intestinal protrusion, then there is little pain when touched.
E la operacio en lu es que consideras lahoras si la eminencia de l’umbilic es per sanc de arceria, o de vena, o per ventositat; lahoras cove que sias prohibit de la curacio de lu, quar en aquela es temor e paor ayssi cum t’e ensenhat en le capitol en le qual he dit les apostemas per arceria e per vena.	And in its treatment, you should consider whether the protrusion of the navel is by blood from an artery or vein, or by intestinal protrusion; therefore it behoves you to abstain from treating it, because there is fear and dread in that one as we have taught in the chapter where we spoke about pustules from an artery and a vein.
E si la eminencia del umbilic es per le budel o per la tela, lahoras cove que comandes al malaute que tengua le ale sieu, e sia stant extendut; e aprop senha am tenta en le circuit de tot le umbilic, e aprop comanda a lu que stia envers entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos, e aprop circunda am spatum lat en le circuit del umbilic sobre le loc le qual has senhat am la tenta; e aprop exten la maytat del apostema a las partidas desus am unci gran; e aprop lia en le circuit am fiel fort o am ceda e la manieyra del liar decent.	And if the protrusion of the navel is by the intestine or membrane, then have the patient lean back and stand extended; and indeed touch with your fingers around the entire navel, and indeed command him to stand facing you with his chest against your chest, and indeed circle with a broad scalpel around the navel over the area which you have touched with your fingers; and indeed extend the pustule towards the upper parts with a large needle; and indeed ligate around it with strong thread or with twine in a decent manner.
E aprop huebre le mieg del apostema extendut sobre le liament e intromet le dit tieu en aquel indic e quereys le budel; e si tu l’as atrobat ni guardat per le liament, lahoras tu extratz alxorati e impelleys le budel a las partidas dedintz del ventre.	And then open the middle of the extended pustule over its ligament and put your finger inside that hole and probe the intestine; and if you have blocked it or restrained it by the ligament, then indeed withdraw your fingers and push the intestine towards the interior parts of the belly.
E si has atrobada la tela, lahoras pren aquel am unci; e inscideys las superfluitatz de lu.	And if you have blocked the membrane, then take it with a needle; and cut off the superfluities of it.
Mays si es contraria a tu arceria o vena, lahoras circunda aquel mot, e aprop retorna a la tua operacio; e pren dos agulhas e met en aquelas dos fiels fortz e entromet dos agulhas en le circuit le qual has feyt entorn le apostema en manieyra de crotz, las quals fassas penetrar; e aprop strenh le apostema en quatre partidas sobre las agulhas.	But if it is opposite your artery or vein, then surround it a lot, and then return to your operation; and take two needles and put them in those two strong threads and put the two needles around the pustule in the form of crosses, the which you make to penetrate; and then tighten the pustule into four parts over the needles.
E si tu vols, osta las agulhas e leyssa le loc entro que poyresca la carn extenduda e caia per si; o inscideys aquel quan es subtiliat e se poyreys, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And if you want, remove the needles and let the extended flesh return to its position and fall by itself; or cut into it when it is thinned out and probed, and then dress that with what we have spoken of as a poultice onto the wound until it is healed.
E si la eminencia del ombilic es de carn nada en lu o per humiditat, lahoras cove que tu conquaves le apostema ayssi cum havem dit e estraguas le sanc o la humiditat, la qual atrobas en lu, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove e que consolide le loc.	And if the protrusion of the navel is by dry flesh in it or by moisture, then indeed you should suck out the pustule as we have said and draw out the blood or moisture which you block in it, and then dress that with what covers it so that it consolidates the wound.

De curacio de cranc.	Of the treatment of a cranium.
Ja havem dit, en la divisio, de specia de cranc e en qual manieyra es via a la curacio de lu am medicinas, e que es squivador en lu la curacio am ferr per so que no sia ulcerat; e havem dit cranc engendrat en la mayra e cautela de la curacio de lu.	We have already said in the division of a cranium and how it is the way to its cure by medicines, and that it is cut off in it the cure by iron so that it is not ulcerated; and we have spoken of a cranium engendered in the mother and cautery of its cure.
E diyssero les antics que alcunas veguadas cranc es en loc on es possibla la eradicacio de lu, ayssi cum de cran le qual es en las mamillas o en la coyssa e a lor semblantz dels membres allocat a estrayre tot aquel, e majorment quan es comensant petit.	And the ancients say that some times a cranium is found in a place where its eradication is possible, like a cranium which is on the chest or the buttock and similar to the members assigned to extract all of it, especially when it starts small.
Mays quan es antiquat e es gra, no cove que te propries a lu, quar yeu non pogui sanar de aquel alcu ni no he vist autre, ni que sia pervengut ad aquo.	But when it is old and severe, do not approach the patient, for I have not seen anyone heal from that illness nor do I know of anyone who has recovered from it.
E la operacio en lu es quan es allocat ayssi cum havem dit, es que tu precedescas e laysses le malaute e purgues de colera negra alcunas veguadas, e aprop sagna aquel, si es atrobada replecio manifesta.	And the operation on him is that you proceed and let the patient bleed and purge black bile several times, and then cut into him, if there is found a full, manifest hernia.
E aprop prepara le malaute am preparacio en le qual sia locat am operacio, e aprop prohiceys en le trauc uncis les quals cove ad aquel; e aprop concava de tota part am la codena sego bona perexcrutacio entro que no romangua alcuna causa de las razitz de lu.	Then prepare the patient with preparation in which he is placed for operation, and then pierce the wound with nails that suit it; and then hollow out from all parts with a good saw, thorough examination within so that no cause of the disease remains.
E layssa correr le sanc, e no abscidas aquel leugierament, e exprem les locs, e abstergeys le sanc gros tot am la tua ma o am instrument am le qual es a tu possible dels instruments.	And let the blood flow, and do not bandage it loosely, and press out the places, and wipe off the thick blood with your hand or with an instrument that is suitable to you among your instruments.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat de sanc gros inscizio de vena o de arceria, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que·l flux del sanc sia cessat, e aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	But if the flow of thick blood from a vein or artery gives you trouble, then cauterize that inside so that the flow of blood is stopped, and then treat it with another treatment until it is healed.
Capitol .liv.	Chapter 44
De curacio de ydropici.	Of treatment for dropsy.
Nos ja havem recomtat, en la divisio, de las specias de ydropici de l’aygua, e les senhals de quascuna especia, de la curacio de lu am medicinas.	We have already recommended in the division of the species of dropsy with water, and the characteristics of each species, of its treatment with medicines.
E aquela la qual es curada am ferr no es sino la specia de althitas sola, e no es aproximat am ferr a la specia de timpanistres ni a la especia de yposarcha, quar aquo es mortal.	And that which is cured with iron is only the species of altithas alone, and it must not be approached with iron to the species of tympany nor to the species of hyparka, because it is deadly.
E quan tu ja has medicat aquesta especia de ydropici timpanistre am medicinas e no comfereys la tua medicacio, lahoras considera, quar si al malaute ja es conseguida debelitat, o es am aquel autra malautia otra ydropici, ayssi cum si es en lu tos o cos de ventre e semblant ad aquels, lahoras guarda te que no le mediques am ferr, quar temor es sobre aquo.	And when you have treated this species of tympany with medicines and it does not respond to your treatment, then consider, because if the patient already has debility, or has another disease such as another dropsy, like one in which there is cough or chest or abdominal pain and similar diseases, then beware that you do not treat them with iron, for fear of that.
Mays si tu vezes le malaute de vertut exuberant, e am lu no es autra malautia sino ydropici tant solament, e no enfant ni vielh, lahoras la manieyra de la operacio de lu es que tu eleves le malaute entre las tuas mas, e le ministre aprop lu exprema le ventre de lu am la sua ma, enpellen la aygua a la partida dejos del pentenilh, e aprop pren spatum spinos segon aquesta forma:	But if you see the patient in robust health, and with no other disease but dropsy alone, and not a child or old man, then the manner of operation on him is that you elevate the patient between your hands, and then press his abdomen with your hand, filling the water to the bottom of the navel, and then take thorny ash wood according to this form:
sia de dos partz agudas lonc, de aguda extremitat ayssi cum spatum; mays empero sia en lu alcuna brevitat petit a petit, per so que en la operacio am aquel no passes entro al budel, e que ledas aquel.	let it be of two pointed parts long, with a pointed end like ash wood; but let there be in it some small brevity from time to time, so that in the operation with it you do not pass into the intestines, and let him drink that.
E aprop considera si la generacio de ydropici es de part dels budels, quar lahoras cove que tu am la seccio te alonhes del ombelic per la quantitat de tres ditz a las partidas dejos, en le dreyt de lu sobre le pentenilh.	And then consider if the generation of dropsy is from part of the intestines, because then you must with section elongate the navel from the bottom, in the right of him over the navel.
Mays si la generacio de hydropici es per malautia del fietge, lahoras la tua seccio sia sinistra del ombilic per tres ditz.	But if the generation of dropsy is from disease of the liver, then your section must be on the left of the navel by three fingers.
E si la generacio de lu es per la melsa, lahoras la tua seccio sia en le las dreyt.	And if its generation is from melasma, then your section should be on the right.
E no cove que la tua seccio sia sobre le costat sobre le qual vol jaser le malaute per que no corron las superfluitatz ad aquel loc freul.	And do not let your section be over the side where the patient wants to lie so that the superfluities do not flow to that place.
E aprop perfora am le instrument tota la codena, e aprop entromet en aquela seccio, e eleva la tua ma am le spatum entre la codena e·l siphac, e tu excorja aquel; e si’ la quantitat de una ungla o enviro.	Then pierce with the instrument throughout the cavity, and insert into that section, and elevate your hand with the ash wood between the cavity and the pharynx, and drain him; and if it is the quantity of a nail or more.
E aprop perforo le ciphac entro que pervengua le spatum al loc vuoyt, e es loc de l’aygua.	Then pierce the pharynx so that the ash wood reaches the desired location, and it is where the water is.

e es semblant a canula de argent subtil; es fayt de argent o de eram o de lato leon, al qual en la partida pus bassa de lu es un petit trauc, e en les costatz de lu so tres traucs: dos de una partida e un del autra partida; e fayta es la extremitat de lu insciza segon la manieyra de pluma, ayssi cum vezes:	and it is like a tube of silver or gold or lead, to which in the lower end there is a small hole, and on its sides are three holes: two from one side and one from the other side; and its end is beveled according to the manner of a feather, as follows:
E en la extramitat de lu pus sobirana es armilla, quar quan le instrument perve al aygua, lahoras aquela tantost deysen sobre le instrument, donc evacua de l’aygua en la ora miega quantitat, quar si tu evacuas de aquela mes que no cove en la hora, fort leu mor le malaute per resolucio del sieu spirit animal, o accideys a lu cincopi que es appropinquada la mort.	And at the upper end of it there is a ring, because when the instrument reaches the water, then that immediately withdraws over the instrument, therefore evacuates from the water in the middle quantity, for if you evacuate from that more than it should not in the hour, then the patient dies from resolution of his animal spirit, or he suffers five pains which are approaching death.
Mays evacua de aquela segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu e segon que significan a tu las disposicios del malaute de la vertut del pols de lu e de la bontat de lu.	But it evacuates from that according to the quantity of his strength and according to what you see are the dispositions of the patient's strength, from his pulse and his goodness.
E aprop extrats le instrument, e rete l’aygua la qual causa es quar tantost es retenguda per la codena la qual rete le trauc que es sobre le ciphac del qual e recomtat a tu que perfores aquel segon aquela manieyra.	Then withdraw the instrument and tie up the water which causes it because as soon as it is tied by the cavity, then the hole that is over the pharynx from which you have pierced that according to that manner.
E aprop itera le instrument al autra dia si vezes le malaute tollerant aquo, e extratz de la aygua petita quantitat, e fay aquo per alcus jorns sobre temor, e guarda te de error entro que no romangua de l’aygua sino pauc.	Then return the instrument on another day if he can tolerate it, and withdraw a little water, and do this for several days out of fear, and beware of error so that it does not return to the water except for a little.
Mays si tu temes sobre le malaute, e leyssas de l’aygua gran quantitat, lahoras cura aquel am sepultura en arena cauda, e mota suzor en banh, e al solelh espere per lonc temps; e cura aquel am medicinas dessicativas entro que sia sanat.	But if you fear for the patient and let out of the water a large quantity, then treat him with dry medicines so that he is healed.
E cauteriza sobre le stomac, e la melsa e·l fitge aprop la extraccio de l’aygua, segon que yeu he recontat en aquo que es precedit.	And cauterize over the stomach, and the melasma and the liver, and also the extraction of the water according to what I have recounted in that which precedes.

De la curacio dels enfants les quals so natz les locs de la urina no-perforatz.	Of the treatment for children who are born with holes not punctured in their urine places.
Alcunas veguadas alcun dels enfantz es eyssi del ventre de la sua mayre e·l cap de la sua mixtio no es perforat (o es trauc streyt o no es en son loc).	Sometimes some of the infants are born from their mother's womb and the tip of their genitals is not punctured (or is tightly drawn or is not in its place).
Donc cove coytar am perforacio de lu tantost que es nascut am spatum mot subtil segon aquesta forma:	Then it must be treated with piercing of it as soon as he is born with a very subtle pointed instrument according to this form:
E aprop pausa en le trauc un clavil subtil de plom e ligua aquel, e te per tres jorns o per .iiii.tre.	Then insert into the hole a thin nail of lead and ligature it, and leave it for three days or for 4 days.

But those in which the hole is not in its place, because of that from which he is born and the tip is drawn out, the cause is that from them, that which is born and the tip is drawn out, there is a defect at the end of the tip of the penis so that it cannot urinate into the places inside, because it lifts up the penis with its hand to the places above; and it is not generation, so that the sperm cannot reach the mother according to rectitude, and it is a very harmful disease.

And the manner of operation on him is that the patient be bent over his chest, and then stretch out the tip of his penis with your left hand by a vigorous pull, and insert the tip of the tube into the place of the foreskin like a feather, or you cut some part, so that the meatus comes like the tip of the penis and that the hole falls into the middle place according to what it should.

Capitol .lvi.	Chapter 46
De albater le qual accideys en le prepucii en le cap de la vergua e de corropcio e negror e adherencia del prepucii del cap de la vergua.	Of whitlow which happens in the foreskin on the tip of the penis and of swelling and blackness and adhesion of the foreskin to the tip of the penis.
Motas veguadas accideys aquest albater en la vergua e es eminencia de carn laga.	Many times this white swelling appears on the penis, and it is an eminence of flesh that protrudes.
E de aquela una es maligna e autra es no-maligna.	And one is malignant, and the other is non-malignant.
No-maligna, cove que suspendas am unci subtil e abscindas aquela entro que aquela mondes tota; e aprop pausa sobre aquela coto submirgit en enguent egipciac; e aprop aquel, cura le am enguent diafinicon entro que sia sanat.	Non-malignant: apply a thin ointment and cut out that part within which the swelling is located entirely; then place on that wound Egyptian ointment; then the wound will be healed with an ointment of diafinicon.
E si albater es maligna, de lega color, lahoras cove que tu aministres cauteri aprop la inscizio de lu e la razio de lu.	And if the swelling is malignant, i.e., changing colour, then you should administer a cautery near its beginning and end.
Mays si albater es en le prepuci del cap de la vergua no-circumcis, e la una partida de albater es dedintz le prepucii e l’autra partida es defora, lahoras cove que tu ostes albater le qual es dedintz al comensament entro que es consolidat; e lahora tu cura aquel deforo, quar quan tu curas aquel ensemps le prepuci, no es asegurat que no sia trinquat.	But if the swelling is on the foreskin of the head of the penis and one part of the swelling is inside the foreskin and the other part outside, then you should open the swelling which is inside at its beginning until it is consolidated; then you cure that which is outside because if you cure both parts simultaneously, there will be a risk of tearing.
E ja eysamen accideys en les genetius e en le prepuci negror e corruccio, adonc cove que tu conquavas tot aquo que ja es denigrat e que ja se vol corrompre o que ja es corrumput; e aprop lineys sobre aquel aprop aquo am mel, le qual es contusit am farina de scorsa de milgrana e de errs trissatz e crivellatz.	And I have seen this happen to the testicles and the foreskin, turning black and rotten, so then you should cut away everything that is already discoloured or about to rot or is rotten; then you apply an ointment over it made from ground pomegranate peel mixed with flour and sifted through a sieve.
E aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sana.	Then heal that with another cure until it is healed.
Mays si endeve flux de sanc, lahoras aministra cauteri lunar segon aquesta forma:	But if blood flows from there, then administer lunar cautery as follows:
quar cauteri juvatiu es a dos disposicios ensemps, so es a flux de sanc e a la plagua quan es corrumpuda.	For cautery helps in two ways simultaneously, i.e., for the flow of blood and for the plague when it is rotten.
E si le cap de la vergua es corrodut e es destruit tot en la hora, lahoras cove que tu intrometas en lo meat del prepucii una canula de plom per so que le malaute urina per aquela.	And if the head of the penis is eaten away and destroyed entirely at once, then you should insert a lead catheter into the foreskin so that the patient urinates through it.
En la adherencia del prepucii am le cap de la vergua (et aquesta adherencia no accideys sino en aquel del qual le prepucii es sa, e sobre lu no es exhigida circumcizio; e quan accideys adherencia per plagua o per apostema) cove que excorjas am spatum obtus entro que sia dissolvut le liament e sia deliurat le cap de la vergua de tota partida.	In the adhesion of the foreskin to the head of the penis (and this adhesion does not happen except in those whose foreskin is intact, and for whom circumcision is not performed; and when the adhesion happens due to a plague or an abscess), you should scrape with a blunt spatula until the bond is dissolved and the head of the penis is freed from every side.
E si es dificil desirnir aquelas exquisidament, lahoras cove que tu excorjes am spatum alcuna causa del cap de la vergua e del prepucii, e aysso es quar le prepucii, quan es subtil, fort leu es perforat per la sua subtilitat leugierament.	And if it is difficult to pull them apart, then you should scrape with a spatula the head of the penis and the foreskin because sometimes the foreskin, when it is thin, easily pierces through its thinness.
E aprop separa entre·l prepucii e·l cap de la vergua am dra7 de li subtil, le qual ja es mulhat en l’aygua frega per que no adherescan autra veguada.	Then separate between the foreskin and the head of the penis with a thin cloth which is moistened with water so that they do not adhere to each other again.
E aprop sia curat am vi stiptic entro que sia consolidat.	And let it be healed with a styptic ointment until it is consolidated.
Capitol .lvii.	Chapter .LVII.
De mundificacio dels enfants e de la curacio de aquo que accideys ad aquels de circumcisio.	Of purification of children and of the cure for those who are circumcised.
Circumcisio no es solucio de continuitat ayssi cum las autras plaguas: mays empero cum sia de la nostra operacio e de nostra voluntat, e lus de aquela sia propriament en les enfants, es necessari que asignem en aquela milhor operacio e via pus leugiera perdusent a salut.	Circumcision is not a cure for continence like other plagues; however, since it comes from our action and will, and the more so because it happens to children, we should assign to it better action and easier loss of health.
Donc dic que les antics no diyssero circumcisio en alcu dels lors libres, quar no n’usan en las suas leys, e no es sino quar havem aquisit per speriment, la qual causa es que yeu he atrobat la major partida dels artifexs e dels barbies usar circumcisir e mundificacio am novacula e am torores; e usan de liament am fiel e de inscizio am la ungla.	Hence I say that the ancient doctors did not prescribe circumcision for any of their patients because they do not use it in their laws, and it is only that we have acquired it through experience, which is that I have found most of the artisans and butchers using to circumcise and purify with a knife and with torches; they use resin as ointment and for incision they use fingernails.
E yeu ja he prohadas totas aquestas manieras e no atrobegui milhor mondificacio am forfexs, am liament am fiel que en mondificacio cum la ungla, quar motas vetz efugeys la codena pus desus, quar la codena del prepucii a dos tunicas, e roman la tonica pus dejos, e fort leu es forsat ad autra inscizio e dolor sicura.	And I have prohibited all these ways and found better purification with tweezers, and ointment of resin that is used in purification with fingernails because many times the foreskin escapes upwards, since the foreskin has two layers, and the one below pulls it down and forces another incision and a sure pain.
E am mundificacio le qual es fayta per alphecati, e es digital, del qual usan les sabatiers, no es segurada la inscizio de la extremitat del membre viril, quar fort leu intra en le trau de lu.	And the purification which is done by apothecaries and is digital, that is used by the butchers, does not secure the incision of the end of the male member because it easily goes into its channel.
Mays en la operacio am ungla, fort leu obazeys ferr e corromp la tua operacio.	But in the operation with fingernails, iron and corruption often cause your operation to fail.
E la codena del enfant es breu per natura, e motas veguadas nays en tal manieyra que no ha necessitat de mondificacio, e yeu he vist aquel.	And the foreskin of a child is short by nature, and many times it happens in such a way that circumcision is not needed, and I have seen this.
Mays de la mondificacio que·s fa am forfexs e liamentz am fiel, la bontat, experiment descrobic a mi, quar las forfexs so de proporcional inscizio, per aquo quar la acuitat que es desus es ayssi cum la acuitat que es dejos; e donc cum tu premes la tua ma so proporcionadas dos acuitatz, e inscideysso segon una comperacio en un temps; e es fayta compressio del fiel am figura contenent la codena de la vergua de tota partida, am le qual no catz error de tot.	But of the purification that is done with tweezers and ointment of resin, its goodness, experience has shown me because the tweezers are according to a proportionate incision, therefore when you press your hand so that two acute angles are formed, and you insert them according to a comparison in one go; then compression of the resin is made into the shape containing the foreskin of the penis from every side without any error.
E la manieyra de la operacio primeyra es que tu fassas estar le enfant majorment si es de aquels que entendo un petit, que no fassas sino que tu lies le fiel en la sua vergua tant solament, e que leysses aquel entro al autra dia.	And the way of the first operation is that you let the child be mostly upright if he is one of those whom I understand to be a little small, and you do not lie down but only apply the resin on his penis so that it lies within him until the next day.
E aprop fay aquel alegrar en tota aquela manieyra que es a tu possibla de aquo que recep la sua intelligencia.	Then let him rejoice in all those ways that are possible for you to receive his understanding.
E aprop fa aquel estar entre las tuas mas estatuir preparadament, e no sia ges cezent; e occulta las forfexs en la tua ma o dejos le tieu pe, que l’enfant no veia aquelas ni degun autre dels instruments.	Then let him be between your hands, set up prepared, and not tremble; and conceal the tweezers in your hand or below your foot so that the child does not see those nor any of the other instruments.
E aprop entremet la tua ma a la vergua de lu e suffla en la codena, e tira aquela entro que sia eyssit le cap de la vergua, e aprop mondifica aquel de aquo que es agregat en ela de sordicia.
