E aprop le malaute sia resupinat sobre le sieu dos, e eleva las suas cambas en sus e pausa dejos lu un cuer sobre le qual ja so les homes o un lansol; e aprop unta la extramitat del cauteri am oli o am album de huou o am mucellage de fenugrec o de semblantz; e aprop entromet aquel en le cul am facilitat, e aprop le ministre prengua la borsa e exprema aquel am doas mas e essemps am vehemencia entro que sia evacuat en le budelh tot aquo que es en le cristeri; e aprop extra le cristeri e le malaute leva las suas cambas a la paret.	And let the patient be reclined on his back, and raise his legs up and place underneath him a bed on which there are already men or a bedpan; and then anoint the end of the cautery with oil or with white of egg or with mucilage of fenugreek or of similar things; and then insert that into the buttock with ease, and let the minister hold the bag and squeeze it with both hands and press with strength between them until everything that is in the relief is evacuated into the intestine; and then take out the relief and let the patient lift his legs to the wall.
E si la medicina forsa aquel a eyssiment, tengua le tant quant poyra; e si dorm am aquel per tota una nueyt, es mays derier en juvament.	And if the medicine forces that out, let him hold it as much as he can; and if he sleeps with that for an entire night, it is better to wait in healthiness.
Mays si tu cristerizas aquel en las malautias de solucio de ventre e l’eyssiment de lu le coyta, lahoras tu itera le cauteri entro que sia sanat.	But if you relieve that in the illnesses of soluation of belly and its outflow cuts it, then you repeat the cautery until it is healed.
E si en le cul so emorroydas o apostemas ledens, lahoras sia le cristeri mot subtil e leon, dels cristeris am les quals les enfantz so criterisatz.	And if in the buttocks are hemorrhoids or painful bumps, then let the relief be very thin and closed, of those reliefs by which children are relieved.
De curacio de las plaguas.	Of the cure of the ulcers.
Yeu ja e dit en la divisio de la curacio de las plaguas aquo que convenia al libre, e yeu dic assi la curacio de aquelas am ma e am medicinas segon le conpliment.	I have already said in the division of the cure of ulcers what suited the liver, and so I say the cure of those with hand and medicines according to the completion.
Donc dic que las plaguas son diversificadas segon aquo en que son faytas las plaguas e segon le loc sobre le qual cazo las plaquas.	Therefore I say that ulcers are diversified according to what they are made of and according to the place on which the plaque has fallen.
E las causas per que motas vetz son faytas las plaguas so ayssi cum getament de peyra, o inscisio d’espaza o de cotel, o percussio am lansa, o am fustz, o am sageta, o semblantz ad aquels de motas causas.	And the causes for which many times ulcers are made are thus with stone's bruising or incision of a sword or spear, or blow with a staff or arrow, or similar things to those from many causes.
Mays las plaguas que so en les locz del cos so ayssi cum plagua la qual catz sobre le cap, o·l col, o·l pietz, o·l ventre, o·l fitge, e semblantz ad aquels dels membres.	But the ulcers that are in places of the body are thus with plaque which falls on the head or neck or foot or belly or hip and similar things to those of the members.
E yeu so recomtant la curacio de alcunas plaguas per que pauses aquela ratiocinacio e regla sobre las autras plaguas.	And I am commanding the cure for some ulcers that you ponder that reflection and rule on the other ulcers.
E yeu comensare de las plaguas del cap simplas, quar la rememoracio de las compostas vindra al comensament del tertz capitol.	And I will begin with simple ulcers of the head because the memory of the compounded ones will come at the beginning of the third chapter.
Donc dic que quan accideys en le cap plagua simpla e no es fractura, lahoras considera: si es per getament de peyra o de semblant, e ja ha trinquada la codena tant solament e es gran plagla e temes sobre aquel malaute havinement de apostema caut, lahoras tu te coyta e fleubotoma la cephalica tantost, e no tardas aquo; e extrats ad aquel del sanc segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu si no mes alcuna causa prohibent de fleubotomia, majorment si·l sanc que es eyssit de la plagua es pauc.	Therefore I say that when it happens in the head simple plaque and there is not a fracture, then consider: if it is with bruising of stone or similar thing, and already the tendon has only been stretched and it is great plaque and you fear over that patient having hemorrhoid cauterization, then you cut and phlebolize the cephalalgia right away, and do not delay that; and draw from him blood according to the quantity of his strength if there is not any prohibitive cause of phlebotomy, especially if the blood which comes out of the plaque is little.
E sia la flaubotomia del contrari de la partida plaguada; e guardase le malaute de replecio e de vi e de viandas grossas.	And let the phlebotomy be on the opposite side of the part which is plastered; and let the patient abstain from repletion and wine and thick foods.
Mays si de la minuicio prohibeys alcuna causa, lahoras sia aminorat de la vianda e no apropinque a carn ni a vi.	But if because of the minor cause any prohibition, then let him be diminished in food and not approach meat or wine.
E pausa sobre la plagua, si a lu accideys apostema caut, coto enfus en oli rozat solet o en vi en le qual es stipticat.	And place on the plaque, if to him happens hemorrhoid cauterization, cut it in boiling oil only or in wine in which is dried.
Mays si est segur de apostema caut, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua, si es recent am le sieu sanc e le ayre no ha mudat aquela la polvera la qual yeu recomtare aprop petit.	But if he is sure of hemorrhoid cauterization, then place on the plaque if it is fresh with his blood and the air has not changed that powder which I recommend then smaller.
E si le ayre ja ha mudada aquela, lahoras pausa sobre alscus enguentz entro que sia sanada.	And if the air has already changed that, then place on it dry alkanet until it is healed.
Mays si la plagua es gran o es per inscizio d’espaza e de semblantz, e no so ajustadas las labias de lu per puvils, lahoras ajusta aquelas am sutura segon que yeu recomtare de la sutura de lor.	But if the plaque is great or is with incision of a sword and similar things, and its lips are not closed by threads, then close those with suture according to what I recommend for the suture of them.
Mays si la plagua ja es discuberta del os e pen, e no es retencio de lu sino un petit suspensori, lahoras inscideys aquela e aprop cura la plagua am medicinas e restaura la carn aprop en loc de codena, e comanda al malaute que sia pescut de viandas en las quals es groceza: caps e formen coyt e semblantz a lor, entro que sia compost.	But if the plaque is uncovered of bone and tendon, and there is not retention of it except a small suspensory, then insert that and then cure the plaque with medicines and restore the meat by cutting in the place of tendon, and command to the patient that he abstain from foods in which there is thickness: heads and formen meat and similar things to them, until it is compounded.
E si atrobas en la codena putrefaccio e no adhereys al os, lahoras tu inscideys tot aquo poyrit e geta aquo, e aprop cura aquo.	And if you find in the tendon putrefaction and it does not adhere to the bone, then you insert all that is rotted and cut that, and then cure it.
Mays si en aquestas plaguas es arteria o vena de la qual fluxs de sanc pot evenir, e no es abscindida per medicinas, lahoras tu inquier sobre la arteria, e si atrobas aquela no-inscidida, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am spatum, o lia aquela; e si necessitat te provoca que aquo que havem dit no comfereys, lahoras tu cauteriza entro que·l sanc sia abscidit.	But if in these ulcers there is artery or vein from which flow of blood can come and it is not cut off by medicines, then you clamp on the artery and if it is uncut then you insert that with spatulas, or ligate that; and if necessity compels you to do what we have said not to bring about, then cauterize until the blood is cut.
E si aquestas plaguas son simplas e petitas, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiere; enayssi que tu polverizas sobre aquelas aquesta polvera, quar consolidada aquela denant que l’ayre mude aquelas.	And if these ulcers are simple and small, then the cause of them is chilliness; so that you pulverize over those this powder because when the air changes that.
E la manieyra de la polvera es aquesta: recipe oli de enses partida una, de sanc de drago partida doas, de caus no-extincta partidas tres; sia tot mot trissat e crivellat, e de lu sia la plagua omplida, e sia constrengida per bona constriccio entro que be sobre aquela aderesca, e sia coagulada am le sanc.	And the manner of the powder is this: take oil of sesame seeds one part, dragon's blood two parts, and un-extinguished coagulant three parts; let all be very well pounded and sifted, and then the ulcer to be filled with that, and let it be bound with good constriction so that it adheres, and let it coagulate with the blood.
E aprop strengeys aquela desus am pulvils e leyssa aquela, e no la deslias mentre esta ayssi que no es apostemada, quar no es eredicada de lu la medicina entro que sia sanada.	And then tighten that below with powder and let it be licked, and do not loosen it while this is thus because it is not cauterized, for the medicine does not pass through there until it is healed.
E alcuna vetz fa aquo sola cautz, quan no es a tu en present enses e sanc de drago.	And sometimes it does this on its own, when you are not there to help and there is no dragon's blood.
E ja fa aquesta meteyssa operacio en las grans plaguas quan conveneys que sia pausada sobre aquelas e sian streytas, e so plaguas recentz am le lor sanc, las quals le ayre no ha alteradas.	And this dressing is also performed on large wounds when it is appropriate to place them on those and they are tight, and on recent wounds that have not been altered by air.
E si le ayre las ha alteradas, e majorment quan es en temps d’estiu, lahoras no es entencio a la posicio de aquesta polvera, mays adonc cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit, enayssi que tu pauses sobre aquelas alcus enguents degistius, o que pauses sobre aquelas pols de la farina del ordi am aygua e mel entro que getan poyredura; e aprop cura aquelas am l’autra curacio entro que sian sanadas.	And if the air has altered them, especially in summer time, it is not advisable to apply this powder, but instead heal them with what we have already said by placing on those wounds some healing ointments, or applying on these pulses of flour from a fennel plant mixed with water and honey, which creates a poultice; and also heal them with the other cure until they are healed.
Mays si accideys am la plagua fractura en os, e es petita, lahoras tu extratz aquo am gesti.	But if there is a fracture in the bone along with the wound and it is small, then you should remove it with tweezers.
E yeu diyre la cura de las fracturas del cap en aquo que es envenidor.	And I will discuss the cure for fractured skulls where there is poisoning.
De las plaguas del col.	Of wounds in the neck.
Mays si la plagua accideys en le col, lahoras no es en lu differencia en medicacio, e entre la plagua del cap quan es simpla.	But if a wound occurs in the neck, then there is no difference in treatment from wounds on the head when they are simple.
Mays si ja le nervi del col es inscis o arteria, lahoras si es nervi, no es en lu engen sino que sia evitada curacio de lu am aquo que fa vehement stipticitat, ayssi cum ziniar e zegi que es vetriol e semblantz a lor quar nozo als nervis e contrazo aquel.	But if the nerve in the neck is cut or an artery, then if it is a nerve there should be no cauterization but rather healing with something that causes strong contraction such as vinegar and vitriolic substances similar to these because they do harm to nerves and counter the pain.
E no pauses sobre la plagua alcuna causa de tot freja, quar la sustancia dels nervis es freja e la continuacio de lu es am le cervel, le qual es le pus aut de totz les membres.	And put nothing hot on the wound because the substance of the nerves is hot and its continuation goes to the brain which is the source of all members.
E si’ aquo am que es curat de medicinas leugieras, ayssi cum es caus lavada am aygua dousa, alcuna veguada enfusa en oli rozat o no-rozat, e thucia quan es lavada am aygua dousa e las autras peyras minarantz segon aquesta manieyra, e enguentz humitz.	And if it is treated with light medicines such as causing washing with tepid water, or with some vegetable juice infused in rosin oil or not, and thucia when it is washed with tepid water and the other stones are reduced according to this manner, and ointments moistened.
Mays si la plagua es gran, lahoras aministra sutura, o coarta las labias de lu, e aprop cura aquela am pulvils entro que sia sanada.	But if the wound is large, then perform suturing or bring together its lips and heal it with powders until it is healed.
Mays si a la plagua es profunditat o accideys en lu a la pus bassa partida poyredura, lahoras perfora aquela en le loc mays depremegut.	But if there is depth to the wound or pus occurs in it from a low boil, then pierce that area in the lowest part.
Mays si en la plagua ja es inscisa arteria e es conseguit flux de sanc, lahoras separa o secca aquela, o lia aquela, o cauteriza aquela si necessitat te provoca ad aquo.	But if an artery is cut in the wound and there is bleeding, then stop it or dry it up, or ligature it, or cauterize it if necessity prompts you to do so.
Mays si ja ha insciditz les spondils del golayro o tot, e so salvadas las venas del col, lahoras tu ajusta las labias de la codena am sutura sobre la cana del golayro e no toques aquel; abantz egala aquel e reduzeys aquel sobre la sua figura natural, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent, e leyssa aquela per alcus jorns; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz en les quals es stipticitat e excitacio entro que sia sanat.	But if the joints of the neck have been cut or all of it, and the veins in the neck are saved, then you should bring together the lips of the wound with suturing above the joint of the neck and not touch that; move it back into its natural position, and return it to its natural shape, and strengthen it with decent constriction, and let it heal for several days; and heal it with ointments in which there is contraction and excitement until it is healed.
Mays si la plagua ja en le os a fayta enprecio, lahoras percuireys aquela, e lahoras si en lu ha fragmentz de hos, extratz totz aquels que podes de lor; e aquo que a tu no es apparelhat, leyssa aquo entro que la plagua se poyrisca, e sia separat e la egrecio de lu sia alleujada.	But if the wound is made in bone with depression, then pierce that area and if there are pieces of bone in it, extract all those which you can; and let that which does not appear to be healed, heal within that area where the wound becomes pus-filled, and let the pus separate from it and its pain lessen.
E si la plagua es recent lahoras polveriza sobre aquela polvera la qual t’e recomtada.	And if the wound is fresh then powder it with that powder which was recommended to you.
Mays si en la plagua es fayta fistula, lahoras cura aquela am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra aprop en le sieu capitol.	But if a fistula occurs in the wound then heal it with something whose memory will come shortly in this chapter.
De las plaguas del col o de semblantz quan fayta entre las spallas e es fayta am spaza o am cotel o am lansa o am semblantz.	Of wounds to the neck or similar when made between the shoulders and are made with a spear or arrow or lance or similar.
Si es percussio de lansa o de cotel, e vezes de lu la profunditat, lahoras considera mays si de la plagua yeys ventositat quan le malaute elena; lahoras sapias que la plagua es mortal.	If it is a blow from a lance or arrow and you see the depth of it then consider that if the wound has swelling when the patient breathes then know that the wound is deadly.
E si en lu no es profunditat e la plagua es recent am le sieu sanc, lahoras tu pauses en lu de la primieyra horo polvera, e no strenhas aquel per que no sia le sanc retengut en la profunditat de lu e que retorne al cor e que aucigua le malaute, mays pausa en lu enguent atractiu, e deslia aquela doas veguadas le dia.	And if it is not deep and the wound is fresh with its blood then you should put powder on it from the first hour and not constrict it so that the blood is not retained in its depth and returned to the heart and harm the patient, but put an attracting ointment on it and loose it two times a day.
E si l’enguent no es a tu present, lahoras tu pausa en le orrifici de la plagua coto viel per que sucque aquo que yeys de las humiditatz; e fay que le malaute dorma sobre la plagua per que corra aquo que es en lu ajustat.	And if the ointment is not available to you then you should put on the wound's orifice a piece of old cloth so that it sucks what is inside from humidity; and let the patient sleep on the wound so that what is inside is expelled.
Mays si ja de la plagua son passatz tres dias o mays e no accideys al malaute spasme ni tremor de cor mal ni strictura de ale, e vezes las autras dispozicios bonas de lu, lahoras sapias que plagua es salva; e adonc cura aquela am calguas e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanada.	But if three days or more have passed and the patient does not experience spasms or tremors of the heart or constriction of the soul, and sees the other good dispositions of it then know that the wound is saved; and then heal it with hot water and with the other cure until it is healed.
Mays si la sanacio de lu es excusada, e ja tot temps es uberta, lahoras sapias que ja es fayta fistula; cura donc aquela per le sieu capitol.	But if its healing is delayed and all the time it remains open then know that a fistula has occurred; then heal it according to this chapter.
E si la plagua es per inscisio de spaza o de cotel, e es simpla en la superficia del pietz o del dos, lahoras cura aquela am aquo que es precedit de sutura, si es gran, o am polvera, si es petita.	And if the wound is from a spear or arrow and it is simple on the surface of the foot or heel then heal it with that which comes before suturing if it is large, or with powder if it is small.
Mays si ja ha fayta enprecio en le os, e so ja de lu inscizas pessas, lahoras tu torqua la plagua e coyta ad extrayre aquelas pessas, si so separadas.	But if there is depression in the bone and pieces of it are pushed in then you should twist the wound and cut to extract those pieces if they are separated.
Mays si no so separadas, lahoras leyssa las entro que se poyresca la plagua, que la extraccio de lor es alleujada.	But if they are not separated then let them heal within that area where the wound becomes pus-filled for their extraction is lessened.
E de las autras plaguas accidentz en les autres membres le juvament en curacio es le juvament de aquo que havem dit.	And for other accidental wounds in other members the method of cure is the method which we have said.
De las plaguas del ventre.	Of wounds to the belly.
L’indisposicio la qual accideys en le ventre es o gran, o pauc, o migiera.	The disposition which occurs in the belly is either great, or small, or middling.
De la gran alcunas veguadas yeys le budel o nervi del budel, per que es fayta intromissio de lor e la sutura de lor esser pus vehement e pus subtil.	Of the great some times see the intestine or nerve of the intestine, because it is made intrusion of them and their suturing is more violent and more subtle.
E disrupcio petita es fayta dificil per autra manieyra, e siec se que la reduccio de lor es pus dificil, si no te coytes de la intromissio de lor al sieu loc tantost, quar se ubre e es engrossat per que le intrament de lu es fayt difficil.	And small disruption is made difficult in another manner and it is known that their reduction is more difficult if you do not cut off the intrusion of them to their place at once because it opens and is swollen so that the insertion of it is made difficult.
E donc la milhor disrupcio es migiera, quar en aquela no es dificil la reduccio del budel, ayssi cum es dificil en las doas specias denant ditas.	And therefore the best disruption is middling because in it the reduction of the intestine is not difficult as it is in the two aforementioned species.
E sapias que sutura del ventre es segon quatre manieyras, mays doas suturas son comunas que conveneysso en suturas de las autras plaguas del cors.	And know that there are four methods of suturing the belly, but two sutures are common to other wounds in the body.
E duas autras suturas proprias comunican a las autras plaguas, mays empero so mays proprias en la sutura del ventre.	And two other sutures which are proper to others wounds, but nevertheless are proper only to suturing of the belly.
E yeu recomti a tu quascuna am exposicio e declaracio.	And I have told you everything with explanation and description.
Donc dic que quan la plagua es petita e es eyssit alcuna causa del budel per aquela, e es fayt dificil a reduzir aquel, lahoras aquo es en una de doas manieyras: o per parvitat de la disrupcio ayssi cum havem dit, o quan al budel es venguda inflacio per la frigiditat de l’ayre.	Therefore say that when the wound is small and there is some cause from the intestine through it and it is made difficult to reduce it then it is in one of two ways: or by smallness of the disruption as we have said, or when to the intestine is given inflammation by cold air.
E donc quan aquo es ayssi, lahora cove que tu scalfes aquel enayssi que tu submerges una sponga ho drap humit en aygua tebeza sola, o que coguas en aygua squinant, e cyperum, e spic, e embroques am aquela le budel entro que la imflacio sia resolvuda.	And therefore when it is thus then you should warm that in such a way that you soak a sponge or cloth moistened with tepid water only by itself, or that you gather in squinant water, and cyperum, and spic, and embrocations on the intestine until the inflammation is resolved.
E alcunas veguadas fa aquo vi en le qual ha stipticitat, e es milhor que la aygua sola en resolucio de la imflacio.	And sometimes it does this with the quality that has contraction and is better than water alone in resolving inflammation.
E donc cum tu vezes la imflacio esser resolvuda, lahoras tu humecta le budel am aygua en la qual es coyta altea e malvas, quar per aquo es alleujat le intrament de lu am pauca causa.	And therefore when you see inflammation resolved then you should moisten the intestine with water in which is mixed alder and mallows because by this it is eased the insertion of it with little cause.
Mays si es escusat le intrament de lu aprop aquesta curacio, lahoras scindeys la disrupcio un petit am strument am le qual so inscididas emorroydas.	But if it is necessary to withdraw his bowels for this treatment, then cut the rupture with a small instrument with which you can incise hemorrhoids.
E la curacio primieyra es milhor, quan es propriada que no es seccio, e no sia occupacio a seccar aprop necessitat e defaliment.	And the first treatment is better when it is not cutting, and there is no occupation in stopping the bleeding by necessity and deflation.
Del instrument, sec se la forma de lu:	As for the instrument, look at its shape:
La una partida de lu torta aguda, e l’autra partida no-acuta, e la extremitat subtil, e no sia am la subtilitat de spatum, abantz sia obtusa un pauc.	One side of it is bent and acute, and the other side not acute, and its end thin, and not with the thinness of a spatula, rather it should be blunt a little.
E donc cum la plagua es amplificada e yeys fora le budel, lahoras cove que la sua reduccio sia segon la forma de lu natural, en le sieu loc propri, si es possible sobre aquo, quar milhor es.	And when the wound is enlarged and the intestine comes out, then its reduction should be according to its natural shape in its proper place, if it is possible on that, for it is better.
Mays quan la disrupcio es ampla, e es en la partida pu bassa del ventre, lahoras cove que tu fassas jazer le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa las suas cambas pus autas que·l sieu cap; e si es en la partida pus desus del ventre, lahoras tu pause le cap de lu e·l pietz pus autz que las partidas dejos.	But when the rupture is wide and it is in the lower part of the belly, then you should make the patient lie on his back, and put his legs above; and if it is in the upper part of the belly, then you put his head and chest above the parts below.
E semblantment si la disrupcio es en una de las doas partz del ventre, lahoras pausa la tua entencio e la tua consideracio tostemps en aysso per que la partida en la qual es la plagua sia pus auta que l’autra.	And likewise if the rupture is in one of the two parts of the belly, then pay your intention and attention to that so that the part where the wound is is higher than the other.
E ayssi cove que tu aministres aquo en las plaguas grans e en las plaguas migieras.	And thus you should administer this for large wounds and small wounds.
E en las plaguas petitas, pausa aquo que es a tu preparat, e aprop fay que·l ministre sia entre las tuas mas pyatados, le qual tengua la disrupcio tota am la sua ma e ajusta las labias de lu, e aprop descuebre de aquela ad aquel que siec la sutura alcuna causa aprop autra.	And for small wounds, put on what is prepared for you, and let the minister hold it between his fingers, who has the wound all in his hand and hold the lips of it, and appropriately uncover from that to that which sews the suture any cause or other.
E aquesta es la manieyra de sutura comuna: una que prenguas la agula, o comte de agula segon la cantitat de la amplitut de la plagua; e aprop layssa de la extremitat de la disrupcio del dit anular, e strenh la agula una, otre que tu no metas fiel en las doas extremitatz de la codena, am doas extremitatz del ciphac que es dejos la codena de las partidas dedintz, entro que fassas aquela penetrar de aquela partida; e tu ja has agreguadas doas extremitatz de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, e so faytas quatre ordes.	And this is the manner of common suture: one which you take the needle, or count of needle according to the quantity of the amplitude of the wound; and let go from the end of the rupture of the little finger, and tighten the needle one, another that you do not put thread in both ends of the cord, with two ends of the tape that is under the cord of the parts inside, as you make her penetrate from that part; and you have already added two ends of the cord and two ends of the tape, and so are made four orders.
E aprop strenh am fiel doble en le circuit de la agula, e alcunas veguadas de doas partz ensemps, e aprop agregua las doas labias e la plagua per agreguacio decent; e aprop layssa la grossitut del dit e fiqua una autra agulha en aquela, e aprop lia aquela am fiel ayssi cum fiest am la primieyra agulha; e no cesses far aquo si es necessitat am las agulhas entro que ajas complida tota la contriccio de la plagua.	And let go with double thread around the needle, and some times of two parts together, and let us add both lips and the wound by decent addition; and let go the thickness of the little finger and take another needle in that, and tie that with thread thus as it is with the first needle; and do not cease to do this if it is necessary with needles until you have completed all the contraction of the wound.
E sian las agulhas migieras entre groceza e subtilitat, quar las agulhas subtils mot leugierament insciden la carn; e las grossas so de dificil intrament en la codena, e donc per aquo cove que sian migieras en subtilitat e grosseza.	And let the needles be smaller between thickness and thinness, for the thin needles enter the flesh lightly; and the thick ones are of difficult use in the cord, and therefore let them be smaller in thinness and thickness.
E no cove que la agulha sia ficada en doas extremitatz de la codena propdana mot, per so que la carn no sia inscidida leugierament e que la plagua se huebra devant la sua consolidacio.	And let the needle not be put in two ends of the cord next to it, for fear that the flesh is lightly inscribed and that the wound opens before its consolidation.
E no sian prolonguadas de sutura per que la plagua no sia prohibida de consolidacio.	And let them not be prolonged in suture so that the wound is prohibited from consolidation.
E aprop inscideys las extremitatz de las agulhas per so que no ledescan le malaute deves le sieu dormier; e pausaras sobre la sutura pulvils expanduts de tota partida, les quals tenguan las extremitatz de las agulhas; e layssa aquelas entro que sapias que la plagua ja es consolidada.	And let the ends of the needles be inscribed so that they do not irritate the patient during his sleep; and put over the suture powdered expandants from all parts, which have the ends of the needles; and take them away when you know that the wound is consolidated.
E aquestas specias de sutura am agulhas en cal manieyra es pus convenient en las plaguas petitas, quar habasta en la sutura de lor una agulha o doas o entorn aquelas.	And this kind of suture with needles in what way is more convenient for small wounds, for it reaches in the suture of them one needle or two or around them.
Mays la segonda sutura es cominal: e es que tu aministres am sutura las quatre extremitatz, de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, en una veguada, am agulha en la qual sia fiel envolopat engual en subtilitat e grosseza.	But the second suture is common: and it is that you administer with suture the four ends, of the cord and two ends of the tape, in one go, with a needle in which there is thread wrapped both in thinness and thickness.
E aprop quan am la agulha auras penetrat aquestas quatre extremitatz, reduzeys la agulha de aquela meteyssa partida de la qual comensest, per so que le fiel retrayt caja de la pus subirana partida a la plagua, per so que la sutura sia segon sutura de drap am la qual les draps so strengutz.	And let when with the needle you have penetrated these four ends, reduce the needle from that meted part of which you began, so that the thread drawn box the more superficial part to the wound, so that the suture is according to a cloth stitch by which the cloths are tightened.
E pausa entre quascuna sutura la quantitat del gros del dit mendre.	And put between each suture the quantity of the thickness of the little finger.
E aquesta sutura sabo les homes.	And this suture know men.
E am tal sutura yeu cozegui la plagua la qual era accidida a un home en le sieu ventre le qual era stat plaguat am un cotel, e era la disrrumpcio de la plagua major de un palm, e era eyssit dels budels entorn dos palms del budel del mieg loc e era la disrupcio en le mieg del membre; e adonc yeu reduzegui aquel depus que le budel havia stat foro la plagua per xxiiii horas.	And with this suture I healed the wound which was inflicted on a man in his belly, for he had been stabbed with an arrow, and it was a rupture of two fingers width, and it had exited the intestines around two inches from the intestine of the middle place, and it was a rupture in the middle of the leg; and then I reduced it after the intestine had exited the wound for 24 hours.
E la plagua fo consolidada en le spazi de xv dias o entorn, e curegui aquel e es sanat; e aprop aquo visquec per motz ans, e es conversat en las suas disposicios.	And the wound was consolidated in the space of 15 days or around, and I healed him, and he stayed for a long time, and is conversed in his dispositions.
E les autres metges havian jutgat que no fora sanat; e per miracle foc, quar yeu no curegui aquel am enguent, quar era en loc en le qual enguent no era atrobat ni deguna medicina, mays pausegui sobre la plagua coto viel dos veguadas lo dia e ablucio assiduo am aygua de mel entro que foc sanat.	And the other physicians had judged that he would not be healed; and by miracle he was cured, for I did not heal him with ointment, but put on the wound cotton wool two times a day and frequent washing with honey water until he was healed.
Mays yeu diyre dos specias de sutura proprias segon narracio de Paraula.	But I will say two kinds of proper suture according to the narrative of Word.
E es que tu comenses am sutura de la codena, e entrometas agulha de la partida deforo a la partida dedintz.	And it is that you begin with the suture of the cord, and interlace the needle from the outer part to the inner part.
E donc cum la agulha penetra en la codena e en aquel meteys lacertz segon rectetut e en longetut de tot le cos, e layssa la extremita del ciphac en le qual has entromesa la agulha; e fay penetrar en la autra extremitat la agulha de la partida dedintz a la partida deforo en l’autra extremitat del mihat.	And so when the needle penetrates in the cord and in that you have made holes according to rectitude and length of all the body, and let go the end of the tape in which you have put the needle; and make it penetrate from the other end the needle from the inner part to the outer part in the other end of the mihat.
E don cum tu auras fayta aquela penetrar, lahoras tu fay aquela penetrar autra veguada en aquela meteyssa extremitat del mihat de la partida deforo a la partida dedintz; e leyssa la extramitat del ciphac que es en aquest latz, e fay penetrar la agulha en l’autra extremitat de la partida dedintz a la partida deforo.	And so when you have made it penetrate, then let us make it penetrate another time in that meted end of the mihat from the outer part to the inner part; and let go the end of the tape which is on this side, and make the needle penetrate in the other end of the inner part to the outer part.
E fay penetrar am aquela la tua penetracio am la qual fas aquela penetrar en le ciphac en la extremitat del mirat la qual es en la partida de lu entro que tot aquel penetre.	And make it penetrate with that your penetration with which you make it penetrate in the tape in the end of the mihat, which is in the party of him, so that everything penetrates.
E aprop comensa de aquest meteys costat e cus aquel am la extremitat que es del ciphac en l’autra latz, e extratz la agulha de la codena la qual penetrec, e aprop redutz aquela en aquela codena e cos la extremitat del ciphac que es en l’autra costat am aquesta extramitat del mirat; e extratz aquela de la codena la qual es de part de lu.	And let us begin from this meted side, and draw that with the end which is of the tape on the other side, and take out the needle from the cord which penetrates, and let us reduce it in that cord and press the end of the tape which is on the other side with this end of the mihat; and draw that from the cord which is of the part of him.
E fay aquo una veguada e autra, e fay aquo una veguada aprop autre veguada entro que tu cozes tot aquo que es deforo segon aquel eysemple.	And do this one and another, and do one again and then another until you sew all that is out according to that example.
E la suma de aquesta manieyra de sutura es que tu cozes am sutura de pellicies am la qual cozo las pels, enayssi que tu cozes le ciphac una veguada de la part de la extremitat de la codena, e que leysses aquela autra veguada entro que la ajas complida.	And the sum of this manner of suture is that you sew with the suture of skin with which you sew the skin, indeed that you sew the tape one time from the end of the cord, and let us take that other time so that you finish it.
Mays la segonda specia de sutura propria la qual dieys eyssament Gualia , e aquest es de sermo de lu e per lu recomtat, es que tu cozas aquela segon semilitut am la qual alcus medicantz cozo aquela, enayssi que agreguan tota partida a la sua compar partida a lu convenient per natura; e aplican la extremitat de autre de lu e la extremitat del mirat al autra extremitat de lu, e aquo es fayt segon que yeu a tu recomti.	But the second kind of proper suture which I say is called Gualia, and it is of the bowels of him and by him wound, is that you sew that according to similitude with which I have mentioned medicine sews that, indeed that you add all parts to their proper comparison to him conveniently by nature; and apply one end of him to another end of the mihat and that is done according to that I have to you.
Cove que tu fiques la agulha en la extremitat del mirat a tu propdana de la partida deforo, e fassas aquela penetrar a la partida dedintz en aquel sol, e leysses dos extremitatz del ciphac; e aprop revolveys la agulha e fay aquela penetrar de foro a la dedintz en dos extremitatz del ciphac.	Place the needle at the end of your sight, near the edge of the wound, and make it penetrate inside to the depth of that sun, and touch the two ends of the cicatrix; then turn the needle and make it penetrate from outside to inside on both ends of the cicatrix.
E aprop revolveys aquelas cascunas, e fay penetrar quascunas de la partida dededintz entro a la partida deforo en dos extremitatz del mirat autras que so en le latz contrari.	Then turn those scars, and make some of them penetrate from the inside to the outside on both ends of the wound that is in the opposite side.
E aquesta manieyra de sutura es milhor de la sutura comuna leugiera, e es sutura de la qual precedic rememoracio.	And this way of suturing is better than common suturing, and it is the suturing from which I derive my memory.
Aquest es le sermo de Gualia	This is the speech of Gallia
E mays le diyssero alcus, sutura del ventre es rectificada am dos agulhas, so es que tu entrometas en aquestas a quascunas un fiel, e comensa am intromiccio de agulha de aquo que es deves tu, e fay aquela penetrar entro al autra latz segon sutura de aquels les quals cozo les cuers engualment.	And some say that stomach suturing is done with two needles; you should insert a needle in each of these and start with the needle nearest to you, and make it penetrate into the other side according to the suturing of those who cut up bodies along the middle.
E sapias que quan disrupcio es en le mieg loc del ventre, lahoras la sutura de lu es pus difficil que dels autres locs del ventre.	And know that when there is disruption in the middle part of the belly, then its suturing is more difficult than that of other parts of the belly.
Mays le juguament de medicacio de plagua es jutgament de las autras plaguas.	But the judgment of medicine for plague is a judgment of the other plagues.
La qual causa es quar quan tu consieguas la plagua recent am le sieu sanc denant que l’ayre altera aquela, e reduses le budel e cozes aquela e aptas aquela decentment, lahoras pausa sobre aquela polvera encarnativa.	And its cause is that when you find the plague new with its blood before the air alters it, and you return the intestine and cook it and prepare it decently, then place upon it a carnative powder.
E si le ayre ja ha alterada la plagua, lahoras pausa sobre aquela alcus enguentz les quals so a tu presens entro que fassan peyra dura e cajan les fiels, e sian consolidatz ciphac e mirat; e aprop cura aquela ayssi cum es la curacio de las autras plaguas entro que sia sanat.	And if the air has already altered the plague, then place upon it some unguents which are at your disposal inside so that they make a hard stone and enclose the puss, and are consolidated cicatrix and wound; then heal it just as is the healing of the other plagues until it is healed.
Mays si a tu no so presens las medicinas, lahoras pausa sobre aquela tantost, pus que comensa a getar brac, coto viel, e permuta aquel dos veguadas le dia, ayssi cum a tu e ensenhat, entro que sia sanat, quar tu no indigeysses de autra medicacio en motas disposicios quan las plaguas so simplas.	But if you do not have the medicines at hand, then place upon it immediately, as soon as it begins to suppurate blood and pus, change it twice a day, morning and evening, according as you are taught, until it is healed; for you should not use other medicine in different dispositions when the plagues are simple.
Mays si tu temes que la plagua comunique en lesio als membres principals, lahoras cove que tu submergas lana leon en oli de trempada qualiditat, o en oli rozat, e pausa aquela en le circuit dels locs que so entre les angonas e dejos las aysselas.	But if you fear that the plague will communicate to the principal members, then take lamb's wool and soak it in oiled quality or in oiled rosewater, and place it around the places which are between the angles and under the heels.
E si sent dolor o putrefaccio en les sieus budels, quar motas veguadas aquo s’endeve, lahoras cristeriza aquel am vi stiptic negre tebe, e majorment si la poyredura es pervenguda en le budel e es fayta exitura penetrant entro la conquavitat de lu.	And if he feels pain or putrefaction in his intestines, how many times this happens, then anoint that with black styptic wine of Tebes, and especially if the putrefaction is produced in the intestine and there is an exit opening into its cavity.
E sapias que aquela que es del budel gros es de pus leugiera sanacio que aquela que es en les budels subtils.	And know that that which is of the gross intestine is easier to heal than that which is in the subtle intestines.
E es de dificil sanacio quar le budel le qual es apelat “gegunu” no recep sanacio de plagua que caja en lu de tot; e aquo es per la gran multitut de venas que so en lu e per la magnitut de lu que so en aquelas, e per subtilitat del cos de aquel, e per propinquitat de aquel a natura de nervis.	And it is of difficult healing when the intestine which is called "gut" does not receive healing of plague that boxes in it from all sides; and this is because of the great multitude of veins that are in it and because of the magnitude of it that are in those, and because of the subtlety of the body of that, and because of proximity of that to nature of nerves.
Mays si aquo que procezeys de la plagua es la tela, e conseguas aquela recent, redutz aquela segon la tua rectetut am la qual reduzes les budels engualment.	But if what proceeds from the plague is the tissue, and you obtain that recently, reduce it according to your rectitude with which you reduce the intestines similarly.
Mays si es passat a lu spazi e ja es feyt vert o negre, lahoras que tu strenguas aquela am fiel sobre le loc que es denigrat de lu, per so que vengua fluxs de sanc, quar en la tela so venas e arterias.	But if it has passed into space and is already made black or dark, then you should constrict that with puss on the place that is blackened by it, so that there comes a flow of blood from the tissue in which there are veins and arteries.
E aprop inscideys aquo que es otra aquel liament, e pausa dos extremitatz del fiel pendentz de la partida dejos de la plagua foro lu, per que sobre tu sia alleujada la atraccio de lu deves le cazement de la tela e emissio del brac de la plagua.	Then insert that which is another that, and place the two ends of the puss pendent from the edge below the plague opening it, so that upon you is alleviated the attraction of it because of the descent of the tissue and emission of blood of the plague.
Rememoracio de las plaguas quan accideysso en le budel.	Memory of the plagues when they happen in the intestine.
Quan accideys disrupcio en le budel e es petita, lahoras es possibla que sia resteurada en alcus homes, per aysso quar yeu vi aquel le qual era stat plaguat en le sieu ventre am percussio de lansa et era la plagua de la part dreyta del stomac, e la plagua era antiquada e fayta fistula, e eyssic de lu gestio e ventositat.	When disruption happens in the intestine and it is small, then it is possible that it be restored in some people; therefore, because he had the plague in his belly with a lance-wound and the plague was on the right part of the stomach, and the plague was old and made fistula, and he passed gas and ventosity from it.
Adonc yeu pansegui la curacio de lu ja sia que no era confizat en la sanacio de lu, mays cessegui subtiliar aquel entro que foc sanat e le loc es consolidat.	Then he followed the healing of it even though he was not confident in its healing, but he continued to sutilize that until it was healed and the place was consolidated.
E yeu pus que vi le loc ja consolidat, timegui sobre le malaute que endevengues sobre lu accident de mal en le sieu ventre; e no endevenc alcu per aquo mal accident e romas en las suas milhos disposicios mangant e bevent, e aprop entrec en banh e es exercitat en sos ditz.	And he put that which he saw the place already consolidated, he waited on the patient in whose belly he had received harm because of an accident of evil; and he did not receive any harm from that evil accident, and remained in his many dispositions eating and drinking, and he went into bath and was exercised in his limbs.
E ja diysero alcus experimentados que quan endeve plagua en le budel, e es petita, lahoras cove que sia liada segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu prenguas fromiguas de grans caps; e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua e pausa una fromigua de aquelas que aja la boca uberta sobre las doas labias de la plagua; donc quan pren sobre aquelas e strenh la sua boca, abscindeys le cap de lu, quar adhereys e no es dissolvut.	And some experienced people have said that when plague happens in the intestine and it is small, then it should be bound according to this way: and it is that you take herbs of great heads; then tie the two lips of the plague and place one of those herbs which has an open mouth over the two lips of the plague; then when he takes on those and tightens his mouth, cut off the head of it, for it will adhere and not be dissolved.
E aprop pausa autra formigua prop la primieyra, e no cesses aquo a far am formiguas una aprop autra segon la quantitat de tota la plagua.	Then place another worm near the first one, and do not cease doing this with worms one after another according to the quantity of all the plague.
E aprop reduzeys aquela e cos la plagua; e romanguan aquels caps annexces en le budel entro que·l budel sia sanat; e no accideys al malaute degun nocument.	Then return that and cook the plague; and let those heads attach in the intestine until the intestine is healed; and no harm will happen to the patient.
E ja es possible que·l budel sia liat am fiel subtil lo qual es fayt del budel de bestia annexs am lu, pus que es mes en agulha; e es que tu prenguas la extremitat de aquestz fiels de budel, e sia mot descarnat, e aprop lia la extremitat de lu am fiel de li, envolopat, e aprop entromet aquel fiel en agulhas e cos am aquel le budel, e areduzeys aquel en la disrupcio.	And it is possible that the intestine be bound with a subtle puss which is made from the intestine of beast added to it, because it is more in needle; and it is that you take the end of those intestines of intestine and make much of it naked, and then bind the end of it with puss of it, wrapped, and then insert that needle and cook with that the intestine, and reduce that into the disruption.
E aquesta manieyra de sutura am formiguas no es sino segon via de fiducia e d’esperansa.	And this way of suturing with worms is nothing but according to way of confidence and hope.
Mays si la plagua es gran e ampla, majorment si es en un dels budels subtils, quar lahoras no es engen sino subtiliacio, e no es sanacio de lu de tot.	But if the plague is large and wide, especially if it is in one of the subtle intestines, for then it is nothing but subtilization, and not healing of it completely.
De curacio de zuchem e fistula.	Of healing of ulcer and fistula.
Sapias que tota plagua e apostema quan se envilheseys e se Antiqua, e es fayt ulcus, e no es consolidat e geta braç tot temps e no es abscindit, lahoras, en qualque membre sia, universalment es nompnada fistula e nos la apelam aquela azukem.	Know that any plague and apostema when it becomes soft and old, and is made ulcer, and not consolidated and suppurates, then, in whatever member it is, universally is named fistula and we call that as "sucker."
E fistula segon veritat es nodacio feutrada, dura, blanqua am la qual no es dolor e a la qual es conquavitat ayssi cum es conquavitat de pena de ausel; e per aysso nompnat aquela alcus rizatz, id est pena.	And fistula according to truth is knotted phlegm, hard, white with which there is no pain and to which is cavity just as is cavity of bone of donkey; and because of that it is named  "rizat", that is bone.
E es en alcus homes humida, la qual geta brac; e fort leu la humiditat es abscidida en alcunas horas.	And it is in some people moist, which suppurates blood; and strongly its moisture is discharged in some hours.
E alcunas veguadas aquesta humiditat es mota, e es pauca, e es grossa, e es subtil.	And sometimes this moisture is thick, and it is little, and it is gross, and it is subtle.
E yeu ja he denant dit en la divisio, lahoras cum yeu diyssi las plaguas, que tot ulcus que no es sanat ni no es en lu nuda carn, no es aquo sino per una de ix causas: de las quals la una es o per pauquesa de sanc en le cos; o per malicia de lu; o quar entre lu e las labias es carn dura prohibent nativitat de carn; o quar es de mota legesa; o quar aquel ulcus en si meteys es poyrit e la materia que es a lu tramesa es de mala qualitat; o quar la medicina es enconvenient en la curacio de lu; o quan corrupcio catz en la regio, e es pestilencia; o per proprietat de regio ayssi cum endeve a Saragossa , en la qual es fayta difficil degestio de las malautias, e es tardada en aquela sanacio de apostema per natura; o quar en lu es os un, o motz osses.	And I have already given the division, then when I say the plagues, that any ulcer which is not healed and it is not naked flesh, it is not anything but by one of these causes: of which one is or because of lack of blood in the body; or because of wickedness of it; or because between it and its lips there is hard flesh preventing generation of flesh; or because it is of thick phlegm; or because that ulcer inside meets is rotten and the matter that is in it is of bad quality; or because medicine is inconvenient for its healing; or when corruption happens in the region, and pestilence is tardy in that healing of apostema because of nature; or because there is bone, or many bones.
Ja e mostrat totas aquelas causas, e·ls senhals de aquelas e la curacio de lor am medicinas en la divisio.	Now I have shown all of those causes, their signs, and their cure by medicine in the division.
E cove assi que yeu fassa a tu saber la curacio de fistula la qual es fayta per via de operacio am ma.	And now so that you know the cure for a fistula which is caused through an operation with the hand.
E sapias que fistula accideys en totz les membres del cos; quar de aquelas son fistulas que perveno a las venas grantz e arterias, o als nervis, o al ciphac, o al budel, o a la vesica, o ad alcuna de las costas, o ad alcu dels spondils del dos, o ad alcuna de las juncturas compostas per composicio ayssi quo de la ma e del pe; e de aquelas so que dan a lu propinquitat del membre principal e de semblantz.	And know that fistulas occur in all the body's parts; some of those are fistulas that affect the large veins and arteries, or nerves, or brain, or intestine, or bladder, or any of the ribs, or one of the vertebrae of the spine, or any of the compound joints consisting of bone and skin. And there are others that occur near the main body part they resemble.
E donc aquela de aquestas fistulas que es segon aquesta manieyra es de las malautias de dificil sanacio, e no recep curacio, e occupacio am aquela es trebalh e ignorancia.	And therefore those of these fistulas that follow this manner are illnesses of difficult cure, and do not receive treatment, and occupation with them is labor and ignorance.
E si es de las fistulas alcuna la profunditat de la qual no perve ad aquestz locs que e dit, e esperas e confizas en la curacio de lu, e vols pervenir a cognicio de lu, lahoras pren tenta de eram o de ferr, e si la fistula va segon rectetut, e perquireys aquela am lu.	And if it is one of the fistulas whose depth does not reach these places I have mentioned, and you expect and believe in its cure, and wish to attain knowledge of it, then take a probe made of iron or steel, and if the fistula goes straight, then probe it with this.
Mays si la fistula es tortuissitat, lahoras investigua aquela am tenta de plom subtil, quar plom am la levitat del sieu cors es alleujat e curvat deves la tortuositat.	But if the fistula is winding, then investigate it with a probe made of thin lead, for lead, by virtue of its light body, is drawn and bent according to the windings.
E si la fistula es havent motz horrificis, no es a tu possible que signifiques sobre lu am tenta.	And if the fistula has horrific movements, then it is not for you to give a sign of it with a probe.
Adonc cristeriza le orrifici per sos orrificis, quar la humiditat per la qual clisterizas aquela va deves las autras orrificis e corr de lor.	Therefore, christen the opening for its openings, for the moisture by which you cleanse that will go through the other openings and flow out of them.
E aprop inquier exquisitament, segon qual manieyra a tu es possible que conoguas si aqui has os o nervi, e es la conquavitat de la fistula longinqua o propdana, o es una fistula a la qual so motz orrificis e esta sobre aquo tot am la suma de la tua fortaleza, am la tua enterroguacio, am la qual enterroguas le malaute, e la invencio de la dolor deves la tua compressio am la ma sobre le loc, e semblantz de las significacios e de las causas accidentz al apostema.	And then inquire closely according to the manner in which it is possible for you to know whether here there are bones or nerves, and whether the fistula' s cavity is distant or near, or whether it is a fistula whose openings are all at one end, and it is according to your entire strength that you probe the patient, and the discovery of pain according to your compression with your hand over the area, and similar to the signs and the accidental causes of the apostema.
E cum tu auras stat sobre totas aquelas causas am stacio veraya, lahoras ve a la curacio segon confidencia: e es que tu consideras lahoras si es fistula apparent propinqua o en loc sal, longinqua de junctura, o de nervi, o de arteria, o de vena, o de un dels locs les quals yeu a tu e ditz.	And when you have stood over all these causes with true standing, then come to the cure according to confidence: and it is that you consider whether the fistula is apparently near or in a salty place, distant from a joint, or of a nerve, or of an artery, or of a vein, or of one of those places which I have told you about.
Lahoras tu secca la fistula segon que denant es dit de la naracio de lu, e osta aquo que es en aquela filtracio e de carns corrumpudas, e aquo que es nascut en le orrifici de la carn, o de theil e de semblantz, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	Then you dry up the fistula according to what has been said before about its narrative, and stop up that which is in that filtration and of rotten flesh, and that which is born in the opening of the flesh, or of thinness and of similar, and cure that within which is healed.
Mays si la fistula es de longinqua profunditat, e es segon rectetut, lahoras cove que inscidas aquela en le preon atant quant a tu sira possible, e aprop mondifica aquela de totas las suas carns corrompudas; e aprop administra calguas envolopadas en medicinas acutas, e intromet aquelas entro a la conquavitat de la fistula, la qual has conprenduda am ferr.	But if the fistula is of distant depth and is straight, then know that you must insert that into the cavity of the fistula, which you have understood with iron, as far as it is possible for you to go, and then cleanse that of all its rotten flesh; and then administer hot waters wrapped in sharp medicines, and insert those into the cavity of the fistula.
E fay aquo am aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la medicina acuta corroda tot aquo que es romas en la conquavitat de la fistula de la corrupcio.	And do that with it several times until the sharp medicine corrodes all that is rotten in the cavity of the fistula.
E aprop restaura aquela am enguentz les quals engendran carn sana entro que sia sanada.	Then restore that with ointments which bring about healthy flesh within that is healed.
Mays si no es sanada per aquo, lahoras tu cauteriza aquela segon que havem recomtat.	But if it is not healed by that, then you cauterize that according to what we have recommended.
Mays si la causa de fistula es os e es deves tu certificat aquo, lahoras tu inquireys aquela e secca aquela segon que havem recomtat, si tu no prohibeys alcuna causa de vena o de nervi o de membre principal ayssi cum havem dit.	But if the cause of the fistula is bone and that is certified by you, then you probe and dry up that according to what we have recommended, unless you forbid any cause of vein or nerve or main body part as we have said.
Mays si le os es a tu descubert e es en lu alcuna corrupcio e negror, lahoras tu ratz aquel entro que la corrupcio sia hostada tota; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que lu encarne entro que sia sanat.	But if the bone is uncovered and there is corruption and blackness in it, then you remove that all the way until the corruption is entirely stopped up; and then cure that with what causes flesh within to be healed.
E si no es sana e gieta brac ayssi cum fazia, lahoras sapias que tu no est pervengut a la eradicacio tota de la corrupcio; e adonc tu descuebre sobre lu segondanament e exquisitament fay la razio de lu e la mundificacio de lu am la deriera fortalasa tieua, e aprop restaura aquel.	And if it is not healed and the arm hangs as before, then know that you have not attained to the total eradication of the corruption; then uncover it again and do the reason for it and cleanse it with your greatest strength, and then restore that.
E donc si es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras sapias que aquela corrupcio es en la profunditat longinqua del cors, la qual no ha conseguida, e adonc a tu en aquel no es engen sino laysar aquela.	And therefore if it is healed, then that is good; and if not, then know that the corruption is in the distant depth of the body, which has not been reached, and then you have nothing to do with that but to leave it alone.
E si le os corromput es petit, o es a tu possible atirar aquel, lahora tu le atira am forceps subtils las quals conveno ad aquo.	And if the rotten bone is small, or it is possible for you to pull it out, then you pull it out with thin forceps which are suitable for that.
E si so motz osses, lahoras exquisitament fay la extraccio de totz aquels, e de aquels no laysses denguna causa am la tua fortaleza.	And if there are many bones, then you make the extraction of all those with your greatest strength and do not leave any cause behind.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat alcuna causa de las humiditatz, e en lor inscizio no ha temor ni error, lahoras inscideys aquelas liaments o carns si so aqui, e deliura les osses.	But if you encounter any counteraction by the moisture, and in their incision there is no fear or mistake, then insert those with laments or flesh if they are here, and loosen the bones.
Mays si a tu no es preparacio de ostar les osses de la tua hora, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua aquo que poyresca la plagua aquela, e layssa aquela entro que aquo es al enviro de aquels osses de carns e de liamentz, e guarda la plagua que no sia consolidada, e sia constrengida la seccio la qual tu has inscidida en la tua operacio.	But if you are not prepared to stop up the bones at that time, then pause over the wound what will poultice it, and leave that until the pulp is at the environment of those bones of flesh and of laments, and guard the wound so it is not consolidated but restricted by the incision which you have made in your operation.
Habantz, si temes, pausa sobre lu coto submers en sopre trissat am oli, o coto submers en anguent egipciac, o en alcu dels enguentz vertz, quar quan poyriran aquelas liaments, e les osses son de lor seperatz la ablacio, e de aquels atraccio es alleujada.	Have you, if you fear, pause over it a cloth drenched in oil or a cloth drenched in Egyptian ointment, or one of the green ointments; for when those laments will rot and the bones are separated from that ablation and that attraction is eased.
Mays si es un gran os ayssi cum le os de camba o de coyssa o semblantz ad aquels, e aquo que de lu es corromput es la facia de lu tant solament, lahoras ratz aquela am resio tant solament derriera entro que sia ostada aquela negror e corrupcio, e aprop restaura la plagua.	But if it is a great bone like the bone of the arm or of the thigh or similar to those, and that which is rotten in it is its fascia only, then remove that with resin only behind so that the blackness and corruption are stopped up, and then restore the wound.
Mays si aquo que de lu es corrumpyt es gran partida, e la corrupcio ja ha conseguida la medulla del os, lahoras es causa necessaria cerrar aquel e aquel tot inscidir entro al loc on es pervenguda la corrupcio, e lahoras cura aquel entro que sia consolidada.	But if that which is rotten in it is a great part and the corruption has already reached the marrow of the bone, then the necessary cause is to close that and to cut that all the way into the area where the corruption has been reached, and then cure that within so that it is consolidated.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc ad un home en la sua coyssa per que pausez aquela a eyssempli e adjutori sobre la tua operacio.	And I have told you that you should ask from one man in his thigh so that he will offer aid and assistance to your operation.
Foc un home jove per etat entorn xxx ans, al qual accideys dolor en la sua cueyssa, e de las partidas dedintz mauguda es sobre la materia dedintz le cors entro que la materia es pervenguda a la cueyssa, e es materia de apostema am gran apostema, e no foc a lu causa extrinseca.	A young man about thirty years of age to whom joint pain occurred in his head and the mucous membrane inside is swollen into the matter within the head where the matter has reached the head, and it is matter of apostema with great apostema and there was not to him an extrinsic cause.
E adonc foc extendut le temps am aquela per la error dels metges entro que l’apostema es hubert, e acorrero de lu materias motas, e la sua curacio foc aprop pausada entro que la camba foc fistulada, e faytz son en lu motz orrificis les quals totz getavan poyredura e las humiditatz del cos.	And then the time was prolonged by that because of the mistake of the doctors until the apostema was opened, and there occurred in him many openings through which all the humors of the body flowed out, and his cure was then stopped up so that the thigh was fistulated, and there were in him horrific openings through which all the fluids of the body flowed out.
E adonc le curec multitut de metges entorn dos ans, e no foc en aquels savia ma en la art, entro que yeu fu appelat.	And then he was treated by many doctors for about two years, and there was not in those the wisdom of the bone within the joint where he had been called.
E vi la camba de lu e las materias que corrian de lu aquels orrificis per gran cors; e ja le cos de aquel home era tot stabozit e la color de lu era citrina.	And they saw his thigh and the matters flowing out of it from those openings because of the great body; and indeed that man' s body was entirely swollen and his color was yellowish.
E adonc yeu intromesi la tenta ad un de aquels orrificis e pervenguec la tenta al os.	And then they inserted a probe into one of those openings and reached the bone.
E aprop yeu e perscrutat tostz les orrificis e trobegui aquels pervenir a lor de totas partidas de la camba.	And then they probed all the openings and found that they came from all parts of the thigh.
E adonc yeu me coytegui e inscidegui sobre un dels orrificis aquels entro que descrobegui una partida del os, e atrobegui aquel corromput, e ja era terros e corrumput e denigrat; e era ja corrumpuda una partida de la camba entro que havia penetrat entro a la mezola.	And then they cut and inserted into one of those openings where I discovered a part of the bone, and I found it rotten, and indeed it was earthy and rotten and blackened; and there was already a part of the thigh rotted where it had penetrated within the membrane.
E adon yeu serregui aquo que a mi era discubert e preparat del os descubert.	And then I tied what was uncovered and prepared of the exposed bones.
E yeu cujegui que no fos en le os sino aquela corrupcio la qual abscidigui e serregui, e yeu ja havia derraziguada.	And I saw that it was not in the bone, but that corruption which had separated and I tied off, and which I had already cut away.
E aprop pausegui la restauracio de la plagua am medicina consolidativas per lonc temps, e no es consolidada.	Then I applied the restoration of the wound with consolidative medicine for a long time, but it did not consolidate.
E aprop yeu iteregui e descubregui sobre le os segondament sobre le descubriment primier, e atrobegui continua corrupcio am le os.	And then I tied and uncovered the bone again upon the first uncovering, and found continued corruption in the bone.
E serregui aquo que a mi apares de aquela corrupcio, e aprop yeu fo perforsat fayre la curacio de lu e restauracio, e no es restaurat.	And I tied that which appeared to me of that corruption, and then I saw it was fitting to do the cure and restoration of him, and he was not restored.
E adonc yeu descubri sobre lu autra veguada e no cessegui inscidir le os petit a petit particuladament e perforsa la restauracio de lu, e no es restaurat entro que inscidigui entorn un palm de lu, e aquel extraxi am la medula sua, e aprop restauregui aquel am medicinas, e es consolidat leugierament e sanat.	And then I uncovered him another way and did not cease to pierce the small bone little by little particularly and perfumed his restoration, and he was not restored until I had pierced around one palm of him, and that which I extracted with its marrow, and then I restored that with medicines, and it consolidated slightly and healed.
E no es necessaria iteracio en la operacio de lu e seccio de lu sino per la disposicio de la freulesa de lu e per la paucitat de la tollerancia de lu e paor de lu de mort, quar a lu accidia en totas horas per superfluitat de evacuacio sincopi mala.	And it was not necessary to iterate the operation upon him or his sectioning except by the disposition of his sickness and by the lack of his tolerance and fear of death, for he became lethargic at all hours due to excess evacuation.
E donc sanat es per sanacio entiera, e nada es en loc de os carn dura; e es fayta bona la disposicio de lu en le sieu cors e retornec la vertut de lu; e es conversat en las suas disposicios e no fec a lu contrarietat en ambulacio ni nocument en denguna causa.	And therefore he is healed by whole healing, and nothing is in the place of bone or hard flesh; and his disposition in his body has returned to its virtue, and his dispositions are converted and no contrariness was made to him in walking nor harm in any cause.
Mays si es os eminent en loc del cors ja trauquat, lahoras cove que tu secces aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu prenguas liament e strenh aquel en la extremitat de aquel os eminent, e comanda ad alcu que extenda aquel en sus; e pausa aquel liament de lana pus gros del primier liament; e aprop lia aquel sobre la carn que es dejos le os, e exten la extramitat de lu per que atires la carn a las partidas dejos, e tu descuebras la carn sobre le loc le qual voles serrar per que la serra no leda la carn.	But if the bone is prominent in the place of the body having been pulled out, then know that you should section it secondly in this manner: and take linen and tie that at the extremity of that prominent bone, and command someone to extend that in his hand; and pause that linen of woolen thread over the flesh which is below the bone, and extend its extremity so as to pull the flesh back to the parts below, and you uncover the flesh over the place where you wish to cut so that the saw does not cut the flesh.
E pausa fust o taula dejos le os decentment, quar quan tu fas aquo no es prohibida la serra que no secce la carn corrumpuda.	And pause a post or table below the bone properly, for when you do that it is not prohibited that the saw does not cut the corrupted flesh.
E cove que sia la serradura sobre le loc corrumput petit a petit, quar si es en la concavitat del os corrupcio e no appar en la sua apparicio al sentiment, e forssa a serratura de lu autra veguada.	And know that the sawing is upon the corrupted place little by little, for if it is in the concavity of the bone and corruption does not appear in its appearance to the sense, then force its cutting another way.
E si le os es corrumput e no-eminent, abantz es la una partida continuada am la autra, e la corrupcio es al mieg loc o en partida de lu, lahoras tu descuebre la carn de totas partz tota; e aprop pausa fust dejos, e aprop serra aquel de la primiera partida la on es la corrupcio entro que sia continuada la serratura del autra partida.	And if the bone is corrupted but not prominent, before it is one party continued with another, and the corruption is in its middle or in a part of it, then you uncover the flesh from all parts entirely; and then pause a post below, and saw that from the first party where the corruption is while the sawing continues through the other party.
E sia la serradura segon le loc de la corrupcio un petit, segon que havem dit.	And let the sawing be according to the place of the corruption a little, as we have said.
E si la corrupcio es en la junctura, inscideys aquela junctura corrumpuda, e serra le os la on es continuat del autra part.	And if the corruption is in the joint, enter that corrupted joint and saw the bone where it continues from the other part.
E si de la corrupcio es en la continuacio de doas juncturas, lahoras no es en lu razio sino engen.	And if the corruption is in the continuation of two joints, then there is not reason in him but foolishness.
E si la corrupcio es en le pecte de la ma o del pe, es mot dificil; empero cove que tu inquieras la corrupcio en qual manieyra appareys a tu, e que abradas aquela, e mondes aquela segon quascuna disposicio la qual es a tu possibla, e am cascum engen sia rectificat a tu, quan no fa a tu contrarietat vena o nervi.	And if the corruption is in the palm of the hand or the foot, it is very difficult; however, know that you inquire into the corruption in whatever manner it appears to you, and that you open that, and cut it according to any disposition which is possible for you, and with whatever foolishness is rectified for you, when it does not make a contrariness vein or nerve.
E sapias qual es inscididors e las serras a inscidir aquestz osses son motz segon le situament dels osses, e la preparacio de aquels, e la grosseza de aquels, e la subtilitat e la grandeza e la parvitat de aquels, e la duricia e la lor raritat; per que cove que tu prepares a tota specia de operacio estrument convenient ad aquela opperacio.	And know that the saws and the saws for cutting these bones are very according to the situation of those bones, and their preparation, and their thickness, and their subtlety and greatness and smallness, and their hardness and rarity; so that when you prepare for any kind of operation, convenient instrument for that operation.
E sapias que aquela operacio significa a tu sobre la specia del strument del qual indigeysses; quan am tu es gran studi e lonc e conoyssensa de las manieyras de aquesta art, e testimoni de manieyras de malautias, quar lahoras ja tu las avias per tu meteys aquo que es convenient a lu dels sturmentz a tota malautia.	And know that that operation signifies for you on the kind of instrument of which you are in need; when with you is great study and length and knowledge of the manners of this art, and testimony of manners of illnesses, for then you have by your parents that which is convenient to him of the instruments to every illness.
E yeu so a tu formant en la fi de aquest capitol le nombre dels instrumentz les quals pausaras cum eyssimples am les quals proceziras a la tua prohibicio la qual experimentaras sobre las autras.	And I shall tell you at the end of this chapter the number of the instruments which you will use with simples by which you will proceed to your prohibition, which you will experience on the others.

Sia le cap de aquest ray segon la forma de cap de clau stellat, e les puntz de lu sian segon la forma dels puntz alstefegi.	Let the head of this file be according to the form of a key star, and its points according to the form of the points of the saw.
E no conveneys sino que am aquel sian confricadatz les caps de las juncturas quan so corrumpudas, o es la boca gran ampla.	And it does not behoove that with that are rubbed the heads of the joints when they are corrupted, or is the great mouth wide.

E la extremitat de lu es triangulada e de aguda extremitat.	And its extremity is triangular and of acute extremity.
E es fayt de ferr de India , e semblantment cove que totas las causas que havem ditas de rasoris e de inscissoris e de serras.	And it is made of Indian iron, and similarly know that all the causes that we have said of saws and of incisers and of saws.
De inscizio extremitatz e de la serratura dels osses.	Of incising extremities and of the sawing of bones.
Las extremitatz se poyresso o per causa intrinseca o per causa extrinseca, o cum tu auras medicat aquela corrupcio per curacio de aquelas medicinas e la curacio no comfereys, o vezes la corrupcio anar deves le membre la qual no percuteys denguna causa, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquel membre entro aquo la hon acossec la corrupcio, per que le malaute evasesca per aquo de mort o de malicia que es major defeliment del membre.	The extremities become pus or by an intrinsic cause or by an external cause, or when you have medicated that corruption by cure of those medicines and the cure does not correspond, or sometimes the corruption goes down from the member where there was no cutting cause, then know that you incise that member where the corruption is located, for that the patient escapes by death or by malice which is the greater defect of the member.
E le senhal de aquel al qual accideys, es que·l membre es fayt negre entro que sia cujat que foc la ja comburit, o se poyreys aprop la negror entro que la poyredura aquela ane entro aquel membre que siec lu e que prengua tot le cors; e donc coyta te am inscizio de aquel.	And the sign of that to which it happens is that·the member is made black as if it were burned by fire, or it becomes pus properly the blackness within as the swelling, and therefore cut off from that.
E semblantment si es causa de la corrupcio percussio de alcunas causas venenosas ayssi cum de scorpio mari o de vupera o de rutela e de semblantz.	And similarly if it is a cause of the corruption by shock of some poisonous causes as of scorpion sea or of adder or of centipede or of scorpions, then cut off from that.
E si la corrupcio o la percussio es en la extremitat del dit, lahoras tu inscideys le dit e no dones spazi a la corrupcio per que ane entro a la ma.	And if the corruption or the shock is in the extremity of the finger, then you incise the finger and do not give space to the corruption for that it goes into the hand.
E semblantment si accedeys a la ma, lahoras tu inscideys aquela de la razit del focil, e no dones spazi a la corrupcio entro que prengua en le focil del bras.	And similarly if you access the hand, then you incise that of the knuckle of the fire-bone, and do not give space to the corruption for that it goes into the arm.
E si envezeys aquel, lahoras inscideys le bras entro al coyde en la junctura.	And if instead you incise the arm within at the elbow in the joint.
E si passa otra la corrupcio e la vezes enviro le coyde, lahoras en aquel es la mort del malaute; e aministrar autra causa otra aquo en curacio es quantitat de vertut.	And if another goes through and turns around the elbow, then in that is the death of the patient; and another cause another cure quantity of virtue.
E semblantment fay del pe quan corrupcio envezeys le dit del pe, lahoras tu inscideys aquel entro ad un dels nozes.	And similarly do the foot when corruption comes through the finger of the foot, then you incise that within at one of the toes.
E si pren en la pente del pe, lahoras tu inscideys tot le pe.	And if it affects the shoulder, then cut into the entire shoulder.
Mays si pueja entro al denol, lahoras tu inscideys la camba entro a la junctura del denol.	But if it can be seen in the groin, then cut into the groin up to the joint of the hip.
E si la corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denol, lahoras en lu no es engen sino dimissio, e layssar le malaute a la mort.	And if the corruption has already reached the hip, then in this case there is no cure but to release the patient and let him die.
E la manieyra de inscidir le membre o de serrar lu es que tu strenhas le liament en la partida pus dejos la qual voles inscidir, e strenh autre liament sobre le loc; e extenda le ministre un liament a las partidas dejos, e extenda le ministra autra liament en sus; e tu separa la carn la qual es entre dos liamentz ain spatum lat entro que sia descuberta tota la carn; e aprop sia inscidit o serrat.	And the way of cutting or binding the joint is to tighten the ligament at the part lowest down, which you want to cut, and tighten another ligament over it; and extend a ligament to the parts below, and extend the other one above; and separate the flesh which is between two ligaments so that all the flesh might be exposed, and then let it be cut or bound.
E cove que sia pausat drap de li de totas partidas per so que no toque le loc sa, e que vengua al malaute lesio ajustada e apostema caut.	And whatever is placed on top of the wound must not touch the wound itself but be applied with a dressing and bandage tightly so that there might come to the patient a wound healed and clean.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc quan obras, lahoras tu cauteriza le loc coytadament, o pausa sus lu alcunas polveras restrenhentz le sanc; e aprop retorna a la tua medicacio entro que sia complida.	But if there is bleeding from the wound, then cauterize it or place some powders upon it which stop the flow of blood; and return to your medicine until it is complete.
E aprop lia le membre plaguat am liament al u convenient, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And bind the wounded member with a ligature in whatever way you consider appropriate, and care for it until it is healed.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc a un home en le sieu pe, aquest meteys accident le qual yeu e a tu recomtat, le qual es quar accidic a lu negror en le sieu pe am adustio que era asemblada a combustio de foc.	And I remind you to do what happened to a man on his foot, this accident which I and you recorded; the man got blackness in his foot from burning which was like fire.
E aquela corrupcio accidic primierament en le sieu dit entro que tendec tot le pe.	And that corruption began in his toe so that it affected his whole foot.
E adonc aquel home preparec per si meteys pus que vic la curacio anar al membre am la vehemencia de lu que atrobec de dolor e de adustrio de lu, e el inscidic aquel pe entro a la junctura, e foc sanat.
