And then phlebotomize the vein along with little by little wide phlebotomies; and extract blood according to a temperate quantity or according to what you see is needed, because it is at that; and then make it like the other vein.
E aprop deslia le liament e strenh las doas venas am strictura migiera per so que·l malaute no sia prefocat, e laysa entro al mati quar la plagua es sanada.	And then loosen the ligature and constrict the two veins with a mild constriction so that the patient is not overwhelmed, and leave it into the mat so that the plague is healed.
E le juvament de la fleubotomia de las venas algerich, comfereys a petitas apostemas e pustulas de la boca e corrupcio de las gengivas e malas ulceracios e fissuras, e a malas ulceracios que so en le nas e en le circuit de lu.	And the advantage of phlebotomy of the veins algerich, brings small abscesses and pustules in the mouth and corruption of the gums and bad ulcers and cracks, and to bad ulcers that are in the nose and around it.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquelas es que fases cezer le malaute denant tu, e strenh le col de lu am una benda, e aprop revolveys las labias de lu e reguarda a doas venas de las quals la una es de la dextra de la labia e la segonda de la senestra; e la demonstracio de quascuna es per la negror de quascuna de amdos, e aquo mays es quar en le circuit de aquelas so venas menudas negras; e adonc inscideys cascuna per inscizio inscident.	And the quality of phlebotomy of these is that you make the patient lower his head to you and constrict his neck with a bandage, and then roll back his lips and look for two veins of which one is on the right side of the lip and the second on the left; and the demonstration of each is by the blackness of each of them, and this more because in the circuit of these are small black veins.
Mays si dubitacio es dejos tu, e no sabes qual es de aquelas, lahoras tu enten a inscisio de la major de aquelas, e de la pus manifesta de aquelas.	But if doubt is under you, and you don't know which is it, then you understand the incision of the largest of these, and of the most manifest pus of them.
E fay le semblant de las doas venas que so en las labias desus.	And make like the two veins that are on the lips above.
Mays costuma corr mays a inscidir las doas venas que so en la labia dejos.	But custom more inclines to incising the two veins that are on the lip below.
Mays de doas venas que so dejos la lengua le juvament es aprop la fleubotomia de la cephalica a prefocacios que so en le guolayro, a la malautia de la uvula, e a malautias de la boca.	But of two veins that are below the tongue, the advantage is appropriately phlebotomy of the cephalic one at infections that are in the gullet, at illnesses of the uvula, and at illnesses of the mouth.
E la qualitat de fleubotomar aquelas es que segue le malaute entre las tuas mas denant le solel, e eleva la lengua de lu, e reguarda dejos la lengua, de la un latz de lu vena e del autre latz vena, e la color de quascuna es declinant a negror.	And the quality of phlebotomy of them is that you follow the patient between your hands in front of the sun, and lift his tongue, and look below the tongue, from one side of him vein and from the other side vein, and the color of each is declining to blackness.
E adonc fleubotoma quascuna; e guarda te que no ultimes la tua ma en fleubotoman aquelas, quar dejos aquelas so arterias.	And then phlebotomize each one; and keep that you do not finish your hand in phlebotomy of them, because below those are arteries.
E las tuas venas que so fleubotomadas en le coyde so en las quals corr costuma en totz les homes, e la fleubotomia de lor es fayta segon dos manieyras, o pongen am le fleubotomi mirtilat o olivar a subtilitat declinant; o secsar am fleubotomi cutellar, e apelha si alnessil, e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And the veins that are phlebotomized in the head are those in which usually runs in all men, and the phlebotomy of them is done according to two manners, either put with the phlebotomy mirtilat or olive at subtlety declining; or secsar with phlebotomy cutellar, and it calls if alnessil, and this is its form:
E aquest alnessil es que conveneys a seccio e de aquels so specias latz e subtils segon la amplitut de las venas e segon la strictura de aquelas.	And this alnessil is that it agrees to secsar and of those are special sides and subtle according to the amplitude of the veins and according to the constriction of them.
Forma de fleubotomi mirti:	Form of phlebotomy mirtilat:
sia le latz de lu ayssi cum vezes, e conveneys a obrir las venas concavas plenas procedentz apparentz grossas, e ad aquelas que conteno sanc gros torbat.	Be the side of him thus with looking, and agree to open the veins concave full proceeding apparent thick, and to those that contain thick twisted blood.
E aquesta es la forma de fleubotomi olivar:	And this is the form of phlebotomy olive:
E aquest fleubotomi es de menor latitut e de pus subtil extremitat, e conveneys a fleubotomia de venas subtils que conteno sanc subtil citri.	And this phlebotomy is of lesser width and more subtle extremity, and agrees to phlebotomy of subtle veins that contain subtle citrus blood.
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de la vena basilica la qual es una de tres venas: quar extratz le sanc de las malautias que so dejos le guolayro e·l col, e de aquo que siec le pietz e·l ventre.	But the advantage of phlebotomy of the basilic vein which is one of three veins: because extracted the blood from the illnesses that are below the gullet and neck, and from what affects the feet and belly.
E conveneys al fleubotomador, quan fleubotomia aquela, que guarde be aquela e sia sobre-temor en aquela, quar dejos lu ha arteria, e si erra e ajusta en la punctura del fleubotomi, inscidira aquela arteria e accidira fluxs de sanc, per so que cove que no fleubotomes aquela am fleubotomi pungent, abantz sia sectant cum alnessil.	And it agrees to the phlebotomist, when phlebotomy that one, that he guard well and be on top of it, because below him is an artery, and if he errs and adjusts in the puncture of the phlebotomy, incise that artery and access flow of blood, so that he should not phlebotomize that with puncturing phlebotomy, before being cut off with alnessil.
E si no appar la basilica per apparicio manifesta, lahoras cove que tu laysses aquela e que tu mudes a la autre, o que cerques alcun ram sieu; o que fleubotomes en loc de lu finis del bras, quar aquela es manifesta; e secsa aquela am fleubotomi alnessil ayssi cum havem dit.	And if the basilic does not appear by manifest appearance, then let you leave that and move to the other one or seek some branch of it; or phlebotomize in the end of the arm, because that one is manifest; and cut off that with phlebotomy alnessil as we have said.
Mays si tu voles la fleubotomia de lu meteyssa, lahoras cove denant la strictura del bras que toques le loc entro que conogues le loc dels pols, e aprop senha sobre lu am tencha; e aprop lia le bras e secsa la vena am seccio concava am fleubotomi alnessil ayssi cum havem dit; e guarda te que caja la percussio per alcu spazi del loc de la arteria.	But if you want the phlebotomy of it meteyssa, then let in front of the constriction of the arm that you touch the place between which you know the location of the pulse, and then press on it with a thong; and let go of the arm and cut off the vein with secsar concave with phlebotomy alnessil as we have said; and keep that the percussion box for some space of the location of the artery.
E quan tu vezes, cum strenhes le liament, imflacio en le loc que has senhat am tencha, lahoras aquela inflacio es inflacio de la arteria, e donc squiva aquela.	And when you see, with constricting the ligature, swelling in the location that you have pressed with a thong, then that swelling is of the artery, and therefore loose that one.
E si vezes le sanc fluir en la fleubotomia ayssi cum aurina de enfant, e·l sanc es subtil rog, lahoras sapias que es del sanc de la arteria; e lahoras tu coyta e pausa le tieu dit sobre aquel per lonc spazi; e aprop osta le tieu dit, e si lo sanc es abscindit, quar motas veguadas es abscindit, lahoras tu strenh le bras e layssa aquel.	And if you see the blood flow in the phlebotomy thus with shining of child's milk, and the blood is subtil red, then know that it is of the blood of the artery; and then you press and pause your thumb over that for long space; and prop your thumb, and if the blood is cut off, because many times it is cut off, then you constrict the arm and leave that one.
E guardes le malaute de la moccio de lu, e sia sobre-temor de lu e no maugua aquel per alcus dias entro que sia sanat.	And keep the patient of the phlebotomy for several days until he is healed.
Mays si le sanc no es abscindit, e vezes que deves tu no es present medicina ad aquo, lahoras tu inscideys la arteria, si appar a tu; quar la extremitat de lu es contrayta, e es abscindit le sanc; o que prenguas scorsa de fistic, e fen aquela, e pren la una maytat e strenh aquela sobre le loc de la vena am strictura descent am liament e am pulvils entro al autra dia.	But if the blood is not cut off and you see that medicine to it does not help at all, then you incise the artery if it appears to you; because its extremity is contracted, and the blood is cut off; or take a piece of fistic, and fen it, and take the one end and constrict that over the location of the vein with constriction descending am ligature and am powder within on another day.
E lahoras si le sanc es abscindit, bo es; e sino, lahoras cura aquel am aquo del qual es precedit a la rememoracio del loc de las polveras abscindentz flux de sanc.	And then if the blood is cut off, well; and not, then heal that one by what from which it preceded to the remembrance of the location of the powders cut off flow of blood.
E la abscizio del sanc de lu es dificil en motas disposicios per le loc petit de la plagua e la possibilitat del liament del bras.	And the incision of the blood of it is difficult in many dispositions by the small location of the plague and the possibility of the constriction of the arm.
Mays de la vena fusca la fleubotomia es juvament que extratz lo sanc de la partida subirana del cap e a la partida dejos del cors; per aquo quar es composta de ram de la basilica e de ram de cephalica, ayssi cum havem dit.	But of the dark vein phlebotomy is advantage that extracted the blood from the superior part of the head and from the lower part of the body; because it is composed of a branch of the basilic and a branch of cephalic, as we have said.
E cove al fleubotomant aquela que sia sobre-temor en la fleubotomia de lu, quar dejos aquela es un nervi; e adonc si ajusta en la punctura del fleubotomi e atroba le nervi, accidira a lu stupor, e es difficil la sanacio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot, E aquest nervi motas veguadas apar al sentiment; e si es ocultat ad alcus homes e es subtil e no es monstrat, lahoras cove que tu pauses le fleubotomi am le qual tu fleubotomas am seccio de alnessil, e evita le nervi am la tua fortalesa.	And let the phlebotomist that one be on top in the phlebotomy of it, because below that is a nerve; and then if he adjusts in the puncture of the phlebotomy and hits the nerve, stupor will happen to him, and it is difficult for him to heal, and strong he is not healed at all; and this nerve many times appears to the sense; and if it is hidden in some men and is subtle and not shown, then let you pause the phlebotomy with which you phlebotomize with secsar of alnessil, and avoid the nerve by your strength.
E si la vena es entre dos nervis, lahoras tu fen la vena en la longitut.	And if the vein is between two nerves, then you fen the vein in length.
Le juvament de la fleubotomia de la vena cephalica es que atratz le sanc del cap e comfereys a las malautias dels huels.	The advantage of phlebotomy of the cephalic vein is that it attracts blood from the head and gives to illnesses of the eyes.
E cove en aquest propriament, si vols que la fleubotomes pungen am fleubotomi olivar o am fleubotomi mirti; quar es la pus salva de totas las venas, quar no es dejos lu arteria ni nervi.	And in this place specifically, if you want to let the phlebotomies bleed with olive phlebotomes or with myrtle phlebotomes; because it is the safest for all veins, since there are no arteries or nerves here.
Mays empero conveneys a tu deves la fleubotomia que guardes que am le fleubotomi no punguas le cap del lacert tant solament, e cerques le loc pus leugier, e no notz a lu, si no es atrobat am la percussio primieyra que sia sobre aquela am fleubotomia alcunas veguadas.	But nevertheless it is necessary that you should make the phlebotomy in such a way that with the phlebotomes you do not puncture only the head of the lymph node, but seek the place further away and do not press on it, unless it is moved by the first percussion that is over that where the phlebotomy will be made several times.
Mays empero fort leu es apostemat en alcus homes, quan no es fleubotomat en la primieyra percussio, mays no notz en re aquel apostema.	But very seldom is an abscess formed in some people when they are not phlebotomized on the first percussion, but they do not press on that abscess.
Mays la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquela e les accidentz de lu so motz, en les quals te cove cogitar en lor rectificacio.	But the quality of the phlebotomy of this and its accidents are many things, in which you need to consider their correction.
Le primier de lu es del qual cove que sapias que fleubotomia no es aministrada sino en conservacio de sanetat e per speransa de lu e cautela de aveniment de malautias, e que sia fayta fleubotomia en la una de las venas que so en le coyde, so es: cephalica, fusca e basilica; e que sia fayta fleubotomia al comensament de primaveyra, sobre dejun en primaviera e autunppne, e en invern aprop la comestio, quan apparo significacios de replecio.	The first of these is that you should know that phlebotomy is not administered except in preservation of health and for hope of it and precaution against onsets of illnesses, and that phlebotomy be made at the beginning of spring, after breakfast in spring and autumn, and in winter shortly after eating, when there appear signs of fullness.
E sia fayta fleubotomia e le tertz dia o al primier pus que del jorn siran passadas tres horas.	And phlebotomy be made on the third day or on the first more than three hours after dawn.
Mays fleubotomia que es aministrada, mays quan provoca convenencia e necessitat ad aquo, o de nuoyt o de dia, en tota hora e en tot temps.	But phlebotomy that is administered, but when it provokes convenience and necessity for it, either at night or day, in every hour and at all times.
E cove que efant no sia fleubotomat entro que aja xiiii ans, e femna que sia prenhs no sia fleubotomada sino del quart mes entro al sete, e les viels no sian fleubotomatz les quals ja han passatz lx ans.	And an infant should not be phlebotomized until he is fourteen years old, and a pregnant woman should not be phlebotomized except for the fourth month until the seventh, and the elderly should not be phlebotomized when they have already passed sixty years.
E cum alcu vol esser fleubotomat per qualque manieyra sia, cove que mondifique les sieus budels denant la fleubotomia am clisteri leon, si en aquels ha mota fenda retenguda, per so que las venas no atiro las superfluitatz en la fleubotomia dels budels, que son puridas, e que no noguan als membres principals.	And when someone wants to be phlebotomized for some reason, it is necessary that he cleanse his bowels before the phlebotomy with a lion’s-womb enema, if in these there are retained fissures, so that the veins do not throw off the superfluities in the phlebotomy of the bowels, which are purified, and so that they do not harm the principal members.
E no sian fleubotomatz les pascientz naucea sacertiva e crapula, ni evasent de malautia ni de ebretat entro que aquo sia remaugut aquo de lor, ni malaute de ydropici, e mays que fleubotomia sia temuda aprop colica passio e aprop vomit, e aprop cos de ventre, e aprop multiplicacio de coyt e de trebal e de exercici de dejunis o de vigilias e de tota causa que dissolveys la vertut, o sia corpore28 o animal.	And let those who are phlebotomized not be nauseous and drunk, nor recovering from illness or drunkenness until this is eliminated from them, nor sick of hydropsy, but let phlebotomy be feared when there is colic pain and vomiting, and after abdominal discomfort, and after multiplication of cough and fever and exertion from breakfasts or vigils and from all causes that dissolve strength, either corporeal or animal.
E aprop considera en subtiliacio de humos denant aquo si le sanc es gros, am viandas e beures, e am medicinas si aquo es a lu possible ad aquo.	And also consider the subtlety of humors before that if the blood is thick, with foods and drinks, and with medicines if it is possible for that.
E aprop intre en banh si alcuna causa no prohibeys, o sia excersitat per alcun exercici per so que·l sanc sia subtiliat.	And also go into a bath if no cause prohibits it, or be exercised by some exercise so that the blood is made subtle.
E pausa la fleubotomia de lu en le pietz del dia, so es enviro la hora de tercia, ayssi cum havem dit.	And make phlebotomy at about the third hour of the day, as we have said.
E perforsa te que·l pietz de aquel sia guardat en aquel dia de totz mals accidentz animals, ayssi cum es angustia, ira, temor, e de totz accidentz corporals, ayssi cum es trebal e pena superflua e coyt e semblantz a lor.	And for that the feet of that one be guarded on that day from all accidents of animals, as they are anguish, anger, fear, and from all corporal accidents, as they are exertion and excessive pain and cough and their likenesses.
E a la sua sezelha fassa esser presentz las causas en le us de la qual corr costuma dels homes am aromaticitat e odorament e am bals e semblantz ad aquels segon la cantitat de possibilitat.	And let the causes be present in the use of which the blood is used by men with aromatics and incense and balms and their likenesses according to the quantity of possibility.
E segua le fleubotomador sobre un coyssi que sia pus aut que·l coyssi de aquel que deu esser fleubotomat.	And let the phlebotomist follow on a cushion that is higher than the cushion of him who must be phlebotomized.
E aprop extragua le sieu bras, e fregue aquel am la sua ma le fleubotomador doas o tres veguadas; e aprop strenha le liament am correia e involva aquel doas veguadas.	And also stretch out his arm, and wipe that with his hand the phlebotomist two or three times; and also tighten the bandage with a strap and wrap it two times.
E sia la strictura temprada, quar la strictura quant no es engual, o la strictura es am superfluitat, lahoras prohibeys de fluxs del sanc; o es am mollificacio, e lahoras prohibeys le cors del sanc eyssament.	And let the compression be moderate, because compression when it is equal or the compression is of superfluity, then flow of blood is prohibited; or it is of softening, and then blood of the body flows out.
E aprop la strictura, cove que aquel que deu esser fleubotomat fregue las suas mas ensemps entre lor entro que las venas sian imfladas, e sian declaradas al sentiment.	And also let that one who is to be phlebotomized rub his hands together in between them until the veins are swollen and declared by feeling.
E aprop le fleubotomador unte le sieu fleubotomi am un pauc de oli antic propriament; e aprop pausa le sieu di indic de la ma senestra sobre aquela vena, dejos le loc del qual vol la fleubotomia, per que la vena fuja un pauc, e la percussio sia sessada quar de las venas es la qual atrobas ayssi cum corda fugent deves la fleubotomia, e de aquelas es que es plena de ventositat e quan pauses le fleubotomi sobre aquela es contrayta deves le fleubotomi, e es desceubut le fleubotomador; e le fleubotomi no uobre la vena, e si uobre, aquela es streyta.	And let the phlebotomist anoint his phlebotomes with a little old oil properly; and also pause his finger of the left hand over that vein from which he wants to phlebotomize so that the vein escapes a little, and the compression is relaxed because from those veins through which the blood flows out is the one through which the phlebotomy should be made, and when he pauses the phlebotomes over it are contracted by the phlebotomes, and the phlebotomist is discharged; and if the phlebotomes open the vein, that one is contracted.
E donc, per aquo cove que·l fleubotomador sia fermat e sia sollicit en totas aquestas causas.	And thus, for this reason let the phlebotomist be careful and persistent in all these causes.
E aprop depause le fleubotomi, mays si la vena es huberta en una veguada, lahoras bo es; e sino, tu itera aquo autra vaguada dejos aquel loc un pauc, o sobre lu am festinacio, si le loc no es apostemat.	And also pause the phlebotomes, but if the vein is opened in one go, then it is; and if not, you iterate that again another time over that location a little, or on it with compression, if the location is not inflamed.
Et si le loc es apostemat, o le malaute se spauresca, lahoras tu le layssa per un dia o per dos, e no strenha le liament, quar fort leu atirara apostema caut, ni no intre en banh.	And if the location is inflamed or the patient becomes frightened, then let him be laid for a day or two, and do not tighten the bandage, because it will soon draw out the abscess cauterizing, nor enter into a bath.
E aprop itera la fleubotomia si la ama.	And also iterate the phlebotomy if he desires it.
E si la apercio es petita e corr sanc subtilment, e temes que non yesca sanc la cantitat que voles, lahoras tu itera le fleubotomi en aquel trauc segon rectitut e ajusta en la appercio un pauc, e fay aquo am festinacio denant que·l loc sia apostemat, quar le loc es apostemat en motz homes deves pauca apercio.	And if the impression is small and the blood flows subtly and he fears that there does not flow blood in the quantity which he wants, then iterate the phlebotomes on that wound according to rectitude and adjust it a little in the impression, and do this with compression before the location is inflamed, because the location is inflamed in many men through little impression.
Mays si vezes aquel ja apostemat, lahoras no iteres sobre lu, quar no escusa a tu alcuna causa; e pausa sobre aquel alcuna partida de la fenda de oli, quar alleuja le cors del sanc.	But if he has already been inflamed, then do not iterate on it because it does not excuse you for any cause; and pause over that any part of the wound with oil, because it soothes the blood of the body.
E es milhor en aquest loc que oli e que les autres olis.	And is better in this location than other oils.
E semblantment aministra fenda de oli en tota fleubotomia am la qual fleubotomes las venas deves la prohibicio de cors de sanc, e fan aquo tyriaca alfadoc e sagzenea quan es pausat de la una de aquelas sobre le loc, quar le sanc es subtiliat e es revolvut quan es gros.	And likewise administer oil in every phlebotomy when the phlebotomes are stopped by the prohibition of flow of blood of the body, and make tyriaca with alfredoc and sagzenea when it is paused over that one of those on the location, because the blood is made subtle and is drawn out when it is thick.
E si en le loc de la fleubotomia es engendrat gran apostema, quar motas veguadas accideys, e majorment ad aquel que no es stat sangnat sino aquela veguada, o en la apercio de la vena pauca, e lahoras tu coyta, e pausa sobre le loc sponja infuza en aygua e sal, un pauc scalfada, e strenh aquela per una hora, quar es dissolvut.	And if a large abscess is engendered at the location of the phlebotomy because many times it has happened and more to that one which was not phlebotomized except for that go, or in the impression of the vein little, then let him be cauterized and pause over the location sponge moistened with water and salt, a little heated, and tighten that for an hour, because it is dissolved.
E cove que fassa aquo aprop le yssiment del sanc de aquela vena am compliment de lu o de autra vena.	And let him make that also the flow of blood from that vein with completion of it or from another vein.
E si roman en le loc per alcus dias alcuna negror o viriditat, no notz aquo; e si voles, pausa sobre aquel alcuna causa de aloen e de mirra dissolvut, o alcuna causa de suc de mentastre o de calament o semblant de lu.	And if there appears in the location for some days blackness or greeness, do not press on it; and if you wish, pause over that any cause of aloe and dissolved myrrh, or any cause of juice of wormwood or of powder or its likeness.
E motas veguadas accideysso apostemas e eminencias deves fleubotomia de la basilica.	And many times it has happened that abscesses and protuberances are engendered by phlebotomy of the basilica.
E donc pausa la tua ma sobre aquela, e si lahoras tu atrobas mollicia deves la tua compressio sobre aquela, lahoras aquela eminencia es malvada e mala; e adonc guarda te que pauses sobre aquela alcuna causa de aquo que havem dit, quar fort leu fluira de la arteria sanc.	And thus pause your hand over that and if you then tighten the softness with your compression over that, then that protuberance is evil and bad; and therefore beware that you pause over that any cause of what we have said, because it will soon flow from the artery blood.
E fay emplaustre am aquo en que es stipticitat, per que le loc sia endurat, e aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And make a plaster with that in which it is tight, so that the location be hardened, and also cure that with the other cure when it has healed.
E cove que extraguas del sanc a tot hom segon la quantitat de la sua vertut e segon la color vencent sobrc le sanc segon que appar.	And anyone who extracts blood from every person according to the amount of his virtue and according to the color appearing on the blood, according to what appears.
Quar si le sanc es negre, lahoras tu le layssa yssir entro que sia rog; e semblantment si tu le vezes gros, lahoras tu le layssa yssir entro que sia subtiliat; e semblantment si es agut, entro que sia ostada la acuitat de lu.	Because if the blood is black, then let it be left until it becomes red; and similarly, if you see it thick, then let it be left until it becomes thin; and similarly, if it is sharp, let its acuteness be stopped.
E cove ad aquel que es ple e fort e ha necessitat de extraccio de sanc en una veguada, que sia amplificada la fleubotomia de la vena e le fleubotomi sia lat.	And to whom it is full and strong and has the need of bloodletting in one sitting, then let the phlebotomy be amplified and the phlebotomies be wide.
E en aquel que es freul, sia fayt le contrari de aquel, e cove que extragua aquel en tropas veguadas, e que le trauc sia streyt.	And for one who is pale, let the opposite of that be done to him; and whoever extracts that in several sittings, then let the incision be tight.
E le milhor que es administrat en fleubotomia de vena es que sia la seccio transversa, no punctura.	And the best that is administered in phlebotomy of the vein is that it be a cross-section, not a puncture.
E aquesta manieyra de fleubotomia es salva de flux de sanc e de inscizio de nervi, e es pus lausabla e pus salva que fleubotomia segon latitut e longitut.	And this manner of phlebotomy is safe from bleeding and incision of the nerves, and it is more praiseworthy and safer than phlebotomy according to width and length.
E a la qual es acostumat sobrevenir sincopi deves la fleubotomia, e cove que tu cures aquel denant la fleubotomia am un petit de pa infus en vi de milgranas o de oximel simple scalfat; e extratz a l u del sanc en tres veguadas o quatre.	And to whom it is accustomed to have a fainting after the phlebotomy, then treat that person before the phlebotomy with a little bread infused in wine of pomegranates or of simple oxymel warmed; and extract from him some blood in three or four sittings.
E si es enfregiditat de compleccio, lahoras prengua denant la fleubotomia pa infus en eyssarop de mirra o en eyssarop de mel aromatizat am specias ayssi cum am pebre, canela, gingiebre e semblantz, o en eyssarop aromatizat e mot odorant.	And if it is weakness of complexion, then take before the phlebotomy bread infused in myrrh syrup or in scented honey syrup with spices such as pepper, cinnamon, ginger and similar, or scented syrup and very aromatic.
E si accideys sincopi deves la fleubotomia, e es causa de lu issiment de mot sanc, lahoras cove que prengua en beure aygua de carn e eyssarop mot odorant subtil; e use de aromaticitat am algualea, e sia linit le sieu pietz am aquela.	And if a fainting occurs due to the phlebotomy, and it is caused by losing too much blood, then take before drinking water with meat and scented syrup very subtle; and use of aromatics with aloes wood, and let him apply that to his feet.
E usa de las autras causas que havem ditas en la divisio en le capitol de sincopi per evacuacio.	And use the other causes which we have mentioned in the division in the chapter on fainting by evacuation.
E qui vol eventar le sieu bras e dissolver le sieu sanc segonda veguada, cove a lu del qual la fleubotomia es per mota evacuacio, e la vertut de lu es freol, que evacue le sanc petit a petit, so es segon la quantitat de la vertut en les dias continuables.	And whoever wants to vent his arms and dissolve his blood in the second sitting, then let him who has phlebotomy as much evacuation, and whose virtue is cold, evacuate the blood little by little according to the amount of his virtue in continuous days.
Mays qui vol eventar le sieu bras, e gitar lo sieu sanc segonda vetz, e le sieu cors es fort, lahoras fassa aquo aprop vii horas o ix de la primieyra fleubotomia.	But whoever wants to vent his arms and withdraw his blood a second time, and his body is strong, then let him do that about seven or nine hours from the first phlebotomy.
Mays qui vol atirar le sanc del cors sieu al contrari de la partida a la qual declina, cove que sia eventat en le segon dia o le tertz.	But whoever wants to withdraw blood from his body in the opposite direction to which he is declining, then let him be vented on the second or third day.
Mays aquel cors en le qual es mot sanc ja scalfat e es acuit e fa accidir febre, cove que sia gitat de lu sanc en una veguada e sia de lu gitada gran cantitat e sia amplificada la apercio entro que accidesca sincopi, pus que tu auras conservadas totas las condicios de fleubotomia; e que pauses la tua ma sobre le pols de lu deves le cors del sanc, per que no endevengua mort en loc de sincopi, quar motas veguadas endeve aquo quan le fleubotomador es ignorant e negligent.	But the body in which much blood has already been withdrawn and it is acute and causes fever, then let him have his blood withdrawn in one sitting and have a large quantity withdrawn from him and have the incision amplified so that fainting does not occur; and when the doctor's hand on the pulse of the patient so that death does not occur in place of fainting, for many times this happens when the phlebotomist is ignorant and negligent.
E no cove quan tu voles desliar le bras e evacua le sanc segonda veguada, cum ja sia claus le orrifici de la vena e sia fayt difficil issiment del sanc, que tu premas subre aquel am vehemencia e encurvat sia extendut leugierament, quar aquo es trop mal.	And do not press when you want to withdraw blood and evacuate blood a second time, when the orifice of the vein is already closed and it is difficult to draw blood, because if you press strongly on that and it is extended slightly, then that is very bad.
Habantz le layssa entro que sia fleubotomat segondament; o remau aquo am la acuitat del fleubotomi que es coagulat del sanc en le orrifici de la vena; o pausa sobre aquel de tyriaca alfarach, o de sagzenea, e comprem aquel am compressio leugiera entro que·l sanc sia fora yssit.	Let it not remain so that it is phlebotomized again; or if there is a clot of blood in the orifice of the vein, pause on that with alfarach or with saguine, and compress that gently until the blood comes out.
E si la vena es apostemada, lahoras layssa aquela e no la toques entro que·l apostema sia sedat.	And if the vein is swollen, then leave it and do not touch it until the swelling goes down.
E si necessitat te provoca a evacuar le sanc segondament, e no es excusacio, lahoras tu sagna aquel sobre aquel loc o en l’autre bras en autra vena.	And if the need arises to evacuate the blood again, and it is not an excuse, then you will bleed that person on that spot or on the other arm in another vein.
E la vena apelada “funis del bras” es fleubotomada en loc de la fusca o de la basilica, quan no so atrobadas o so amaguadas, quar es composta de aquelas.	And the vein called “veins of the arm” is phlebotomized instead of the basilic or the cephalic when they are not found or are hidden, because it is composed of those.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intrometa la sua ma en aygua cauda entro que·l focil se enrogezesca e que la vena apparia manifestament.	And the quality of phlebotomy of it is that the patient immerses his hand in warm water so that the vein becomes dilated and appears apparently.
E aprop sia strengut sobre aquel am liament am strictura migana; e aprop fleubotoma segon le tranvers petit, no latitudinalment ni segon la longitut.	Then let it be tightened on that with a ligature with mild tightness, and let the phlebotomy be done according to the small cross, not longitudinally nor according to length.
E sia la apercio ampla e sia la tua fleubotomia am la qual tu fleubotomas aquela sobre la junctura de la ma un petit.	And let the incision be wide and let your phlebotomy with which you phlebotomize that person be on the joint of the hand a little.
E si es prohibit le fluxs del sanc, lahoras tu itera la ma en l’aygua cauda e layssa le sanc correr en la aygua entro que consieguas la tua necessitat.	And if the flow of blood is prohibited, then immerse the hand in warm water and let the blood run in the water until you see your need.
Mays si tu eras en les dias d’estiu, lahoras tu yest excusat de la iteracio de la ma en l’aygua cauda, e le mes es pausat le cors del sanc en aygua cauda en temps de yvern.	But if you are in the days of summer, then you will be excused from immersing the hand in warm water; and let the body of the blood be paused in cold water during winter.
E la fleubotomia de aquesta vena es pus salva que de totas las autras venas, quar dejos lu no ha vena pulsatil, ni nervi.	And phlebotomy of this vein is safer than of all the other veins, because there is no pulsating vein or nerve in it.
E la fleubotomia de la savatella de la ma dreyta es conferent a las malautias del fetge.	And phlebotomy of the wrist of the right hand is related to diseases of the liver.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que tu strenguas la ma am liament o am la tua ma, pus que tu l’as mesa en ayga cauda, entro que la vena sia imflada e sia be demostrada al vezement; e aprop fleubotoma aquela transversan; e si inscidas aquela de tot no nozera aquo en re.	And the quality of phlebotomy of it is that you tighten the hand with a ligature or your hand, because you have immersed it in warm water, until the vein is swollen and is demonstrated obviously to the eye; and let the incision be made transversely on it; and if the incision is made anywhere else, then it will not benefit at all.
E conserve que no ultimes la tua ma am la fleubotomi, quar dejos lu so les nervis dels ditz denudatz de carn.	And take care that you do not cut your hand with the phlebotomy, because underneath there are nerves of the fingers stripped of flesh.
E aprop itera la ma en l’aygua cauda e laysse correr le sanc en aquela, quar si tu no iteras aquela en l’aygua cauda, le sanc sira coagulat en lo orrifici de la vena, e es prohibit de flux.	Then immerse the hand in warm water and let the blood run in that, because if you do not immerse it in the warm water, the blood will clot in the orifice of the vein, and its flow is prohibited.
E cum es extrayt le sanc segon la quantitat de necessitat, lahoras tu pausa sobre la vena oli e sal, per que no sia consolidada coytadament; e semblantment cove que tu fassas en tot ram streyt.	And when the blood is withdrawn according to the amount of need, then let you pause on the vein olive oil and salt, so that it does not clot firmly; and similarly, let you do in every branch tightly.
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de aquela de la ma senestra, es que es conferent a las malautias de la melsa.	But the benefit of phlebotomy of that of the left hand is related to diseases of the brain.
E fay semblantment en la fleubotomia de lu ayssi cum has fayt en l’autra.	And do similarly in the phlebotomy of it as you have done in the other one.
E le juvament de la vena sephena de la fleubotomia es a las malautias que so en la partida dejos del cos, ayssi cum so malautias de la mayre, e a retencio de mestruas, et a las malautias dels ronhos e ulceracios de coyssas e de cambas antiquas, e a lor semblantz de las malautias.	And the benefit of phlebotomy of the cephalic vein is to diseases that are below the body, as well as diseases of the mother, and to retention of menstruation, and to diseases of the knees and ulcers of the legs, and their likes in diseases.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute entrometa lo sieu pe en aygua cauda e fassa sobre aquel fricacio entro que be apparen las venas; e lia sobre la junctura del pe am correia; e le loc de la vena le talo apparent deves le dit pous, e de aquela so ramificatz en la facia del pe motz ramps.	And the quality of phlebotomy of it is that the patient immerses his foot in warm water and rubs on that so that the veins appear; and press on the joint of the foot with a strap; and the location of the vein let it be seen from the toe pushing, and from there it branches into the fascia of the foot many branches.
E donc fleubotoma le pus ample ram o dejos la camba deves le talo deves la agreguacio de lu, quar es milhor e pus sal.	And therefore phlebotomize the wider ram or below the leg from where the toe comes, because it is better and more safe.
E si fleubotomas aquela en la facia del pe, lahoras tu te guarda dels nervis que so dejos aquela sobre la facia del pe, e pausa la tua fleubotomia am la qual tu fleubotomas per le travers, quays cum si tu la volias inscidir.	And if phlebotomize that in the fascia of the foot, then you must guard against the nerves that are below that on the fascia of the foot; and let your phlebotomy be made according to the cross, just as if you wanted to make an incision.
E sia le fleubotomi vosil.	And let the phlebotomies be mild.
Mays si es prohibit le issiment del sanc; lahoras tu itera le pe de lu en l’aygua cauda e layssa correr le sanc en aquela entro que sia evacuat.	But if the flow of blood is prohibited, then immerse his foot in warm water and let the blood run in that until it is evacuated.
E si le fleubotomador erra en la primieyra veguada, lahoras itera am le fleubotomi en sus un pauc, quar le loc es sal; e no temes de lu malician, mays que te guardes dels nervis ayssi cum havem dit.	If the phlebotomist makes a mistake on the first attempt, then repeat with the phlebotomy on a few more occasions, for the site is salty; and do not fear ill will from him, but rather protect yourself from the nerves as we have said.
E semblantment fay de la sophena del autre pe engualment.	And similarly, treat the other foot in the same way.
E de la vena sciatica, le loc ayssi cum havem dit es deves le talo dejos la cavilha de la partida silvestra.	And for the sciatic vein, the site as we have said is below the ankle of the wild part.
E le juvament de la fleubotomia de lu es a dolo de anca quan es per sanc caut.	And the cause of pain in the hip when phlebotomy is performed is because of clotted blood.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intre en banh, e festine e strenha la cueyssa de lu del latz de la ancha entro desus le talo desus quatre ditz an una benda longua subtil, quar no appar sino per aquo.	And the quality of the phlebotomy is that the patient enters into a bath, and hastens and tightens his thigh from the side of the buttock up to above the ankle in four places with one long, thin bandage, for it does not appear except through this.
E donc quan appar, lahoras tu fleubotoma aquela segon cascun engen que es a tu possible e segon le tranvers, e es milhor; o inscidas aquela per inscizio o secces aquela per seccio, quar le loc de lu es sal.	And therefore, when it appears, then you phlebotomize that according to each plan that is possible for you and according to the cross, and it is better; or pierce that through incision or cut that through section, for the site of it is salty.
E ela es en motz homes mot ameguada; e si atrobas aquela, e no appar al sentiment de tot, lahoras fleubotoma alcun ram de lu, e es aquel que appar en le dos del pe enves le dit auricular e le anular.	And it is in most men hidden; and if you pierce that and it does not appear to the senses at all, then phlebotomize a branch of it, and it is that which appears on the back of the foot opposite the little finger and the ring finger.
E guarda te dels nervis, e fay correr del sanc la quantitat que voles.	And beware of the nerves, and let blood flow in the quantity that you want.
E aprop deslia la strictura e pausa sobre le loc de la fleubotomia coto e strenh le loc, quar leugierament es sanat.	Then loosen the tightness and place a bandage over the site of the phlebotomy tightly, for quickly it will be healed.
De ventozacio e de las qualitatz de uzar de aquelas.	Of ventilation and of the qualities of using those.
Ventozas so de corns, o de eram, o de veyre.	Ventozes are of horn, or of ram, or of bone.
E ventozacio es fayta segon doas manieyras: la una de lor es am scarificacio e extracio de sanc, e l’autra es ventozacio ses scarificacio.	And ventilation is done according to two manners: one of them is with scarification and extraction of blood, and the other is ventilation without scarification.
E aquesta ventozacio que es ses scarificacio es segon doas manieyras, quar o es am foc o ses foc.	And this ventilation which is without scarification is according to two manners, for it is either with fire or without fire.
E a las ventozas que so administradas am scarificacio e extraccio de sanc son xiiii locs del cors, dels quals la un en lo qual so pausadas ventozas es alnocrati, e es la deriera partida del cap; e le mieg loc d’el de doas partz del col ensemp; e ventozas del mento dejos la mandibula pus dejos de la boca; e ventozas de doas spatulas; e ventozas de alohoster, e es sobre la fi de la coeta; e ventozas de dos focils, e so de dos brasses; e ventozas de doas cavilhas; e ventozas de doas cuoyssas.	And to the ventozes that are administered with scarification and extraction of blood there are fourteen locations in the body, of which one in which ventozes are placed is the alnocrati, and it is the posterior part of the head; and the middle location of them of two parts of the neck together; and ventozes of the mentum below the mandible further down from the mouth; and ventozes of two spatulas; and ventozes of the aloetaster, and it is above the end of the tail; and ventozes of two focils, and they are of two breasts; and ventozes of two cavilhas; and ventozes of two thighs.
E ventozacio no extratz le sanc sino de las venas menudas sparssas en la carn, e per aquo no catz la vertut per aquelas, ayssi cum es cazement per fleubotomia; ni no cove que ventozacio sia fayta am foc o ses foc en alcuna malautia fayta per replecio entro que le cors tot sia evacuat.	And ventilation does not extract blood except from the small, sparse veins in the flesh, and for this reason it does not possess the virtue of those as cauterization through phlebotomy; nor do I believe that ventilation should be done with fire or without fire in any disease caused by fullness when the whole body is evacuated.
Mays si necessitat provoca a ventozacio per malautia o per continua, aministrem aquela en tota hora al comensament del mes e en la fi de lu, e en le mieg loc de lu e en qualque temps sia.	But if necessity prompts ventilation for disease or for continuous, we administer that throughout the entire hour at the beginning of the month and in its end, and in the middle location of it and in any time it is.
La qual causa es quar dels homes es en les quals es sanc multiplicat entro que indigeys de extraccio de lu per ventozacio e atroba en le sieu cap graveza e soda; e de aquels es que atroba replecio e rogor en la sua cara e en le sieu cap, e en le sieu col; e de aquels es que atroba pruziment en la sua cara e en le sieu front e tenebrositat e hebetut en les sieus huels; e de aquels que gieta le loc de la sua ventozacio; e de aquels es que le lor ris es multiplicat; e de aquels es que atroba gustament de sanc en la sua boca, o que la lengua es apostemada e escup sanc; e de aquels es que lor dormir es multiplicat, e de aquels que vetz sanc en lo dormir rogor e antics e plaguas e autras causas a lor semblantz.	The cause of which is that in men there is blood multiplied within when indigestion occurs from extraction of it through ventilation and it causes heaviness and swelling in their head; and in those who cause fullness and heat in their face and in their head, and in their neck; and in those who cause pulsation in the face and on the forehead and darkness and feebleness in their eyes; and in those whose mouth is dry; and in those whose sleep is disturbed; and in those who see blood in their sleep with heat and age spots and other causes similar to them.
E donc quan vezes en alcuna causa de aquelas, e propriament si es en le tertz o miga del mes, lahoras comandam ventozacio esser fayta pus que so passadas del dia dos o tres horas.	And therefore when you see in any cause of those, and particularly if it is in the third or middle of the month, then we command ventilation to be done after two or three hours have passed of the day.
E juvament de ventozacio de la nuca es que quan aquela confereys a gravitat en le cap e ad aquo que es efondit als huels; mays cove que aquo sia aprop evacuacio de tot le cors.	And advantage of ventilation of the nape is that when it conferes to heaviness in the head and to that which is sunken into the eyes; but beware that this be proper evacuation of the whole body.
E aquesta ventoza es en le loc de fleubotomia de la cephalica.	And this ventilation is in the site of phlebotomy of the cephalic.
E no es legut que use de lu aquel que es de frega complecio, o en le qual es catarr, quar dona ad aquel gran nocument.	And it is not proper to use that which is of complex friction, or in which there is catarrh, for it gives great harm to him.
E per aquo no cove que uso de aquela les vielhs, e en les caps dels quals so malautias frejas.	And for this reason it is not proper that use of that by the elderly, and in heads in which there are cool diseases.
Mays ad aquel que sobre aquela es continuant sobre lu es fayta oblivio; e per aquo cove que tu comandes al ventozador que depause la sua ma un petit am la ventosa a las partidas dejos, temen de la generacio de oblivio.	But to him for whom that is continually over him is done forgetfulness; and for this reason you command the ventozador to pause his hand a little with the ventosa at the sites below, fearing the generation of forgetfulness.
Mays ventozacio de alkehel es en loc de fleubotomia de la vena fusca e de la basilica: e per aquo confereys a asma, e a la constriccio de ale e a la scissura del sturment de ale, e a tos, e a replecio.	But ventilation of alkehel is in the site of phlebotomy of the fusca vein and of the basilica: and for this reason it confers to asthma, and to constriction of throat and to splitting of voice of throat, and to cough, and to fullness.
E cove que sia enpellida la ventoza alkehel un petit, quar si es pausada dejos, engendra debilitat en le cors e en le stomac.	And it is proper that the ventosa of alkehel be bound a little, for if it is placed below, it generates weakness in the body and in the stomach.
E la ventozacio de alhagdahan confereys a las dolors accident en le cap e a obtalmia, e emigranea, e prefocacio, e a dolors en las razitz de las dentz; e es en loc de fleubotomia de la basiliqua.	And ventilation of alhagdahan confers to accidental pains in the head and to ophthalmia, and to emigration, and to pre-fever, and to pains in the roots of teeth; and it is in the site of phlebotomy of the basilica.
E cove que comandes al ventozador que no prema la sua ma am scarificacio per que no inscida la arteria e accida fluxs de sanc.	And you command the ventozador not to press his hand with scarification so that it does not pierce the artery and cause flow of blood.
E ventozacio dejos le mento comfereys a alcola en la boca, e a corrupcio de la gingiva, e a semblantz a lor de las malautias que so en la boca, e stan en loc de fleubotomia de aliheric que so en las doas labias.	And ventilation below the mentum confers to alcola in the mouth, and to corruption of the gum, and to appearance similar to them of diseases which are in the mouth, and they stand in the site of phlebotomy of aligeric which is on the two lips.
Mays la ventozacio que es fayta sobre las doas spatulas confereys a caphatan, le qual es fayt per replecio de caliditat.	But the ventilation which is done over the two spatulas confers to caphatan, which is done through fullness of heat.
E la ventosacio de las doas partidas dedintz dels focils confereys juvament de la fleubotomia de tres venas, so es de la basilica, fusca e cephalica, quar aquela atratz le sanc de totas aquelas venas pus manudas que so en la carn, e aquelas venas menudas de las autras venas pus grossas entro que pervengua la atraccio a las tres venas.	And the ventilation of the two sites within the breasts confers advantage of phlebotomy of three veins, that is, of the basilica, fusca and cephalic, for it attracts blood from all those veins more delicate than the other veins more coarse within that the attraction reaches the three veins.
E comanda al ventozador que trop no procezesca en scarificacio, quar le loc es denudat de carn, e dejos lu so nervis e arterias.	And command the ventozador that he does not proceed with scarification, for the site is deprived of flesh, and below it are nerves and arteries.
E es una ventoza am la qual es ventozat sobre alshosses e confereys a las emorroydas del cul e a las ulceracios pus dejos.	And it is one ventilation with which is ventilated over the buttocks and confers to hemorrhoids of the anus and to ulcers further down.
E cove que comandes al ventozador que sia gran ventoza, e que sia de eram, quar le loc indigeys de fort seccio; e fort leu so traucadas ventozas subtils e sia scarificat am scarificacio.	And you command the ventozador that it be large ventilation, and that it is of horn, for the site indigests from strong section; and it is done with strong piercings strong and ventilation be bound subtle piercings and is scarified with scarification.
Mays ventozas de las cambas minueysso per minuicio manifesta, quar atiran le sanc de tot le cors, e comfereysso a dolors antiquas dels ronhos e de la mayre, e de la vesica; e provocan las mestruas, e comfereysso a bothor e ademil; e stan en loc de fleubotomia de doas sophenas, e alahorcoben, e de doas cavilhas.	But ventozes of the thighs be done through mild mildness, for they will draw blood from all the body, and confer to ancient pains of the knees and of the mother, and of the bladder; and they provoke menstruation, and confer to bothor and ademil; and they stand in the site of phlebotomy of two sophenas, and under the armpits, and of two cavilhas.
Enpero mot debelitan tot le cors e fan accidir sincopi en motz homes.	However they weaken all the body and cause syncope in some men.
E de las ventozas alahorcoben le juvament es propda al juvament a las ventozas de doas cambas.	And of the ventozes under the armpits, the advantage is similar to the advantage to the ventozes of two thighs.
E la qualitat de la posicio de las ventozas es que pauses la ventoza al comensament vueda e sucguas per succio temprada, e no prolongues la posicio de las ventozas, mays pausa aquelas leugierament, e reman aquelas coytadament, e que las humors venguan al loc per adveniment engual.	The quality of the cupping position is that you place the cup at the beginning, let it suck with moderate suction, and do not prolong the position of the cups, but place them lightly, and leave them tightly, so that the humors come to the site evenly.
E no cesses iterar aquo e continuar entro que veja le loc ja enrojezir e inflar e que appara la rogor del sanc.	And do not cease to iterate this and continue until you see the site already reddened and swollen and the heat of the blood appearing.
E lahoras tu scarifiqua e itera la succio pauc a pauc, e aprop considera en la dispozicio dels cors.	And then you scarify and iterate the suction little by little, and then consider the disposition of the body.
Quar aquel home que es de tendra carn de rars pors, cove que tu le scarifiques una veguada e no pus, per que le loc no sia ulcerat.	Because a man who has tender flesh in few places, you should scarify him once and not pus, so that the site is not ulcerated.
E comanda al ventozador que amplifique la scarificacio e pronde un pauc, e atempre la succio am facilitat.	And command the cupper to enlarge the scarification and take a few, and temper the suction with ease.
E si en le sanc es grossitut, lahoras cove que scarifiques doas veguadas, quar en la primieyra veguada es uberta la via de subtiliacio al sanc e a la aquositat de lu.	And if the blood is thick, then you should scarify twice, because in the first cupping, the pathway of subtlety to the blood and its moisture is opened.
Mays en la segunda a la perscrutacio aquisida de la extraccio del sanc gros.	But in the second, it acquires penetration through the extraction of thick blood.
E si le sanc es mot feculent, lahoras sia fayta scarificacio la tersa veguada per que consiegua le derier.	And if the blood is very foul, then let the third cupping be done so that the residue is achieved.
E derierament, quan volem extrayre le sanc pauc a pauc o un petit, abasta a nos una scarificacio.	And finally, when we want to extract blood little by little or a little bit, it is enough for us with one scarification.
E si volem extraccio de mot sanc, scarificam am mota scarificacio; e si nos conoyssem que·l sanc es gros, lahoras cove que scarifiquem per scarificacio preonda.	And if we want to extract a lot of blood, we scarify with a deep scarification; and if we know that the blood is thick, then let us scarify with a gentle scarification.
E le terme de scarificacio en la qual es la profunditat de la codena tant solament.	And the term of scarification in which the depth of the skin is only as much.
E si aquel del qual la codena es grossa, dura, fusca, e les sieus pors so streytz, cove que les locs de las ventosas sian untatz lenitius, apertius resolutius; si es en temps d’estiu, ayssi cum es oli de aloen o oli de violat, o oli de amellas dossas, o oli de cemensa de coja; e si es en temps ivern, lahoras oli narci, o oli de liri, o oli de camamilla, o de sanc, e ad aquels semblantz.	And if the person whose skin is thick, tough, dark, and whose pores are tight, then let the sites of the cups be anointed gently, widely, and resolutely; in summer time, likewise with oil of aloe or oil of violet, or oil of almond shells, or oil of cedar wood; and in winter time, then with oil of nut, or oil of larch, or oil of camomile, or blood, and to those like them.
E si la superfluitat es grossa, freja, lahoras le oli sia amaranti, o oli de balsamita, o oli de aloen, o oli aneti, e a lor semblantz.	And if the superfluity is thick, tough, then let the oil be of myrrh, or oil of balsamita, or oil of aloe, or oil of anise, and to those like them.
Mays si le ventozador es de amples pors de tendra carn, lahoras cove que sia prohibit de oli, e cove que ad aquest les locs de ventozas de lor aprop la ventozacio sian lavatz am ayguaros o am aygua freja de solatrum, o am aygua de coja, o am aygua de bordolaguas, e semblantz ad aquelas.	But if the cupper has ample pores of tender flesh, then let oil be prohibited from him, and let the sites of the cups be washed with vinegar or with hot water of solanum, or with water of cedar wood, or with water of borderwaters, and to those like them.
E aquel del qual le sanc es de mota humiditat, lava las suas ventozas am vi agre, o am aygua de mirt e sumac e semblant ad aquels.	And if the person whose blood is of great moisture, wash their cups with sour wine, or with water of myrtle and sumac, and similarly to those.
E de aquel del qual las superfluitatz son grossas, lava las suas ventozas am vi antic, o am aygua de sansuc, que es majorana, o de decoccio de anet, o de camamilla, e a lor semblantz.	And if the superfluities are thick, wash their cups with old wine, or with water of sanser, which is marjoram, or with decoction of anise, or of camomile, and to those like them.
E cove que la ventozacio sia guardada denant de banh; habantz cove que sia aministrada aprop issiment del banh per una hora o per doas, e cove que dorma aprop la ventozacio.	And let the cupping be kept away from bathing; while having it administered after bathing for one or two hours, and let him sleep after the cupping.
Quid est quo oportet ut regatur ventosandus aus phlebotomatus ante ventosationem.	What should one do who needs to be bled by cupping before venesection?
Cove que consideras al comensament: lahoras si le ventozador o aquel que·s deu fleubotomar es coleric e ventz sobre lu sanc agut e imflamacio, lahoras cove que prengua causas infrigidantz, ayssi cum milgranas acetosas, e endivia an vi agre e laytuguas, e secanabin, e julep, e a lor semblantz.	Let him consider first: if the cupper or he who is to be bled is choleric and has hot blood and inflammation over him, then let him take causes of frigidity, likewise with acetic milfoils, and endive in sour wine and leeks, and squill, and julep, and to those like them.
E pausa a lor viandas ayssi cum poletz, e carns de auzels serbiges, e viandas conditas am agras, e a lu semblantz.	And let him stop eating thus with pullets, and meats of fat fowls, and seasoned foods with vinegar, and to those like them.
E de aquel del qual la compleccio es freja, cove que prengua en beure eyssarop almiva, o eyssarop de alsecanabin de semensas, e sumac, e vi mot odorant migier entre viel et noel; e que a lu sia comendat que use de paucitat de beure e de mangar, e pausa las viandas de lu poletz e canabir e pissers e petitz auzels e colombat.	And if the person whose complexion is hot, let him take in drinking esserop of honey, or esserop of squill seeds, and sumac, and very fragrant wine between spring and summer; and let it be commanded to him that he use little of drinking and eating, and let his foods be pullets and canabis, and peas, and pigeons, and doves.
E cove que en lo dia de ventozacio e de fleubotomia le beure sia major que la vianda.	And let him drink more in the day of cupping and phlebotomy than he eats.
E cove que sia donat en beure en alcunas horas ad alcus homes tyriaca alpharac, o medicamentz de musc, so es muscada, o alcelita denant la ventozacio o denant fleubotomia o aprop, per so que·ls membres principals sian confortatz e que·l sanc sia subtiliat; e no cove que prenguan aquela scalfatz.	And let him be given in drinking at certain times to some men myrrh of alpha-arack, or medicines of musk, so that it is muscaded, or alcelita before cupping or phlebotomy or afterwards, so that the principal members are made comfortable and the blood be subtle; and let them not take those scaldings.
Mays las ventozas que so ses scarificacio sian ventozas que so pausadas sus le fetge, e sobre la melsa e podagra, e sobre le umbelic, en les locs dels jonolhs, e la pixida del ancha, quar aquestz membres no suffertan scarificacio sobre si.	But the cups that are after scarification be cups that are paused over the liver, and over the melsa and podagra, and over the umbilical, in the sites of the joints, and the pubis of the hip, because these members do not suffer scarification upon themselves.
E no es querit per aquelas sino atraccio de sanc de membre, ayssi cum pausam ventosa sobre mamilha en malautia de flux de sanc del sanc de las nars; e usam de aquela per que sia dissolvuda ventositat freja inviscade del membre, ayssi cum pausam sobre le ventre e l’umbelic; quar aquela rarifique le membre e scalfa lu e ramau la dolor quar resolveys ventositat.	And it is not wanted by those except for attraction of blood of member, likewise with pause the cup over the breast in malady of flow of blood of the blood of the nose; and use that so that subtle thick heat of the member is dissolved, likewise with pause over the belly and umbilical; because that rarefies the member and burns it and removes the pain that resolves the heat of the member.
E ja es pausada sobre les ronhos quan accideys en lor opilacio o poyra, quar per vertut de atraccio fort leu huobre opilacio e erradica le poyra de son loc.	And it is also paused over the testes when they become in their swelling or pain, because through virtue of strong attraction their swelling and pain is eradicated from its site.
E semblantment fa quan es pausada sobre le fetge e la melsa deves ventositat en aquels enclausa.	And similarly it does when it is paused over the liver and melsa, because of cupping in those in confinement.
E aquestas ventozas so administradas vuedas amb succio tant solament; e alcunas veguadas so administradas am foc.	And these cups are administered thus with suction only; and some are administered with fire.
E alcunas veguadas so administradas plenas de aygua tebeza en las malautias de la melsa.	And some are administered full of tepid water in the maladies of the liver.
E aquo es per que la ventoza sia umplida e sia pus gran, so es aygua cauda sola o aygua en la qual sian cuytas herbas ad aquo convenientz.	And for that the cup is filled and pus comes out great, it is water with which are cuited herbs according to what is convenient.
Forma de ventoza aministrada am foc: sia la amplitud del orrifici de dos ditz, segon que nos la havem formada; e la quantitat del preon sia la maytat de un palm; e sia en lo latz de lu, en le loc que es en le circuit, la maytat de lu, le trauc sia petit segon la quantitat que intre en lu una agulha.	Form of cup administered with fire: let the aperture of the orifice be two digits, according to how we have formed it; and the quantity of the fire be the measure of a palm; and let its length in the site where it is in the circuit, the measure of it be the measure of itself, the pierce be small according to the quantity that enters into it an awl.
Sia fayta de eram rog o citri, de grosses marges, leon, enguals e terses per so que no leda le membre deves la sua posicio sobre lu.	Let it be made of wood of wild rose or citron tree, of thick margins, lion, inwal nut and horse-chestnut so that it does not lead the member according to its position upon it.
E sia al mieg de lu vergua transversa de eram o de ferr, on es pausada candela am lo foc.	And let it be over the middle of it a transverse band of wood or iron, where is paused candle with the fire.
E ja sia aquesta ventoza gran major de aquela la qual havem recomtat; e la pauca mendre de aquela segon las malautias e la etat de aquel que usa de aquela.	And it is also this cup great much more than that which we have described; and the little less of that according to the maladies and the state of him who uses that.
E las ventosas dels efantz e extenuatz so autres que las ventozas dels joves e de grosses corssas.	And the cups of children and exhausted ones are smaller than those of young people and large bodies.
E la qualitat de pausar aquesta ventoza am foc sobre le membre es que extenda la meca am foc de lenha decentment denant una pauca candela de cera, e pausa aquela sobre le mieg de la vergua transversa en le mieg loc de la ventoza, per que le foc sia accendut enviro la partida dejos per que no sia comburit le cors del malaute.	And the quality of pausing this cup with fire upon the member is that it extends the mace with decent fire before a little candle of wax, and pause that over the middle of the transverse band in the middle site of the cup, so that the fire be lit around the lower part so that the body of the sick person is not burned.
E aprop sia pausada sobre le membre del malaute, e le dit sia sobre le trauc que havem dit, entro que quan tenem las ventozas e non indigem que osten le dit e que yesca la vapor sobre aquel trauc, lahoras la ventoza sira tantost dissolvuda.	And then it is paused over the member of the sick person, and the finger is over the pierce that we have said, while we hold the cups and do not move the finger and let the steam go over that pierce, the cup is so dissolved immediately.
E prop igneys la meca segon la sua manieyra, e itera aquela si indigeyssas de aquela.	And then light the candle according to its use, and relight it if it goes out.
Mays en ventosa que es aministrada en la malautia de plauressi, am aygua, en la qual no ha vergua transversa ni trauc, e no es aministrada sino que sia umplida de aygua, e es pausada sobre le membre tant solament.	But the cupping glass that is administered for pleurisy, with water in which there is neither a transverse membrane nor a hole, and it is not administered unless it has been filled with water, and is placed over the affected part alone.
E aquesta es la forma de lu: E aquesta ventoza quant plus es gran, tant es milhor, per que puya recebre gran quantitat de aygua.	And this is its shape: And this cupping glass when it is largest, that is the best, so that it can receive a large quantity of water.
Capitol .xcvii.	Chapter 97.
Sanguissuguas no so administradas en motz membres sino en les membres en les quals non es possible posicio de ventosas, per la parvitat de aquels, ayssi cum le pot e gingiva e semblantz a lor; o en membre denudat de carn, ayssi cum le dit e·l nas e lors semblantz.	Leeches are not applied to small parts of the body unless it is impossible to apply cupping glasses there because of their small size, as with the eye and gum and similar parts, or to exposed flesh, as with the finger and nose and similar parts.
E la qualitat de usar de aquelas que si has trobadas sanguisugas que so en las ayguas dossas de poyredura mundas.	And the quality of using leeches that you have found in the double-wallered, clean, blood-red waters.
E aprop sian layssadas le dia e la nueyt en aygua dossa entro que sian famolentas, e que no romangua alcuna causa en le ventre de aquelas; e aprop sia evacuat le cors en le comensament am fleubotomia e am ventozas; e aprop fregua le membre del malaute entro que s’enrojezesca; e aprop sian pausadas sobre lu.	And let them be left in the water for a day and night until they become hungry, and let no cause remain in their bellies; and let the body be evacuated at the beginning by phlebotomy and by cupping glasses; and let the affected parts of the patient be rubbed until they turn red; and let them be placed on him.
E cum son umplidas e caso.	And when they are full, then...
E si es possible succio del loc am ventoza, es mays derier en juvament.	And if it is possible to draw out the poison from that spot by cupping glasses, it is better done by suction.
E sino, lahoras lava le loc am vi agre e aprop am mota aygua; e sia freguat e expremut.	And if not, then wash the affected spot with mild wine and then with tepid water; and let it be rubbed and squeezed out.
E si es prolonguat le cors del sanc aprop le cazement de las sanguissuguas, e es aquo resudan, lahoras tu enfon un drap de li en aygua freja, e pausa aquel de sobre entro que sia abdida la resudacio.	And if the flow of blood is prolonged due to the application of leeches and it oozes out, then you should soak a cloth in cold water and place it over the affected area so that the oozing stops.
E si le sanc es multiplicat, lahoras polveriza sobre lu vitriol trissat, o guallas e semblantz a lor de las causas stipticas, entro que·l sanc sia abscidit; o sian pausadas sobre le loc las maytatz de favas excocicadas, e sian layssadas entro que las favas aderescan al loc, e es le sanc abscidit.	And if the blood is profuse, then powder vitriol, or gall nuts and similar astringent substances of the causes, should be sprinkled over the affected area until the bleeding stops; or cooked split peas should be placed on it and left until the peas adhere to the spot, and the blood stops.
E cove, si es necessaria, iteracio de sanguissuguas, quan es possible mudar aquelas.	And if necessary, the leeches can be reapplied when they have been changed.
E si las sanguissuguas son prohibidas de suspenssio, lahoras sia freguat le loc am sanc recent o fique una agulha en les locs entro que yesca sanc; e aprop sian pausadas, quar aquelas quan sento alcun sanc tantost adarysso.	And if the leeches are prohibited from being suspended, then the affected area should be rubbed with fresh blood or an needle should be pricked into the spots so that blood comes out; and let them be placed there, for when they sense some blood it will come out right away.
E quan voles que cajan, polveriza sobre aquelas un pauc de aloen trissat, o sal, o cendre, e cazo tantost.	And when you want them to stop, sprinkle a little crushed aloe, or salt, or ash over them, and right away they will.
Ayssi comensa lo prolec de la tersa partida: de restauracio.	Thus begins the discussion of the third part: of restoration.
Aquest capitol es motas veguadas necessari en la art de medicina; e es restauracio de fractura e de dislocacio accident en les osses.	This chapter is many times necessary in the art of medicine; and it is a restoration from fracture and from accidental dislocation in the bones.
O, filh, sapiatz que jactan se de aquest capitol les fols metges e les vulguars e aquels que degun temps no reguardero les libres dels Antics ni legiro de aquels una letra.	Oh son, wise one, know that the foolish doctors and the common people and those who have never read the books of the Ancients nor understood a letter from them speak foolishly about this chapter.
E per aquesta causa es fayt que aquesta manieyra dels scients in terra nostra es privat; e yeu no ho e obliat en aquo degun temps be de tot; e no he adhibit aquo que apres, sino per longitut de lectio dels libres dels Antics e studi sobre le entendement de aquels, entro que extrayssi la sciencia de aquels.	And for this reason, this way of the wise in our land is prohibited; and I have not committed it at any time; and I have not practiced that which teaches, unless through length of reading the books of the Ancients and studying on the understanding of those, so that I extracted the science from them.
E aprop adirigui a experiment e studi en la longitut de la mieua vida.	And I also added experience and study throughout the length of my life.
E yeu ja he de aquo descrit en aquest capitol tot aquo que conte la mieua sciencia e sobre le qual es passat lo mieu experiment; pus que agui abreujat aquo a vos autres e deliuregui aquo de occupacio de elonguacio; e abreujegui aquo en la fi de abreujacio; et e monstrat aquo en la fi de declaracio; e formegui en aquo motas formas dels sturmentz que so administratz en aquel, cum es fayt per addicio de declaracio, ayssi cum he fayt en dos capitols precedentz.	And I have already described in this chapter everything that my science and experience teach me about this subject; for I have abbreviated it for you and delivered it from the occupation of lengthening; and I have shortened it at the end of the declaration, and illustrated it with many forms of the instruments which are administered in it, as has been done by addition of declaration, as I have done in two preceding chapters.
Capitol primier.	First chapter.
Summae et collectiones ex esse fracturae ossium, ex eis quarum praemissio necessaria est, antequam incipiamus rememorationem membrorum fraftorum et diversorum si uniuscuiusque.	Summary and collections from being fractured bones, from which their premise is necessary before we begin the remembrance of the members of fractures and of various ones if one by one.
Cove donc que diguam en le prohemi de aquest capitol las summas del sermo; e les capitols al entendament dels quals en le comensament es forsat le artifexs e a stacio sobre la veritat de aquels; so es vos e aquels que so promptz que sapian o aprenguan aquesta art nobla autres de vos.	Therefore let us begin the summary of this chapter, and the chapters to the understanding of which at the beginning the artisans are forced, and to the truth of those: it is you and those who are adept in this noble art that you learn from others.
E donc dic que quan accideys a alcu fractura o dislocacio o torcio o cazement, lahoras cove que tu te coytes al comensament am fleubotomia o aleyar aquel, o quascu ensemps, si no prohibeys alcuna causa, ayssi cum debelitat de vertut, o es aquel al qual accideys effant, o viel en decrepitat, o es temps de vehement calor, o de vehement freg.	And therefore I say that when accidents happen to any fracture or dislocation or twisting or herniation, then let you be concerned at the beginning with phlebotomy or bleeding him, or with some poultice, if no contrary cause prohibits it, as for weakness of strength, or he is an infant, or old in decrepitude, or there is violent heat, or violent rubbing.
E aprop sia content en vianda sieua de erbas frejas e de carns de auzels e de crabotz; e prohibem carns grossas e umplir si de viandas e de tota vianda que umple las venas de sanc, entro que siras segurat de apostema caut, e si no temes efusio de materia al membre.	And let him be fed on a diet of green vegetables and meat of birds and crabs; and let him abstain from fatty meats and from filling foods that fill the veins with blood, so that you guard against pus in the affected member, and if you do not fear an effusion of matter.
E lahoras retorne le malaute al sieu regiment primier am le qual corr costuma de lu.	And let him then return to his first regimen with which he was accustomed.
E donc cum le os trencat comensa esser restaurat, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia pascut de viandas nutritivas de nutriment mot e gros e greu en les quals sia viscositat, ayssi cum so viandas faytas de froment cueyt am aygua, e ris, e caps, e pes, e ventres de vacas, e huous, e peys fresc, e vi gros e semblants ad aquels, e am aquest regiment es fayta coagulacio de fractura pus leugierament e miels.	And therefore when the broken bone begins to be restored, then let the patient be fed on nutritive foods of light and coarse and heavy foods in which there is viscosity, as well as on cooked foods made from wheat with water, rice, and peas, and fish, and fresh meat, and groats, and similar to these, and with this regimen coagulation of the fracture is made more slowly and better.
E sapias que les osses trinquatz quan so en les homes que so en la primiera vilura e en los decrepitz, no es possible que sian continuatz e sian consolidatz segon lur natura per la exsiccacio dels membres de lor.	And know that the fractured bones when they are in old people and in the elderly, it is not possible for them to be continued and consolidated according to their nature because of the drying up of the members of them.
E son consolidatz e continuatz segon lor natura tot temps per la exsiccacio de aquels membres, e so continuatz e consolidatz aquels que so de lor en la fi de la lenitat, ayssi cum les osses dels petitz effantz.	And they are consolidated and continued according to their nature at all times by the drying up of those members, and they are continued and consolidated by the old ones when they are in the end of softness, as well as the bones of small children.
Mays empero natura ajusta e amnecteys sobre le os trencat de tota partida alcuna causa semblant a glut en le qual es grossitut que adhereys e strenh aquel entro que so ensemps conglutinatz e liatz ensemps, entro que venen la fi de fortitut e de fermesa, ayssi cum foc al comensament, entro que denguna causa no prohibeys aquel de las suas obres.	Nature however adjusts and connects the broken bone of every part any cause similar to a clot in which there is thickness that adheres and strengthens it together so that it comes to its end of strength and firmness, as well as fire at the beginning, so that no cause prohibits that from its works.
E per aquesta causa es necessari que pauses las viandas del malaute, viandas en las quals so gravitat e viscozitat e grosseza, ayssi cum havem dit.	And for this reason it is necessary that you stop the patient's diet, a diet in which there is heaviness and viscosity and coarseness, as we have said.
Mota diversitat de fractura segon diversitat del membre.	The diversity of fracture according to the diversity of the member.
E sapias que las specias de fractura son diversas segon la diversitat dels membres, quar fractura del os de la camba es diversa de la fractura del os del cap; e la fractura del os del pietz es divers de la fractura del os del dos; e semblantment totz les autres membres son diverses entre lor.	And know that the species of fractures are diverse according to the diversity of the members, for the fracture of the bone of the leg is diverse from the fracture of the bone of the head; and the fracture of the bone of the foot is diverse from the fracture of the bone of the arm; and similarly all other members are diverse among themselves.
E yeu venc am rememoracio de tota specia de fractura, expausada en le sieu capitol distincta del autre.	And I win by remembrance of every species of fracture, explained in my distinct chapter from another.
Mota diversitat de fractura en si meteyssa.	The diversity of fracture within itself.
E son diversificadas las specias de fractura del os en lor meteyssas; quar es fayta fractura arcuada otra aquo que accidan en lu stellas; e alcunas veguadas es fayta fractura segon la longitut del os: e so las fracturas de lu satagia e astelhas e addicios procedentz e no-procedentz, ayssi cum es fayt en la pena quan es preparada a escriure, e es fractura am plagua e disrupcio en le cap, e es fractura fissura petita.	And the species of fractures of the bone are diverse within themselves; for there is made an arcuate fracture another that occurs in them in stars; and some times the fracture is according to the length of the bone: and they are fractures of the satagia and angles and additional ones, as well as when it is prepared for writing, and a fracture is a fissure in the head, and a fracture is a little crack.
E a tota specia es engen o turment propri en restauracio de lu segon que vindra rememoracio de lu distincta en les sieus locs.	And there is a specific pain or torture unique to the restoration of him according to what will come to his memory distinctly in his places.
Mota senhal de fractura del os.	Here is another sentence:
E per aquo es conoguda fractura del os: es tortuositat de lu, e de aquel eminencia e appericio de lu al sentiment, e so de lu quan compremes aquel am la tua ma.	And because of this, a fracture of the bone is known: it is its tortuousness and that eminence and its appearance to the senses, and from it when you compress it with your hand.
