E donc quan no es en le loc tortuositat apparent ni so no es feyt deves le tieu tocament quan toques le os am agitacio e le malaute no atroba gran dolor, lahoras no es aqui fractura.	And therefore when there is not in the place a tortuousness apparent or from it not made because of your touching when you touch the bone with motion and the patient finds no great pain, then there is no fracture here.
Habantz es possible que sia tortuositat o petita fissura, adon no cove que tu mauguas aquel am la tua ma e am compressio de tot; habantz pausa sobre lu de las medicinas de las quals ve rememoracio aprop aquel moment le qual conveneys al loc; e aprop sia streyt per strictura subtil.	It is possible that there is tortuosity or a small crack, then it does not behoove you to wince when you touch it with your hand and with compression of all; rather pause over it medicines of which come memory fittingly to the place; and then be tight by subtle constriction.
E sapias que·l loc quan es arcuat e no es scindit en dos o otra aquo que no accidan en lu satagie, cum es remauguda tota partida de la sua compar, lahoras cove que comenses de la tua hora a rectificacio de lu habantz que a lu accida apostema caut.	And know that the place when it is arched and not split into two or anything else that does not happen in it satagie, as all is completely split from its comparison, then behoove you to commence from your hour to rectification of it before what happens in it apostema cautery.
E si a lu accida apostema caut, lahoras layssa aquel per alcus dias entro que cesse le apostema; e aprop engualha aquel segon quascuna manieyra que podes de levitat e de engen.	And if in it happens apostema cautery, then let it be for several days until the apostema ceases; and then heal that according to any manner that you can of elevation and of healing.
E sapias que restauracio de lu e agulacio de lu es pus leugiera que del os en le qual accideysso sathagie.	And know that restoration of it and piercing of it is more difficult than of the bone in which happens satagie.
E aprop strenh aquel segon que vindra la rememoracio de lu.	And then strengthen it according to what will come the memory of it.
Mays si en le os so satagias, lahoras es necessaria extencio de aquest membre trencat de doas partz, si es la ma o le pe; o am la tua ma si le membre es petit; o am doas cordas o am una corda e la ma.	But if in the bone so satagies, then is necessary extension of that broken member from two parts, if it is the hand or the foot; or with your hand if the member is small; or with two cords or with one cord and the hand.
E sia la tua posicio am la qual pauses le membre loc engual segon la sua figura natural, mentre que las partidas so extandudas del membre trenquat, lahoras te perforsa que fassas retornar aquelas addicios am engen e segon quascuna manieyra que poyras en lor locs.	And be your position with which you pause the member place healing according to its natural figure, while the parts so extend from the broken member, then you perforate that returning those adductions with healing and according to any manner that you can in their places.
E guarda te segon la tua forssa que no accida sobre le malaute per la tua operacio delor ni lesio; e perforsa te segon le tieu poder que tu appliques la un os am l’autre son companho segon lors milhors formas.	And guard yourself according to your strength that does not happen over the patient through your operation of pain or harm; and perforate you according to your power that you apply one bone to another companion according to their best forms.
E cove que en aquela hora aprofitablament tu toques am la tua ma aquel, e si vezes aqui alcuna causa diversa, rectifiqua aquel e enguala aquel per la quantitat de la tua vertut.	And behoove you in that hour advantageously you touch with your hand that, and if you see here any diverse cause, rectify that and heal that through the quantity of your virtue.
E exquiva vehement extenssio e compressio, ayssi cum fan mots fols metges que motas veguadas fan accidir apostema caut per la sua operacio, o fan accidir contraccio en le membre ayssi cum havem vist aquo per la operacio de lor motas veguadas.	And avoid violent extension and compression, likewise as many foolish doctors who many times cause apostema cautery through their operation, or cause contraction in the member likewise as we have seen that through the operation of them many times.
E aprop annecteys, aprop equacio e decent operacio e strictura de aquel membre, e repaus e tranquilitat; amoneste le malaute sobre aquo e fay le squivar que no maugua aquel en la hora de las suas vigilias e del sieu dormir, e ves la sua revolucio e agitacio, e deves la sua egestio, e deves totz les sieus movementz am tota la sua vertut; e aguarda se que la posicio del membre sia posicio am la qual sia asegurada la dolor, la qual causa es quar quan sent en la disposicio de la posicio del membre delor o lesio; lahoras cove que permutes aquel ad autra disposicio de aquela am la qual non senta dolor; e guarda am aquo que la posicio de lu aquela sia dreyta e engual, per so que al membre non accida tortuositat quan es restaurat.	And then attach, then equilibrium and decent operation and constriction of that member, and rest and tranquillity; warn the patient about that and do him to avoid wincing in the hour of his vigils and sleeping, and see his revolution and motion, and attend to his excretion, and attend to all his movements with all your virtue; and guard if the position of the member is position with which he is secured from pain or harm; then change that to another position with which he does not feel pain; and guard with that that the position of it be straight and healed, so that no tortuosity happens to the member when it is restored.
E la qualitat de la strictura del membre tranquat es aquela que yeu recomti; per que sapias que·ls membres trencatz so diversificatz en lor parvitat e en lor grandeza e en la forma de aquels.	And the quality of the constriction of the broken member is that which you consider; for you know that the broken members are diversified in their smallness and in their greatness and in the form of them.
E de aquels que son petits ayssi cum le bras e·l dit e·l focil e semblantz ad aquels, lahoras cove que la envolucio sia de drap mol subtil.	And of those which are small likewise as the arm and the finger and the wrist and similar to them, then let the wrapper be of very fine cloth.
Mays aquels que so grosses ayssi cum la cuoyssa o la camba, cove que en aquels sia envolucio lada e dura, quar la liadura lada connecteys le membre gran e strenh aquel de tota part am strictura engual, enayssi que en lu no intre macula.	But those which are large likewise as the thigh or the leg, then let the wrapping be firm and hard, for the firm binding connects the large member and strengthens it from all parts with equal constriction, so that in it does not enter a crack.
E aprop comensa, aprop la tua evacuacio de equacio, pausar liament convenient ad aquo, sobre le loc de aquela fractura am tres envolucios o quatre segon que·l membre mereys; e strenh la tua ma un petit am le liament.	And then commence, then your evacuation of equilibrium, pause convenient ligament to that, over the place of that fracture with three or four wrappings according to how the member merits; and strengthen your hand a little with the ligament.
E aprop ve am aquel a la partida pus sobirana del loc de la fractura, e strenh mens que no foc la tua strictura am la qual has strengut le loc de la fractura.	And then go to that to the most superior part of the place of the fracture, and strengthen mind so that you do not focus your constriction with which you have strengthened the place of the fracture.
E aprop elongua te am envolucio del loc de la fractura un pauc, e mollifiqua la strictura petit a petit, entro que prenguas del loc sa una gran partida.	And then elongate yourself with wrapper of the place of the fracture a little, and soften the constriction little by little, while you take from it a great part.
E aprop pren una autra benda e envolveys aquela autra veguada sobre le loc trenquat am envolucio, e aprop ve am las envolucios a la partida pus dejos de la fractura; e sia la tua operacio en la strictura de la envolucio e en mollificacio de aquela segon que havem dit en la envolucio primieyra desus.	And then take another bandage and wrap that other part over the broken place with wrapper, and then go to the wrappings at the most inferior part of the fracture; and be your operation in the constriction of the wrapper and in softening of that likewise as we have said in the primary wrapper above.
E aprop pausa entre las volucios de stopa leon o drap am le qual sia engualada la tortuositat de la fractura, si en lu es tortuositat; e sino, no pauses en lu alcuna causa.	And then pause between the wrappings of wool or cloth with which is healed the tortuosity of the fracture, if in it is tortuosity; and if not, do not pause in it any cause.
E aprop pausa sobre lu autra benda, e aprop enguala sobre aquestas envolucios stelhas decentment faytas tantost, si en le loc no es imflacio o apostema caut, e lahoras pausa sobre lu aquo que sede le apostema aquel e que oste la imflacio; e layssa aquela per alcus jorns; e lahoras tu strenh sobre lu las stelhas.	And then pause over it another bandage, and then heal over these wrappings decently made liniments at once, if in the place is not inflammation or apostema cautery, and then pause over it that which seats the apostema cautery and which heals the inflammation; and let that be for several days; and then strengthen over it the bandages.
E sian las stelhas de la maytat de canna lada raza, e be formada saviament; o sian de fust de pi; o de ramps de palma ; e sia le ample de quascuna stelha segon aquesta forma e aquesta figura:	And the liniments be of the thickness of a cane shaft, and be formed wisely; or be of wood of pine; or of reeds of palm; and be the width of each bandage according to this form and this figure:
Empero cove que la astelha que es pausada sobre aquela fractura sia pus grossa e pus lada un petit que las autras astelhas, e la longitut de la stela segon qu’es legut al membre en magnitut e parvitat; e aprop strenh sobre las astelhas am autra benda segon la tua primieyra strictura; e aprop lia desus am fiel decentment segon que havem dit de strictura, e es que sia la tua strictura segon le loc de la fractura mes, e quant mes es alonguat de la fractura, es mendre la strictura.	However, let the bandage that is paused over that fracture be thicker and harder a little than the other bandages, and the length of the bandage according to how it is measured to the member in greatness and smallness; and then strengthen over the bandages with another bandage according to your primary constriction; and then bind over it with faithful wire decently according to what we have said of constriction, and be your constriction according to the place of the fracture less, and how less is elongated from the fracture.
E cove que les fils sian migiers en grossesa e subtilitat, e sian de li mol; e si les fils so grosses, ayssi cum yeu he vist per la operacio de alcus fols pausantz les lors fils de cordas de li tort, e es error gran, quan catz la strictura fora equalitat.	And let the threads be medium in thickness and fineness, and be of wire; and if the threads are thick, likewise as we have seen through the operation of some foolish pausing their threads of cords of wire, and it is great error when constricts the equality away.
E eyssament fils subtils no so convenientz, quar tu no consaguiras per strictura am aquels aquo que voles, e no cove que entre astela e astela haja mens de un dit.	And equally thick threads are not convenient, for you will not achieve through constriction with them what you want, and let there be space between bandage and bandage of one finger.
E si le malaute es ledit per las extremitatz de las stelas aprop la strictura en les locs sas, lahoras pausa dejos aquelas de stopa leon o lana carmenada entro que aquo no li fassa lesio.	And if the patient is hurt by the ends of the bandages then strengthen in the places his wool or cotton between that does not harm him.
Alcunas veguadas fractura es am plagua, e accideys disrupcio en la codena, e yeu vindre am rememoracio en aquela en le capitol segon singularitat.	Sometimes fracture is with swelling, and happens disruption in the tendon, and I come to memory in that in the head according to particularity.
E sapias que ges tot membre trencat no es streyt am stelhas al primier dia; la qual causa es quar le membre, quan es gran, no cove que pauses sobre lu stelhas sino aprop v dias o vii o mays, segon la tua seguratat de adveniment de apostema caut.	And know that not all broken member is tightened with bandages on the first day; the cause of which is that the member, when it is great, let you pause over it bandages but after several days or a week or more, according to your security of occurrence of apostema cautery.
E aquesta es la manieyra dels emplaustres am les quals les Antics restauravan, les quals so pausatz sobre fractura e dislocacio e torcio.	And this is the manner of the bandages with which the Ancients restored, which were paused over fracture and dislocation and wrenching.
Manieyra de emplaustra comu abruejat de restaurament de fractura, convenient a motas compleccios e majorment a las femnas e als efantz, quar es de aquo sobre le qual no ventz calor ni freg: e es que prenguas de polvera de moli, e es la medula de la farina que pen deves le movement de la mola en las paretz del moli.	Manner of bandage as well wetted with restoration of fracture, convenient to many complexities and mostly to women and children, for it is that which takes from powder of ground, and is the core of the flour that comes from motion of the mill in the walls of the mill.
E comfeys aquel ayssi cum es, sino que cribelles aquel am album de huou, e pausa la comfeccio de lu no-spessa ni subtil; e aprop usa de aquela.	And season it thus, but add a little white pepper to the broth and use this not thick nor thin; and then use it.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre restaurant fractura e dislocacio e torcio: recipe de assafetida, de lapdanum, de acacia, de enula, e migrach, que es razit de milgraner salvage, de totz ana drac. x; de mirra e aloen ana drac. v; alochil ana drac. xx; totz sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian mesclatz am aygua alichil o am album de huou si la compleccio del malaute es scalfada; e aprop usa de aquest emplaustre, quar es de bona composicio e restaura les osses trencatz leugierament, e confereys a motz homes.	Another way of making a plaster that heals fractures and dislocations and twists: Take assafetida, myrrh, acacia, enula camphor, and mace, which is ground from wild peppercorns, all in equal drachms; myrrh and aloe each in five drachms; aloes in twenty drachms; let them all be ground and sieved and mixed with honey water or with white egg yolk if the patient' skin is injured; then use this plaster which has a good composition and quickly restores broken bones, and confers to many people.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre le qual comfereys a fractura e torcio: recipe migrach e met de altea blanca ana drac. x; de mirra e de aloen ana drac v; de acacia drac. vi; de bol armenic drac. .xx.	Another way of making a plaster that heals fractures and twists: Take mace and ground white alder in ten drachms each; myrrh and aloe in five drachms each; acacia in six drachms, and Armenian bole in twenty.
Totz sian trissatz en mortier am mota contricio, e sian cribellatz, e sian comfitz am aygua o am album de huou e sia administrat.	All are ground in a mortar with rose water, and sifted, and made into a paste with vinegar or white wine and then applied.
Manieyra de emplaustre a juncturas e osses separatz de lors locs, e seda dolor accident en aquels e a fissuras e fractaduras: sia presa lana sutza e sia submersa en vi agre e oli cuyt e sia pausat sobre le loc.	Method of plaster for joints and bones separated from their sockets, and pain occurs in them, and to fissures and fractures: take some clean wool and soak it in sweet wine and oil and place it on the affected area.
Mays en aquest emplastre no es vertut de restauracio, de apostema caut e expelleys dolors propriament.	Perhaps this plaster does not have the virtue of restoration, but it will soothe and draw out pains quite well.
Autra manieyra de emplastre que restaura os trancat: pren fuelas de figuier sort e fuelas de papaver salvatge; contereys tot e fay emplastre de lor.	Another method of a plaster that restores broken bones: take the bark of wild fig and the bark of wild poppies; grind both into a powder and make them into a plaster.
Manieyra de emplastre abreujat aministrat deves la restauracio de fractura de os e quan tu voles resolucio del romanent de apostema: recipe razitz de altea, de camamilla e flors de violes, de farina de ers, de totz ana partida .i.; sian totz trissatz e sian cofitz am vi, si·l membre no es scalfat.	Method of a plaster that promotes the healing of broken bones and when you want resolution of the residue of an abscess: take powdered white poplar bark, camomile flowers, violet flowers, and bran, of all these in equal parts .i.; all are ground and made into a paste with wine if the wound is not raw.
Mays si es scalfat, lahoras comfeys aquel am aygua de coliandre humit o am aygua e usa de lu.	But if it is raw, then season that with warm water of celery or vinegar and use it.
Autra manieyra de emplastra pus fort en resolucio que aquest primier, quan accideys apostema dur deves la restauracio del membre: recipe de razitz de altea e de semensa de li, e de balaustia, e mellilot, majorana, flors de viol, de camamilla, de totz ana partida i engual; totz sian trissatz e sian cofitz am aygua de sauze o am aygua dousa o am vi, tot aquo segon la qualitat del membre e le repaus de la color de lu.	Another method of a very strong plaster for resolution that this first one, when pustules appear on the healing of the member: take powdered white poplar bark and linseed, and black thistle, marjoram, violet flowers, camomile, of all these in equal parts i and grind them, then make into a paste with vinegar or warm water or wine, according to the quality of the wound and the color of it.
Mays Ypocras no diyssec en le sieu libre que sia pausat sobre le membre trenquat deves la restauracio de lu sino cerot fayt de cera e de oli e no autre causa; e recomtec que sia migier entre grossitut e subtilitat.	But ipocras does not dry in the open air, so it should be placed over the broken bone to promote healing of it unless a poultice is made of wax and oil and nothing else, and wrapped so that it lies between thickness and thinness.
Mays a Gualia es vist que sian pausatz sobre le membre trencat deves la restauracio de lu e las causas en las quals es exsiccacio am petit de caliditat so ayssi cum mirra, enses e semblantz a lor de aquelas causas que havem recomtadas.	But Gualia is seen to be placed over the broken bone for its healing and the causes in which there is dryness with little heat are also like those of the causes we have recounted.
Manieyra de emplastre que comfereys a lesio e dolor: recipe migat, de cezes, de pels de home inscizes o pena de auzel, e de altea, e sal, partidas enguals; sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian cofitz, e sia fayt emplastre.	Method of a plaster that provides relief to injuries and pain: take myrrh, cedar wood, human hair or horse tail, and white poplar bark, and salt, all in equal parts; grind and sift them, then make into a paste and make the plaster.
Mays la quantitat segon la qual cove que romangua la liadura e aprop sia disliada, es que consideres si no es accidit dolor ni pruziment ni le os es trencat no es maugut de son loc, lahoras tu no deslies de motz jorns.	But the quantity according to the wound that is bound up, and then loosen it, and consider if there is no pain nor swelling, nor is the bone broken and not displaced from its socket, then do not remove it for several days.
E si accideys al loc dolor vehement o prusiment o imflacio, lahoras tu te coyte o deslie aquel en la hora, e osta le emplastre de lu.	And if pain or swelling or inflammation occurs in the area, then cut or remove it in that moment and stop using the plaster.
E pren drap de li e spongia marina leon humida, e submergeys aquela en aygua tebeza, e am aquela lava le loc entro que cesse aquel pruziment e la dolor sia sedada; e aprop layssa repausar le membre per una hora; e aprop pausa sobre lu lana sutza submersa en vi agre e oli o oli rozat, e lia sobre lu per una nuoyt entro que sias segur de apostema caut, e que repause la imflacio del membre, e sia remauguda la dolor de lu.	And take a piece of linen and sponge the wound with warm water, and wash the area with mild vinegar until the swelling and pain are relieved; then let the member rest for an hour; and then place clean wool soaked in sweet wine and oil or rose-colored oil over it overnight to prevent an abscess from forming on the wound, and let the inflammation of the member be eased.
E aprop itera aquela strictura subtil e emplastre petit e no·l strenhas per la tua constriccio primieyra, e subtilia am aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then repeat this gentle compression and small plaster again and not tighten it with your first compression, and use that until the wound is healed.
E si vezes que le apostema e la rogor e la dolor e la imflacio e tots les accidentz ja so remaugutz de tot, e indigeysses de emplastre e de strictura, lahoras tu itera aquel ayssi cum has fayt al comensant engualment.	And if the abscess and heat and pain and inflammation and all accidents are now relieved, and you have stopped using the plaster and compression as you did at first equally, then repeat that in the same way as before.
E si no accideys al membre alcuna causa de aquelas que havem ditas, lahoras no deslies aquel sino aprop tres dias o quatre o v o .vii.; e alcunas veguadas tot aquo es layssat per xx dias segon que a tu appar per la desliadura del membre, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que la fractura adhereys, e se acosta a la coagulacio de la carn sobre aquel.	And if no accident occurs to the member of any of those that we have mentioned, then do not remove it but after three or four or five or seven days; and some times it is left for twenty days according to what appears through the loosening of the wound, as we have said, until the fracture has healed and the flesh draws close over it.
E lahoras ajusta en la strictura mays que en la tua strictura primieyra tota, e ayusta en la engrossacio de la vianda del malaute, segon que es precedida la rememoracio de lu.	And then tighten the compression little by little but not as much as your first compression, and adjust the thickness of the padding according to how the wound is preceded in its memory.
Mays si tu vezes le loc de la fractura ja desiccar e extenuar mays que no cove, lahoras sapias que·l nutriment es prohibit pervenir ad aquel; e donc embroca aquel am aygua tebeza deves tota veguada que delias aquel; e sia aquo en totz tres dias; e alleuja la strictura un petit, e per aquesta operacio corr al membre le nutriment, e es sanat leugierament.	But if you see the area of the fracture dried and weakened but not closed, then know that food is prohibited from coming to it; and therefore moisten that with warm water after total washing of the wound; and let it be for three days; and loosen the compression a little, and through this operation feed the member, and it will heal quickly.
Mays aquo que fan les fols restauradors de la fractura del membre autra veguada quan no es restaurat al comensament, segon que cove, e es restaurat segon tortuositat, es error segon la operacio de lor, e temor gran, e si fos dreyturier aquo agrandit les Antics en lors libres e agueran am aquo obrat.	But that which the unskilled restorers of the broken member do another washing when it is not healed at the beginning according to how it covers and is healed according to crookedness, is error according to their operation of them, and great fear, and if they would enlarge the ancient wounds in their sockets and were opened by them.
E yeu no he vist ad alcu de lor aquo far, per que es pus razonable que aquo no fassa.	And I have not seen any of them do this, because it is more reasonable that this should not be done.
Capitol segon: De fractura quan accideys en le cap.	Chapter two: Of fractures when they occur on the head.
Las specias de fracturas son motas, e las figuras de lor son diversas, e las causas son distinctas, quar de fracturas alcuna es fayta per percussio de spaza, e la percussio osta tot le os entro al ciphac, le qual es dejos le os, ayssi cum fay ayssa en le fust, e per aquo aquesta specia es nompnada ascial; o la spaza inscideys alcuna partida del os, e inscideys la carn de lu e no passa la inscizio entro al derier de lu; e aquesta specia de fractura es nompnada levatio absoluta.	The kinds of fractures are many, and their shapes are diverse, and the causes are distinct, for any fracture is not caused by the impact of a staff, and the impact pierces all the bone into the brain, which is below the skull, as it does in the trunk, and through that this kind of fracture is named ascia; or the staff pierces one part of the bone, and pierces the flesh around it, and the incision does not pass through the bottom of it; and this kind of fracture is named absolute elevation.
E la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca, e de fractura que es contricio o atricio; e causa de lu es percussio am poyra o cazement sobre peyra, e a lor semblantz.	And the crack of these two fractures is large or small, and of the fracture that is compression or traction; and the cause of it is impact with a club or stone on stone, and to them alike.
E aquesta fractura o es penetrant que ja apropinqua al pannicol le qual es dejos le os; o es en la facia del os, e la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca.	And this fracture is penetrating that it approaches the membrane that is below the bone; or it is in the membrane of the bone, and the crack of these two fractures is large or small.
E de fractura es que es ameguada en le os, en la subtilitat del cabel petita, e per aquo es nompnada aquesta specia fractura capillar.	And of fracture that is worn away in the bone, in the thinness of the hair, and through that it is named this species fracture capillary.
E es fractura que es fayta o per cazement o per percussio de peyra e a lu semblantz, que fa intrar alcuna lamina del os a las partidas dedintz, e es fayta en le loc concavitat ayssi cum accideys als payroles de eram quan accideys a lor percussio e es partida de lor intrada a las partidas dedintz.	And is fracture that is caused by stone or by impact of stone and to them alike, that makes any lamina of the bone enter into the fingernails, and it is made in the concave place thus as occurs on the fingers when impact and is broken from them.
E majorment es fayt aquo en les cors de osses humitz, ayssi cum so caps de efantz.	And this mostly happens in bodies of moist people, as well as children's heads.
E so a totas aquestas specias fracturas satagias, so son pessas ayssi cum stelhas separadas.	And all these kinds of fractures are set, like separated stars.
E yeu vindre am reremoracio de tot aquo en son loc.	And then you will have a memory of all this in your place.
E conoyssem totas aquestas specias de fractura per deteccio sobre aquelas e per inquisicio de lor am tentas e ostament de carn corrumpuda que es sobre lor.	And recognize all these kinds of fractures by examination and by inquiry to those who have them, and by the appearance of decayed flesh that lies upon them.
E specia capillar es conoguda per aysso que es descubert sobre le os, e es abstergit, e linit sobre lu am tentha, quar la fractura appar negra.	And hair is known because it is uncovered on the bone, and washed away, and when it is probed, the fracture appears black.
Mays en la curacio de fractura considera al comensament les accidentz del malaute, e lahoras si tu vezes per los accidentz que signifique per significacio manifesta sobre paor, ayssi cum es vomit de colera, e extencio, e perdement de entendament, e abscizio de votz, e sincopi, e febre acuta, e eyssiment dels huels e rogor de aquels, e semblantz a lor dels accidentz en las majors disposicios, ses dopte no es sanat.	But in the treatment of fractures consider at first the accidents of the patient, and then if you see by these accidents what is significant through manifest indication, such as vomiting of cholera, and extension, and loss of understanding, and absence of voice, and fainting, and acute fever, and discharge from orifices and redness in those, and likenesses to them in the greater dispositions, it is not healed.
E si vezes accidentz no-correntz tu speras salut, lahoras tu comensa la curacio de lu.	And if you see accidents that do not run their course, then you expect health, then you begin the treatment of him.
La qual causa es quar si es vengut a tu le plaguat en le comensament cum es plaguat e aquo es en les dias de ivern, lahoras cove que tu studias en le ostament del os denant le dia xiiii segon tota disposicio.	The reason for this is that if the afflicted has come to you in the beginning as he was afflicted and that is in the days of winter, then consider that you study in the appearance of the bone before the day fourteen according to all disposition.
E si es en les dias d’estiu, lahoras cove que te coytes ostar le os denant le vii dia, habantz que aquo que es dejos le os sia corromput del pannicol, e que accidescan les accidentz que havem recomtatz.	And if it is in the days of summer, then consider that you wait to splint the bone before the seventh day, having that which is beneath the bone be corrupted by the bandage, and that the accidents we have counted occur.
E si la fractura ja es pervenguda al pannicol cubrent le cervel, e es am partidas menudas e atricio, lahoras cove que inscidas la partida conminuta e atrita, segon que yeu recomtare a tu.	And if the fracture has already reached the brain membrane and is in minute pieces and shattered, then consider that you insert the minute piece and shattered according to what I have told you.
E es que tu razas le cap del malaute plaguat, e descuebres sobre le os segon costuma e manieyra a tu possible segon la figura de la plagua, e que sia leugier sobre le malaute.	And it is that you wash the head of the afflicted and uncover on the bone according to habit and manner to you possible according to the appearance of the plague, and that it be lighter upon the afflicted.
E si accideys a tu deves la deteccio del os, fluxs de sanc o apostema caut, lahora tu te oppausa a lu am aquo que cove, e es que huemplas le loc de draps infuzes en vi e oli rozat, e fassa repausar la plagua entro que sia sedat le apostema, e sies segur de fluxs del sanc; e aprop comensa en la circuicio del os e en la ablatio de lu.	And if it happens to you that you must make the detection of the bone, bleeding or pustule cautery, then you oppose to it with what is appropriate, and it is that you apply the place with clothes infused in wine and rose oil, and let the plague rest until the pustule is sedated, and you be secure from the flow of blood; and then begin at the circuit of the bone and in its ablation.
E aquo sia segon una de dos manieyras de operacio.	And that shall be according to one of two manners of operation.
E la una manieyra es que tu inscidas le os am inscisori de streyt tal, e aquesta es la forma de lu: E aprop administra un autre inscissori aquest, un pauc pus lat que aquel; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And the first manner is that you insert the bone with an incision of strict suchness, and this is its form: And then administer another incision-maker this, a little wider than that; and this is its form:
E aprop administra mays le inscissori pus lat que·l segon.	And then administer more the incision-maker wider than the second.
E cove que sia deves tu nombre de inscissoris diverses, dels quals alcus so pus latz que alcus autres; e alcus de lor so pus breus que·ls autres e sian en le derier de acuitat de las suas extremitatz, e sian de ferr indi o felod.	And consider that there ought to be due to you number of incision-makers diverse, of which some are wider than others; and some of them are shorter than the others and are in the thickness of their extremities, and are of iron or bronze.
E usa de lor am facilitat en percussio sobre le inscissori per so que no concutesca le cap e leda aquel.	And use them with facility in percussion upon the incision-maker so that it does not penetrate the head and lead to that.
E si le os es fort, dur, lahoras cove que perfores en le circuit de lu denant que tu administres los inscissoris am les taravels, les quals so nomnatz taravels no-profundantz.	And if the bone is strong and hard, then consider that you pierce in the circuit of it before you administer the incision-makers with awls, which are named non-deepening awls.
E no so nomnatz ayssi sino quar aquels no pausan le terme de l’os del test ad aquo que es aprop lu, per so quar al taravel es redonda extremitat o marge sobre aquel que es dejos le cap de lu agut semblant a marge o a cercle petit, le qual prohibeys esser submergit e passar la spissitut del os.	And they are not named thus but because those do not pause the end of the bone at what is proper to it, so that to the awl there is rounded extremity or margin on that which is beneath the head of it acute resembling margin or small circle, which prohibits being submerged and passing through the thickness of the bone.
E es convenient que tu prenguas de aquestz taravels gran nombre dels quals quascu convenesca a la spicitut de quascun os, entro que sia a tu present en tottz testz del cervel la extremitat del qual sia aguda, la quantitat en longitut e brevitat sia segon la quantitat de spicitut de aquest test.	And it is convenient that you take from these awls great number of which each convenes to the thickness of each bone, while being present in all tests of the brain whose extremity be acute, the quantity in length and brevity is according to the quantity of thickness of this test.
E aquesta es la forma de tres specias de teravels: La qualitat de perforar en le circuit del os trencat es que pauses le teravel sobre le os e revolvas aquel am les tieus ditz entro que sapias que l’os ja es penetrat; e aprop permuda le terevel ad autre loc, e pausa aquo que es entre tot trauc la quantitat de la grosseza del ray o enviro aquo.	And this is the form of three species of awls: The quality of drilling in the circuit of the broken bone is that you pause the awl over the bone and rotate it with your fingers while knowing that the bone is penetrated; and then change the awl to another place, and pause what is between all crack the quantity of the thickness of the thread or environment that.
E aprop inscideys am inscissoris aquo que es entre quascun trauc del os, e fay aquel pus subtil que podes sobre aquo en fi de levitat, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que erradiques le os, o am la tua ma, o am alcuna autra causa per alcus sturmentz les quals auras apparelhatz ad aquo, ayssi cum tanalhas e forceps subtils.	And then insert with incision-makers what is between each crack of the bone, and make that more subtle than you can over what in end of levity, as we have said, while erradicating the bone, or by your hand, or by any other cause by some tools which you will have prepared to that, as with tongs and forceps subtle.
E cove que tu guardes am tota cautela que l’inscissori no toque alcuna causa del ciphac.	And consider that you keep with total caution so that the incision-maker does not touch any cause of the brain.
E donc cum auras circuit le os perforan, e sira separat del ciphac si es continuat am lu, e auras aquel extrayt, cove que razas e enguales aquel en la asperitat de lu de aquo que es en le os am autra sturment semblant a inscissori, mays empero cove que sia pus teon e pus subtil que les autres inscissoris.	And then when you have pierced the bone and it is separated from the brain if it is continued with it, and you have that extracted, consider that you wash and gnaw it in its asperity of that which is in the bone with another tool resembling incision-maker, but indeed so that it be more thin and subtle than the other incision-makers.
E si roman alcuna partida dels osses petitz e satagias, lahoras pren aquela am facilitat am aquo que es deves tu dels sturmentz; e aprop aquo cura la plagua am lichinis e enguentz les quals havem ditz.	And if a part of the small bones and broken stars, then take that with facility with what is due to you of the tools; and then cure the plague with ointments and bandages which we have said.
E l’autra manieyra de operacio es leugiera, longinqua de paor, la qual diyssec Gualia e la lauzec per gran lausor; e aquest es le sermo de lu: necessari es a tu en le comensament que comenses descobrir la partida del os del loc en le qual es la fractura pus vehement e pus manifesta, entro que quan auras descubert aquela partida e auras pausat dejos lu la extremitat de aquest inscissori lent e alegre del qual aquesta es la forma:	And the other manner of operation is gentler, farther from fear, which Gualia and the lauzec praise for great gain; and this is its speech: it is necessary to you in the beginning that you begin to uncover the part of the bone of the place in which is the fracture most violent and most manifest, while when you have uncovered that part and have paused beneath it the extremity of this incision-maker slow and gentle of which this is the form:
E es que la partida lenticular es leon e no inscideys alcuna causa, e la partida aguda es de lu en dos latz avantz en longitut, ayssi cum vezes; que la partida lenticular sia ajustada al ciphac am la facia de lu inscident aguda en le os.	And the lenticular part is lion and does not insert any cause, and the acute part is of it in two sides forward in length, as you see; that the lenticular part be pressed to the brain with the membrane of it inserting acute into the bone.
E aprop percuteys sobre le inscissori de una partida am un petit malhet entro que inscidas tot le os am facilitat ayssi cum es revolvut, e tu sias segur del pannicol que no accida en lu accident que temas en denguna manieyra, e si le medicant14 era le pus fol de totz les homes e le mays ignorant de lor; certament, e si era dorment.	And then pierce upon the incision-maker of one part with a small hammer while you insert all the bone with facility as it is revolved, and you be secure of the bandage that no accident occur to it in any manner which you fear in any way, and if the patient was the most foolish of all men and the most ignorant of them; certainly, and if he was sleeping.
Lahoras si romania alcuna causa annexa al os del pannicol en alcus locs de os, inscidira aquel de lu am la extremitat del inscissori aquel lenticular, e deliuraria aquel de lu am facilitat, quar es deliurat de lu ses nocument e ses paor.	Then if there is some cause attached to the bone of the bandage in any place of bone, insert that with its extremity of the incision-maker lenticular, and deliver that from it with facility, for it is delivered from it harm and fear.
E si fractura del os no penetra entro al pannicol, e aquo que es abscidit o es ostat del os es la facia de lu, e roman en lu asperitat e satagias subtils, lahoras cove que razas aquela asperitat e erradiques aquelas satagias am razoris subtils per les quals tu has preparat le nombre, de diversas quantitatz per que sia a tu possible administrar de aquels en tot loc les pus convenientz de lor e le pus dreyt de aquels segon aquo en que te perduzeys la tua operacio aquel os trencat e la figura de lu.	And if the fracture of the bone does not penetrate within the bandage, and what is severed or is left of the bone is the membrane of it, and you have in it asperity and minute stars, then consider that you wash that asperity and erradicating those stars with subtle razors by which you have prepared the number, of diverse quantities so that there be to you possible to administer of them in all places most convenient for them and most right of them according to what in which you are lost your operation that broken bone and the form of it.
E cove que administres en la tua razio am la qual razes le os al comensament le pus lat de aquels razoris, e aprop usa aprop lu del pus subtil de lu, e no cesses far aquo segon continuitat entro que pervenguas ad aministrar le pus teon e·l pus subtil de totz aquels.	And consider that you administer in your reason with which you are cutting the bone at the beginning the most wide of those razors, and then use next to it of the most subtle of them, and do not cease doing that according to continuity while you come to administer the most thin and the most subtle of all those.
Mays en quascuna de las autras fracturas petitas capillars e fractura subtil, cove que administres cura segon aquo que perduseys ad rectificacio de lu.	But in any other small capillary fractures and subtle fractures, you must administer treatment according to what is lost to restore him.
E es causa que no es ameguada sobre totz les quals han studi en aquela art.	And it is caused by not being healed above all those who have studied that art.
E stec sobre aquo que nos scriut havem mostrat en grans fracturas.	And this is about what we wrote to show in great fractures.
E si le pannicol es retangut quan tu erradiques le os, lahoras cove que prenguas drap de li segon la quantitat de la plagua, e submergeys aquel en oli rozat, e pausa aquel sobre le orrifici de la plagua; e aprop pren autre drap doblat o triplicat e submergeys lu en vi e oli rozat e pausa aquel sobre drap prim e fay aquo al pus leugierament que podes sobre aquel, que no graves le ciphac; e aprop administra sobre aquel liament lat, e no strenhas aquel sino per quantitat que tengua la plagua tant solament.	And if the skin is stretched when you extract the bone, then take a cloth according to the amount of wound, and dip that in rose oil, and place it over the hole of the wound; and take another folded or doubled cloth, and dip it in wine and rose oil, and place it on top of the first cloth, and do this to the pus as gently as you can so that it does not hurt the head; and then apply lamb's wool over it, and do not tighten it except for the amount that the wound is.
E layssa aquel am aquesta cura per un dia o per dos entro que sias segur de apostema caut; e aprop deslia aquel e aprop aministra medicinas am las quals es superflua siccitat, ayssi cum razitz de lin e farina de errs, e polvera de enses e de aristologia, e de semblantz ad aquels.	And let him stay with this treatment for a day or two until you are sure of the cauterized wound; and then loosen it, and administer medicines that cause superficial dryness, such as linen rags and wheat flour, and powder of fennel and of aristology, and similar to these.
E es que tu fassas de aquestas medicinas polvera que sia pulverizada sobre la plagua, ayssi cum son secas; e universalment, administra en aquel tota medicina de proprietat de la qual es que abstergesca e no mordique.	And it is that you make of these medicines a powder that is sprinkled over the wound, as they are dry; and generally, administer in him all medicine of the property of which is that cleanses and does not bite.
E guarda te segon la tua vertut que la plagua en la tua curacio sia neta; e no sia en lu surdicia de enguent ni autra; ni no layssas agreguar virulencia en lu; quar quan es ajustada sobre le pannicol del cervel, corromp aquel e poyreys aquel, e accideys sobre le malaute aprop aquo malicia maligna.	And keep yourself according to your virtue that the wound in your treatment is clean; and let there be no filth of ointment or other in it; nor let you add virulence in him; for when it is applied on the skin of the brain, it corrupts him and causes him harm, and happens on the patient an evil malice.
E accideys en le ciphac del cap, cum de lu es mondificat le os e majorment quan es menspresada la cura de lu, e es negror en la superficia de lu; e donc considera lahoras si accideys al malaute les accidentz que havem ditz, sapias que es parnicios ses tot dopte.	And it happens in the head, as they are cleansed of the bone and most when the cure is lessened, and blackness in its surface; and therefore consider if these accidents happen to the patient that we have said, know that it is poisonous without doubt.
E si no accideys negror sino de la medicina que es pausada desus, e es en vertut de aquela medicina que fassa aquela negror, lahoras cove que tu prenguas de mel una partida e de oli rozat partidas .iii., e am aquels linieys un drap, e aprop pausa aquel sobre le ciphac; e aprop cura aquel am las specias de curacio que conveneys entro que sia sanat.	And if blackness does not happen except from the medicine that is placed over it, and it is in the virtue of that medicine that makes that blackness, then take honey a part, and rose oil parts iii., and with these line the cloth, and then place it over the head; and then cure that with the spices of cure that you consider until it is healed.
Capitol .iii.	Chapter iii.
De restauracio del nas quan es trincat.	Of the restoration of the nose when it is broken.
Sapias que no es trencat del nas sino doas partidas ensemps pus sobiranas, o una de aquelas alcunas veguadas, per so quar en lu has dos osses, quar la partida dejos es cartillaginosa, e no es trencada e no accideys a lu sino atricio e tortuositat e sinuitat.	Know that the nose is not broken except into two parts above all, or one of those some few times, because in it there are two bones, because the part below is cartilaginous, and it is not broken, and nothing happens to it except compression and crookedness and sinusitis.
Mays si es trencada la una de las doas partidas de lu, lahoras cove que tu intrometas le dit petit en le sieu nas, e que engualhas aquela fractura dedintz am le tieu dit indic, e am le dit pous defora, entro que retorne le nas segon la sua figura natural.	But if one of the two parts of it is broken, then you must put your little finger into his nose, and close that fracture inside with your index finger, and with your thumb push outward, until the nose returns according to its natural figure.
E sia fayt aquo per tu am facilitat, e guarda te que no caja per aquela tua operacio sobre le malaute delor.	And do this by you with facility, and keep yourself that it does not hurt because of your operation on the patient.
E si la fractura es en la pus sobirana partida del nas, e le dit no perve ad aquela, lahoras cove que sia equat am la extremitat del ray en le qual sia petita grossitut.	And if the fracture is in the highest part of the nose, and the finger does not reach it, then let it be applied with the extremity of the rod in which there is a small thickness.
E si la fractura es en doas partidas, lahoras tu fay le semblant de aquo.	And if the fracture is in two parts, then you do that.
E coyta te am restauracio de lu en le primier dia de la fractura, si es possible; e sino, lahoras aprop le vii o·l x deves le repaus del apostema caut.	And cauterize it for restoration in the first day of the fracture, if possible; and if not, then you must let him rest the cauterized wound for seven days.
E aprop entromet en la extremitat del nas una meca de drap de li, si la fractura es en una partida, o metz doas calguas, si la fractura es en doas partidas, e sia en la calgua grossitut de tanta quantitat que umpla le trauc del nas.	And then put into the extremity of the nose a plug of linen cloth, if the fracture is in one part, or put two pegs if the fracture is in two parts, and let there be thickness in the peg of as much quantity that fills the hole of the nose.
E diysso alcus dels antics restauradors que las calguas sian enfundudas en boder, e sian permudadas en tot dia, mays no es vist a mi; habantz cove que la meca sia enfunduda en album de huou comfit am polvera de moli; e aprop layssa la qualgua entro que l’os sia fermat e sia endurazida la cartillage.	And some of the ancient restorers said that the pegs be immersed in vinegar, and changed every day, but I have not seen it; they say that the plug be immersed in honeycombed vinegar with powdered mill; and then let the peg stay until the bone is healed and the cartilage hardened.
E alcunas veguadas sia entromes en le nas, en loc de calgua, pena de auca pus que es envolopada de drap de li leon; e sia que ja te la fractura del nas pus vehement e que le malaute no sia prohibit de inspiracio.	And sometimes it is inserted in the nose, instead of peg, a peacock feather that is wrapped in linen lion cloth; and let there be the fracture of the nose more violent and that the patient not be prohibited from breathing.
E aquesta causa no es a tu necessaria; e si voles, fay aquo, e si voles, fay calguas.	And this cause is not necessary for you; and if you want, do it, and if you want, make pegs.
E si accideys autra veguada apostema caut, emplastra le nas am cerot o am coto enfus en vi agre e oli rozat, o am diaquilon.	And if another cauterized wound happens, plaster the nose with cerote or with a poultice soaked in wine and rose oil, or with diaquilon.
Mays si no accideys apostema caut, lahoras cove que emplaustres aquel defora am farina de sizami e am polvera de enses cofitz am album de huou; e aprop pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e no lies le nas am alcuna causa.	But if there is no cauterized wound, then plaster that outward with sesame flour and fennel powder cooked in honey; and then place a lion's tongue over it, and do not put the nose to any cause.
Mays si so trencats les osses del nas am fractura petita o so conminuitz, lahoras cove que scindas sobre aquels, e extraguas aquels am insturmentz que conveno ad aquels; e aprop cos la scissura, e cura aquela am aquo que encarna e consolida, e am emplastres ad aquo convenientz.	But if the bones of the nose are broken with a small fracture or crushed, then split those, and extract them with instruments that are appropriate for them; and then sew the split, and cure that with what encapsulates and consolidates it, and with plasters that are appropriate.
E si accideys plagua dedintz le nas, lahoras cove que cures aquela am calguas e administra canulas de plom entro que sia de tot sanat.	And if a wound happens inside the nose, then cure that with pegs and administer lead tubes until it is completely healed.
Capitol .iiii.	Chapter iv.
De restauracio de la mandibula quan es trincada.	Of the restoration of the jaw when it is broken.
Quan la mandibula dejos es rompuda e la fractura de lu no es am plagua, reguarda lahoras si la fractura es deforas tant solament, e no es trencada en dos e es curvada a las partidas dedintz, lahoras la sua cognicio es leugiera.	When the lower jaw is broken and the fracture of it does not have wound, consider then if the fracture is outward only, and is not broken in two and bent at its parts within, then its diagnosis is easy.
E cove donc, si la fractura es en la part dreyta, que tu intrometas le tieu indic senestre en la boca del malaute; e semblantment si la fractura es an la mandibula senestra, lahoras intromet le dit indic de la ma dreyta; e impelleys am aquel la gilbositat de la fractura dedintz am facilitat a las partidas defora, am la tua autra ma de la partida defora del os; am aquel decentment equa aquelam.	And therefore, if the fracture is on the right part, put your left index finger into the patient's mouth; and likewise if the fracture is on the left side of the jaw, then put in the mouth with the index finger of the right hand; and push by that the flexibility of the fracture within with facility to its parts outward, with the other hand from the part of the bone; and by that it is equalized that.
E si la fractura de la mandibula ja es separada en doas, lahoras cove que administres extensio de doas partz segon rectitut entro que sia possibla la equacio de lu.	And if the fracture of the jaw is already separated into two parts, then administer the extension of both parts according to its rightness so that it is possible to equalize them.
E si accideys conmocio de dentz a disrupcio, lahoras strenh aquelas de las quals speras que romandran am fil de aur o de argent o de ceda; e aprop pausa sobre la mandibula trencada cerot, e aprop pausa sobre lu drap duplicat, e pausa sobre le drap gran stelha decentment fayta, o una pessa de sola engual a la longitut de la mandibula; e aprop lia aquela desus segon que a tu es apparelhada la liadura de lu e que conveneys la applicacio, entro que no es destruida.	And if there is a concussion of teeth to disruption, then strengthen those with wires that will break with thread of gold or silver, or with thread of silk; and then place over the broken jaw cerote, and then place over it doubled cloth, and place over the cloth a great star decently made, or a bandage single lengthwise of the jaw; and then tie that over so that you have the fastening of it prepared and that it is appropriate to its application, until it is not ruined.
E comanda al malaute que use de repaus e tranquilitat, e pausa la vianda de lu sorbicios leons.	And command the patient to have rest and tranquillity, and feed him with wine and soft foods.
E si extimas que ja es alterada la figura en alcuna manieyra, lahoras tu te coyta e deslia aquel al tertz dia; e aprop rectifica aquo que ja es alterat de lu e emplaustra aquel am polvera de moli, am album de huou, o am farina de cisami, pus que tu auras ostat le cerot de lu, e pausa sobre le emplastra lana leon.	And if you see that the figure is altered in any way, then take it off and loose that on the third day; and then rectify what has been altered of it, and plaster that with sesame flour, with honeycombed vinegar, or with flour of cress, after you have removed the cerote from it, and place over the plaster linen cloth.
E adonc cum sta annex e ajustat aquel emplastre sobre lu, e la disposicio del os no es alterada, layssa aquel, que no le deslies entro que sia sanat e strenh la fractura; quar motas veguadas aquesta fractura es streyta en tres sempmanas.	And then after that and the adjustment of that plaster over it, and the disposition of the bone is not altered, leave it, that it does not loosen until it is healed and the fracture is strong; for many times this fracture is tight in three weeks.
E si autra veguada accida apostema caut, lahoras administra aquo que havem dit motas veguadas en la sedacio de lu entro que sia sanat, e sia remaugut aquel apostema.	And if another vesicle occurs with pus, then administer what we have said about many vesicles in the sedation of him so that he may heal and the pus be expelled.
E si la fractura es am plagua, lahoras considera si es pessa del os separada o satagias, lahoras tu te subtilia que ostes aquelas satagias am aquo que conveneys ad aquo en la remocio de aquelas dels sturmentz.	And if the fracture is a wound, then consider whether it is a heavy bone separated or shattered, then you subtlety that hold those shards with what is convenient to that in the removal of those with instruments.
E si le orrifici de la plagua es streyt, lahoras tu le amplifique am le fleubotomi segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	And if the opening of the wound is narrow, then you enlarge it with phlebotomy according to the quantity of your need.
E aprop quan tu auras ostat aquelas satagias, e de aquelas no sira remaugut re, lahoras tu cos le orrifici de la plagua si es ampla; e sino, pausa sobre aquela un dels emplaustres que conveneysso ad aquo e encarnan aquela, entro que sia sanada.	Then, when you have held those shards, and some do not bleed out, then you close the opening of the wound if it is large; and if not, place one of the ointments that are convenient to that and bandage that up, so that it may be healed.
Capitol .v.	Chapter 5.
De restauracio de la furcula quan es trinquada.	Of the restoration of the collarbone when it is broken.
Motas veguadas es trencada la furcula de la partida denant deves le muscle, e aquela fractura es fayta en una de tres manieyras.	Many times the collarbone in front of the chest is broken by a blow, and that fracture is done in one of three ways.
Quar o es trencada, o seperada, o es seperada en doas partz otra que no accidan satagias; e es leugier a la restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que accideysso en lu satagias, e es dificil a restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que la fractura es am plagua.	Because it is broken, or separated, or separated into two parts other than that do not occur vesicles; and it is easier to restore it; or it is so that vesicles occur in it, and it is difficult to restore; or the fracture is a wound.
E la operacio en aquela, quan la fractura es ses plagua, es que tu fassas esser present dos ministres, per so que la un tengua le adjutori e siegua la furcula trencada, e l’autre extenda le col ves aquela partida.	And the operation in that, when the fracture is a wound, is that you have two assistants, so that one has the assistant and follows the collarbone broken, and the other stretches out the neck while that part is broken.
E aprop enguala la fractura am les tieus ditz entro que sia fayta la forma de lu segon que cove, e no sia en lu eminencia pauca ni concavitat.	Then splint the fracture with your fingers until it is made in its form according to how it covers, and there be no slight eminence or concavity in it.
E si indigeysses mes de extencio, lahoras cove que pauses dejos le titillic del malaute spera de drap o de lana, e sia la grandesa de lu segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat; e exten e eleva la furcula e coarta la spera am la tua ma entro que enguales la frectura segon que cove.	And if you need more extension, then have a cotton or woolen cloth placed beneath the neck of the patient, and let the size of it be according to the quantity of your need; and extend and elevate the collarbone and constrict the cloth with your hand so that you may splint the fracture as it covers.
E si no podes atirar la extremitat de la furcula a las partidas defora, per so quar es pervenguda al preon, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sua cervitz, e pauses sobre le muscle de lu un coyssi migier en grandeza.	And if you cannot bring the extremity of the collarbone to the parts forward, because it is come to the breast bone, then have the patient reclined on his neck, and place a cushion half in size over the muscle of him.
E le ministre prema le muscle de lu a las partidas dejos entro que l’os de la furcula sia elevat que es en le preon en sus, e lahoras tu rectifique la fractura e enguala aquela am les tieus ditz.	And the assistant press the muscle of him to the parts below so that the bone of the collarbone be elevated which is in the breast bone above it, and then you correct the fracture and splint it with your fingers.
Mays si sentes satagias de la furcula e so maugudas, lahoras cove que fendes sobre aquela e extraguas aquelas satagias am facilitat.	But if you feel vesicles of the collarbone and they are not healed, then have you split that open and drawn out those vesicles with facility.
E si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu ingenia inscisio de lu am un dels inscissoris les quals has apparelhatz ad aquo, pus que havias pausat dejos la furcula le sturment que serve le ciphac; e es sturment de fust o de ferr del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And if it is retained in the bone, then you devise an incision of it with one of the knives which you have apparelled for that, after you had placed beneath the collarbone the instrument that serves the head; and the instrument is of wood or iron, of which this is the form of it:
E es semblant a culier del qual aquesta es la concavitat; e sia la sua latitut segon aquo que has necessitat de lu, segon la grandeza del os o la pauqueza de lu.	And it is like a chisel of which this is the concavity; and let its breadth be according to what you have need of it, according to the greatness of the bone or the fragility of it.
Mays la longitut de lu sia segon que es a tu possible a la operacio; que haja doas extremitatz ayssi cum vezes, e la una extremitat sia ample e l’autre streyta.	But let its length be according to that it is possible for you in the operation; that it have two extremities thus with points, and one extremity be ample and the other narrow.
E si la disrupcio de la plagua la qual has inscidida quan has extraytas la satagia del os es ampla, e yest segur de apostema caut, lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura.	And if the opening of the wound which you have split when you have drawn out the pus of the bone is ample, and it seems sure of pus, then you adjust the two lips of the wound with a suture.
E si la disrupcio es pauca, o temes apostema caut, lahoras tu uemple la plagua am draps e pulvils segon la quantitat de la scissura de la plagua.	And if the opening is slight, or you fear pus, then you fill the wound with clothes and powders according to the quantity of the opening of the wound.
E si accideys apostema caut, lahoras infon drap en vi agre e oli rozat e vi, e pausa sobre aquel.	And if pus occurs, then moisten a cloth in wine and rose oil and vinegar, and place it over that.
Mays la strictura del os quan es ses plagua e ses seccio, es que pauses emplastre fayt de farina de moli am album de huou, e pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e aprop pausa la spera dejos le titillic de lu, si indigeyssas de aquela, e aprop pren humemate, so es torca la qual teno les Sarrazis , que sia mot longua, e sia latitut de lu de un palm o entorn aquel; e aprop pausa pulvils duplicatz sobre la stopa e l’emplastre; e aprop pren una stela de taula subtil de la qual la latitut d’ela sia de tres ditz e en longitut semblantment; e aprop envolopa aquela en drap, e aprop envolopa aquel drap am la stela en lo loc sobre le loc de la fractura; e aprop pausa humemati ayssi cum es revout, e revol aquela sobre le col de lu e dejos le titillic de lu sa e dejos le titillic de lu malaute, e reduzeys aquela sobre tota partida, e quan vezes que la strictura de la fractura am strictura descent, e es aquo que no es occultat sobre tu.	But the constriction of the bone when it is without wound and without section is that you place a plaster made of wheat flour with white egg, and place over it a stopa of lion, and then place the cloth beneath the neck of him, if he needs it; and then take humamate, so is the which they hold the Sarrazis , let its length be one palm or around that; and then place powders doubled over the stopa and the plaster; and then take a table-stick of which the breadth be of three fingers and in length likewise; and then wrap up that in cloth, and then wrap that cloth with the stick in the part of the fracture; and then take the humemate as is turned around, and place it over his neck and beneath the neck of him, and reduce that to every part, and when the constriction of the fracture with constriction descends, and that is which does not hide under you.
E tot, que no sia mauguda la stelha desobre le os trencat; e per so cove que tu vejas le malaute quascun dia, que quan le liament es mollificat o vezas la stela ja esser remauguda, lahoras tu rectifica aquo e strenh la liadura.	And all that the plaster be not healed over the broken bone; and so have you look at the patient every day, for when the bandage is softened or you see the plaster already healed, then you correct that and tighten the bandage.
E aprop pausa le dormir del malaute sobre le col de lu, e pausa dejos le titillic de lu deves le dormir de lu en la nueyt un petit coyssi; per so que am aquel sia elevat le adjutori de lu del latz de aquel, e donc es elevada la la fractura de la furcula a elevacio del muscle; o sia le bras de lu liat al col de aquel.	And then place the pillow of him over his neck, and place beneath the neck of him due to the pillow of him in the night a little cushion; so that with that be elevated the support of him from the side of that, and thus is elevated the fracture of the collarbone at elevation of the muscle; or let his arm be bound to his neck.
E no deslies le liament si no accideys en le loc prusiment o apostema, entro a xii dias.	And do not loosen the bandage if pus does not occur in the place or very much, until twelve days have passed.
E aprop renovelha le emplastre si has vista la facia de lu ad aquo, e ajusta en la strictura e restaura aquel e layssa entro que sia restaurat e sia coagulat la fractura de la furcula.	And then renew the plaster if you have seen his face to that, and adjust in constriction and restore that, and leave it until it is restored and the fracture of the collarbone is coagulated.
E es strenguda e comfortada segon le mes en xxviii dias, e alcunas veguadas en alcus homes es fayt en mens de temps de aquel.	And it is tightened and comforted according to the moon in twenty-eight days, and some times in some men it is done in less time than that.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter 6.
De restauracio de fractura de la spalla.	Of the restoration of the fracture of the shoulder.
Spatula tart es trencada en le loc lat de lu e no so trencatz de lu sino les marges.	The spatula is broken in the broad place of it and not broken of it but its margins.
E donc quan es trencat le loc de lu — e es trencat en le mieg loc de lu — e no es conogut sino per tocament, lahoras segon que es la figura de la fractura sforsa te la preparacio de lu e reduzir aquela segon la figura natural en tota manieyra de engen la qual es a tu possible.	And then when it is broken in the place of it — and it is broken in the middle place of it — and it is not congealed except by touch, then according to that the figure of the fracture is bent have you the preparation of it and reduce that according to the natural figure in every manner of engine which it is possible for you.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc polvera de moli am album de huou e stopa leon; e aprop pausa pulvil de drap duplicat; e aprop pausa sobre lu stela lada de taula subtil segon la quantitat de la spatula tota o mays un pauc.	And then place over the place powder of wheat flour with white egg and stopa lion; and then place doubled cloth of wool; and then place over it a table-stick of wood subtle according to the quantity of the spatula whole or but little.
Mays si dejos la stela es concavitat en alcu dels locs de la spatula, lahoras tu enguala aquela concavitat am stopa leon, e aprop pueja la stela segon equalitat.	But if beneath the stick is concavity in any of the places of the spatula, then you splint that concavity with stopa lion, and then set the stick according to equality.
E aprop strenh desus am humemati longua ab constriccio decent e am fermesa de la stela entro que no sia remauguda del sieu loc.	And then tighten above with a long humamate with decent constriction and with firmness of the stick so that it is not healed in its place.
E considera le liament en quascun dia; e totas veguadas que sia mollificat, lia autra veguada e stren le e equa la stela si es remauguda del sieu loc.	And consider the bandage every day; and all times that it is softened, loosen another time and tighten it and adjust the stick if it is healed in its place.
E jagua le malaute sobre le sieu latz sa.	And support him on his side.
E la spatula es restaurada en xx dias o en .xxv.	And the spatula is restored in twenty days or less than that.
E donc quan es complit aquest nombre, lahoras tu dissolveys le liament, e que tu scias ensegurat quar aquela es dels osses dels quals la cominicio no es temuda ni lor dissolucio.	And then when it is completed that number, then you dissolve the bandage, and so you know it to be assured that that of the bones of which the beginning is not feared nor its dissolution.
E si procezeys del loc del os pessa e pongeys dejos la codena, lahoras tu scindeys sobre lu, e osta le, e fay segon que havem dit en la fractura de la furcula de sadacio de apostema caut si accideys aqui.	And if you process the area of the foot and place a chain underneath it, then you split it, and bind it, and do as we have said in the fracture of the clavicle of an aposteme if it occurs here.
