E quant le metge toca la junctura am la sua ma, unte aquela am alcun oli per so que aquo sia aquelas causas las quals ajudan en lubricitat de la junctura am facilitat; e aprop empellesca la junctura am empulcio vehement entro que retorne.	And when the doctor touches the joint with his hand, he should apply some oil to it so that it helps by facilitating lubrication of the joint; and then push down on the joint with violent impulse so that it returns.
E aprop la reduccio de lu cove que sia pausat sobre aquela empastre en le qual sia stipticitat e excequacio am album de huou, e sia extrenhut am strictura descent, e·l bras sia suspendut del col, e sia layssat per alcus dias.	And then the reduction of it must be that ointment is applied on which is stiffened and dried with rosewater; let it be tightened with a decent pressure, and his arm be suspended from the neck, and left for several days.
E aprop sia desliat; e donc si la junctura es formada en le sieu loc, lahoras tu deslia le liament de lu e layssa aquela.	And then let it be removed; and if the joint is formed in its place, then you remove the bandage from him.
E si vezas la junctura no be strenher, lahoras tu itera le emplastre e·l liament, e layssa aquela per alcus dias entro que sia extrenhuda; e aprop deslia aquela.	And if you see that the joint is not tighter, then iterate the ointment and bandage, and leave that for several days until it is tightened; and then remove that.
Mays si accideys a lu gravitat aprop la reduccio de la junctura, e la disposicio de lu es en movement, lahoras aministra humectacio en banh e fricacio subtil, e comprecio, entro que sia aleujat; o pausa sobre la junctura aleliati, so es coyssa de moto grassa; e aprop sia liada, e layssa aquela sobre le os le dia e la nueyt.	But if it happens to him that the weight of the reduction of the joint is heavy and its disposition is in movement, then administer wetting in a bath and subtle friction, while it is cooled down; or apply on the joint aloe, so that there is fat of motion; and then let it be bandaged and left for the day and night.
E aprop osta aquela, e met aquel en banh; e quan suza, lahoras tu fregua la junctura am fricacio temprada, e aprop itera sobre aquela aleliati, so es ronhonal de moto, una veguada, e la segonda, e la .iii.a.,	And then remove that and put him in a bath; and when he is sweat, then you rub the joint with mild friction, and then iterate on it aloe, so that it is ointment of motion, one day, and the second, and the third,
corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denolam intrament de banh, entro que sia linit.	The corruption has already arrived at the brain' lining of the bath, so that it is limited.
E si voles, pausa sobre aquela fenda de vaca humida e scalfada am boder e stren sobre aquel; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas, quar aquela es humida e reduzeys a la sua disposicio.	And if you wish, apply on that the udder of a cow wet and heated with a bandage, and tightly press on that; and do that several times, because it is moist and reduces to its disposition.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter .XXVIII.
De curacio de dislocacio de malassen, so es de la junctura que es entre·l bras e la ma.	Of healing of dislocation of malacet, so is the joint that is between the arm and the hand.
Malassen de la ma alcunas vetz es deslocada, e la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es leugiera, e·l contrari es de las autras juncturas, mays empero cove que sia velocitat en la reduccio de lu en la hora en la qual es deslocada, denant que le loc sia apostemat o que accida en lu apostema caut.	Malacet of the hand some times is displaced, and the reduction of its dislocation is easier, and it is contrary to other joints; but however let there be swiftness in the reduction of it in the hour in which it is displaced, before that place comes to pustules cauterized or that happens to him cautery.
E la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es que tu pauses la junctura de la ma del malaute sobre una taula e le ministre extenda la ma de aquel, e le metge pause la sua ma o o la sua palma sobre la iminencia de la junctura, e empellisca aquela entro que retorne al sieu loc.	And the reduction of its dislocation is that you stop the joint of the hand on a table and let the minister extend his hand, and the doctor put his hand or the palm of his hand on the edge of the joint, pushing it so that it returns to its place.
Mays empero cove que sia considerat si la palma ja es ostada al ventre de la ma, lahoras le malaute pause le dos de la sua ma sobre una taula deves la extencio e la reduccio; e si la dislocacio es precedent deves le dos de la ma, lahoras sia la posicio de la ma de aquel intrinicequement sobre la taula, per so que la ma del metge caja sobre aquela iminencia de la junctura.	However, one must consider whether the palm is already turned towards the belly of the hand; then the patient should place the back of their hand on a table below the extension and reduction. And if the dislocation precedes from the back of the hand, then the position of the hand should be intrinsecally on the table so that the doctor's hand can grasp that imminence of the joint.
E donc si retorna tantost, bon es; e sino, lahoras strenh aquela am empastre cedant le apostema e layssa aquel; e no iteres aquo, quar sino, no soferta ni no podes sobre la reduccio de lu pus que passan a lu dias.	And if he returns at once, that is good; but if not, then press on the pustule with your finger until it gives way and let it go, and do not repeat this, or else he will not endure nor be able to bear the reduction after so many days have passed.
Mays empero la junctura roman segon la sua tortuositat; e no notz al malaute alcuna causa, sino que la ma es mollificada e no pot strenher alcuna causa; lahoras sapias que les nervis son trincatz o trissatz, e lahoras no es engen en lu sino que sia strenhuda am cauteri prop le cazament de lu e fort leu aquo confereys alcuna causa.	But the bone will return to its position according to its tortuosity; and if you observe no cause in the patient, except that his hand is relaxed and cannot grasp anything, then know that the nerves are torn or cut, and there is nothing inside him except that it should be tightened with a cautery near its dislocation, and strengthen it there firmly.
Donc cum malassem es retornada, lahoras pausa sobre lu empastre le qual havem recomtat, e sia layssat e strenhut per v dias; e aprop sia desliat e sia layssat e la ma de lu sia excercitada.	Then when the patient is returned to his former state, apply to him the plaster which we have recommended, and let it remain and be tightened for three days; and then let it be loosened and left off, and the hand exercised.
Mays si le movement de lu es ostat e accideys en lu alcuna gravitat, lahoras leniys aquela am aygua cauda e am fricacio alcunas veguadas, entro que sia alleujat.	But if his movement is impeded and some heaviness occurs in him, then loosen that with warm water and with friction several times, while he is being eased.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter 29.
De la curacio de dislocacio dels ditz.	Of the cure for dislocation of the teeth.
Alcunas veguadas so dislocatz les ditz a tota partida.	The teeth are sometimes completely dislocated.
E quan es dislocat alcun dit de aquels al dos de la palma o al ventre de lu, lahoras sten le dit e impelleys la dislocacio de lu am les tieus pouses, entro que retorne.	And when any tooth is dislocated to the back of the hand or to its belly, then press on the tooth and drive out the dislocation of it with your fingernails, while it returns to place.
E aprop sostenta le cap del dit, e suspen aquel deves la part a la qual es dislocat, e layssa aquel per dos dias.	Then support the head of the tooth and suspend that from the part to which it is dislocated, and leave that for two days.
E aprop suspen aquel e exten aquel entro que dreyt sia engualhat en aquel sieu dia.	And then suspend and extend that until it is straightened out in its place on the following day.
E quan sira noyt, lia aquel segon aquela narracio, e no cesses desliar aquel en le dia e exercitar am movement, e lia aquel en la noyt; e fay aquo per alcus dias entro que sia streyt.	And when morning comes, loosen that according to the narrative, and do not cease loosening it during the day and exercising with movement, and do so at night as well; and do this for several days until it is tightened.
E fay semblant am aquo, si es dislocat al ventre de la ma, e lia aquel ad aquela partida e fay am aquo la tieua primiera operacio, entro que sia sanat.	And feign that it is dislocated to the belly of the hand, and loosen that to that part, and do with it your first operation until it is healed.
E semblantment fay am aquo quan es dislocat a las autres partidas.	And similarly do with it if it is dislocated to other parts.
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter 30.
De la curacio de dislocacio dels spondils del dos.	Of the cure for dislocation of the vertebrae in the back.
Quan accideys ad alcun dels spondils del dos o del col dislocacio complida, e so remaugutz motz spondils de lors locs, lahoras en aquela no es curacio, quar la mort se coyta al malaute.	When complete dislocation occurs to any of the vertebrae in the back or neck, and several vertebrae are displaced from their places, then in that there is no cure, for death awaits the patient.
E senhal de aquo es que la egestio del malaute es fora-eyssida ses voluntat, e no pot retenir aquela; e motas veguadas so mollificatz alcus membres de lu o doas cambas de lu o dos brasses de lu, o un de aquels; o es remaugut un spondil de son loc, quar motas veguadas es remaugut e motas veguadas es fayta la remocio de aquels a quatre partidas.	And a sign of this is that the excretion of the patient is outside his control, and he cannot retain it; and often several members of his body or both legs or both arms, or one of those are relaxed; or one vertebra is displaced from its place, for often it is displaced and often the removal of those to four parts occurs.
Donc aquela ja es remauguda a las partidas detras e es nompnada gelbozitat.	Then when that is displaced to the back parts, it is called dislocation of the spine.
Mays la curacio de lu es que lahoras consideras si la gelbozitat accidey de puerissia, quar lahoras en aquela no es curacio ni de aquela no es sanacio de tot.	But its cure is that you should consider if the dislocation occurred in childhood, for then there is no cure for that, and there is no healing of it at all.
Mays en aquela que ve per cazement o per percussio o per semblant ad aquels, ja diyssero les Antics las manieras de curacio am sermo prolixs, del qual lo mays retorna am profieyt; mays yeu ja e abreujat de aquel del qual lo pauc escusa del trop de lu, per la mieua propinquitat a la entencio mieua exposicio, am la qual he aquo expausat et format ex instrument divers de aquel am le qual mostrero aquo e espausero aquel.	But of that which occurs due to impact or concussion or similarly, the Ancients have spoken of methods of cure with prolix speech, of which the best returns with profit; but I have abridged that which the few excuse from its excess due to my proximity to the intention and its exposition, and in which I have expounded and formed it from diverse instruments, by which I will demonstrate and explain.
E dic que en gelbosita que accideys de la partida denant en le pietz, no es engen ni sanacio de aquela; e semblantment en aquela que es fayta a dos latz.	And I say that in dislocation which occurs to the front part of the feet, there is no healing for it; and similarly in that which is done on both sides.
E de aquelas no es curada sino aquela que accideys en le dos propriament am aquo que yeu recomti.	And of those, only that which occurs in the back properly is healed by me.
E es que·l malaute sia extendut sobre la sua cara sobre pug engual prop de paret, e sia extendut dejos lu esturment molh per so que no sia lidit le pietz de lu.	And let the patient be extended on his face over a soft bed, and let him be extended below by an instrument moistened in order that his feet not be bound.
E aprop un fust dreyt sia pausat, ficat en la terra en la extremitat del pug entorn le cap de lu, e autra fust en aviro les pes de lu en l’autra extremitat del pueg.	And then a straight staff should be placed, fixed in the earth at the end of the bed around his head, and another staff in air holding up his feet at the other end of the bed.
E·l ministre tengua le fust, e no sia fermat en fossa; e autre ministre tengua l’autre segon aquela forma.	And one minister should hold the staff and not be fixed in a hole; and another minister should hold the other according to that form.
E aprop envolopa sobre le cap del malaute e dejos les titillic liamen leon ferm; e exten la extremitat del liamel al fust le qual es deves le cap de lu, e lia aquel en lu; e aprop strenh l’autre liament sobre las ancas de lu les denols de lu, e deves las cambas de lu; e aprop ajusta totz les liamentz e lia aquels en l’autre fust le qual es deves les pes de lu.	And then wrap around the head of the patient and let them lift up with their hands the end of the staff which is beneath his head, and extend the other end of the staff to the other staff which is beneath his feet; and then tighten all the cords and do this to the other staff which is beneath his feet.
E aprop le ministre cascu extenda le liament a la partida del fust, e no sian remaugutz les dos fustz e les liamentz dels sieus locs en les quals son ficatz, mays empero no so fermatz ayssi cum havem dit.	And then the ministers each extend the cords to the end of the staff, and let the staffs not be displaced from their places where they are fixed, but rather let them be tightened as I have said.
E le metge pause las suas palmas sobre le spondil am fortaleza entro que retorne, o que pause sobre aquela una taula, e aprop que ajuste sobre la taula les sieus pes entro que retorne.	And the doctor should place his palms over the vertebra with strength until it returns to its position, or he should place it on a table and then tighten his feet over the table until it returns.
Mays si no retorna per aquesta forma, lahoras pren una taula de la qual la latitut o la longitut sia en aviro de tres brassas, e cava en la paret de la qual havem dit que es prop le malaute un loc en le qual intre la extremitat de la taula.	But if it does not return by this means, then take a table whose breadth or length is in air about three arms, and hollow out in the wall of which we have said that it is near the patient a place into which the end of the table falls.
E aprop pausa la maytat de la taula sobre le spondilh, e·l metge pause les sieus pes sobre l’autre extremitat, e estrenha be entro que le spondil sia coartat e que retorne al sieu loc.	And then place the middle of the table over the vertebra, and the doctor should place his feet over the other end, and tighten well until the vertebra is tightened and returns to its position.
E si tu voles, obre am torn le qual es revolvut am la ma; e es que tu fiques en terra deves le cap del malaute en le derier del pug dos fustz, la longitut dels quals sia d’un bras, e deves le cap de lu en le derier del pug eyssament dos fustz; e sia la longitut que es entre quascun fust un palm, e ja es fayt en quascun fust trauc en le qual corr torn, e quascun sia mot fermat en terra per so que no sia maugut.	And if you wish, open with a pulley which is turned by hand; and fix in the earth behind the head of the patient two staffs, the length of which are an arm each, and fix the head of him in the end of the pulley two staffs, and let the length be between each staff one palm, and each be fixed in the earth so that it is not displaced.
E sia mes un fust redon en le qual es le torn, e sia revolvut en les dos traucs dels dos fustz.	And there should be a round staff in which is the pulley, and it should be turned in the two holes of the two staffs.
E en la extremitat de lu es un trauc en le qual es format le fust, la longueza del qual es un palm am aquo que es revolvut; e en les dos autres fustz es semblant de aquel.	And at its end is a hole in which the staff is formed, the length of which is one palm by that which is turned; and likewise in the two other staffs is similarly.
E aprop strenh les liamentz que has streyt en le pietz del malaute en le trau le qual es deves le cap de lu, e les liamentz que has streyts en las coyssas de lu en le torn le qual es deves les pes de lu.	And then tighten the cords which you have tightened around the feet of the patient in the pulley which is beneath his head, and the cords which you have tightened around his thighs in the turn which is beneath his feet.
E aprop deves quascun torn e stia un ministre que torssa le torn am la sua ma, e le metge engualhe le spondil segon que havem dit.	And then each pulley should have a minister who turns the pulley with his hand, and the doctor should warm the vertebra as we have said.
E aquesta es la forma del torn:	And this is the form of the pulley:
E aprop pus que le spondil es retornat, e le loc es engualhat, lahoras cove que pauses empastre exciccatiu am album de huou, e aprop estopa; e aprop pause sobre le empastre astela de taula de la qual la latitut sia de tres ditz o enviro aquels, e la longitut de lu sia quantitat que prengua le loc de la gelbositat, e sobre la partida del spondil sa.	And when the vertebra is returned and the place warmed, then consider that you pause on the dislocation a plaster dried with oil of roses, and then pitch; and then pause over the plaster a table whose breadth is three digits or more, and its length should take up the distance of the dislocation, and over the part of the vertebra.
E aprop sia liat am liament le qual havem dit, e uze le malaute de nutriment subtil entro que sia sanat.	And then let him be tied with a bandage as we have said before, and feed the patient with subtle food until he is healed.
E si roman alcuna iminencia en le loc en la fi de la sanacio, lahoras cove que sian aministradas medicinas que moilifico e liniscan am aministracio de la taula per lonc temps, la qual havem recomtada; e ja es aministrada en aquel loc lamina de plom.	And if there is any swelling in the affected area at the end of the healing process, then medicines that soften and loosen should be administered through oral intake over a long period of time, as we have described; and a lead plate has already been applied to that area.
E alcunas veguadas accideys imminencia en le derier dels spondils del dos, e es cujat per aquela dislocacio; e es aquel os le qual ja imineys per que no cove que sia fayta prosompcio a lu am aquesta medicina, quar fort leu fara a tu accidir mort.	And sometimes swelling occurs at the base of the spine, and it is caused by that displacement; and there is a bone in that area which should not be subjected to this medicine, because if it is, it will likely cause death.
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter 31.
De curacio de anca dislocada.	On the treatment of a dislocated hip.
Sapias que la junctura del ancha e la junctura del muscle no endeve sino dislocacio tant solament, e no accideys ad aquelas aquo que accideys a las autras juncturas de petita remocio e concavitat.	Know that the joint of the hip and the joint of the muscle are not designed to be dislocated, but only to move slightly with a small cavity.
E la junctura de la ancha es dislocada segon quatre manieyras, quar es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, o a las partidas defora, o a las partidas denant, o a las partidas detras.	And the joint of the hip is dislocated in four ways: it is dislocated on the inside or outside, or forward or backward.
E majorment es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, e pauc a las partidas denant o a las partidas detras.	Most often, it is dislocated to the inside, and less often to the front or back.
E senhal de la dislocacio de lu a las partidas de dintz es quar, quan tu ajustas la camba del malaute sana am la malaute, es pus longua e·l denolh es pus heminent que de la sana, e·l malaute no pot doblar le sieu pe deves le lenguonar, e es le loc que siec le lengonar apostemat de apostema caut, per so que·l cap de la coyssa ja es pervengut aqui.	And the sign of dislocation to the inside is that when you straighten the leg of the patient, it is longer and more prominent than the healthy one, and the patient cannot bend their foot backward, and there is a swelling on top of the hip joint, because the head of the femur has shifted here.
E·l senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio es a las partidas defora, es que les accidentz de lu so contraris ad aquest accident.	And the sign of dislocation to the outside is that its features are opposite to the previous description.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas denant es quar expan la camba sieua segon compliment, mays empero no dobla aquela ses dolor que es en le denol, e si se perforsa ad anar e no pot sobre aquo a las partidas denant; e la urina de lu es retenguda e l’engonar de lu es apostemat, e deves la ambulacio de lu sobre le talo.	And the sign of dislocation forward is that they can only extend their leg, but not bend it at the knee due to pain; if they try to walk on the ball of their foot, they cannot; and their urine is retained, and there is swelling in the groin area, and they walk on their heels.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas detras es que no expande le denol, ni no puesca doblar aquel denant que doble le engonar, e la camba de lu es pus breva que l’autra, e l’engonar es mollificat, e·l cap de la coyssa es deves aquel loc.	And the sign of dislocation backward is that they cannot extend or bend their leg at the knee; the leg is shorter than the other, and the groin area is softened, and the head of the femur has shifted backward.
Mays reduccio de las specias de aquesta dislocacio es que tu consideras, lahoras, si la dislocacio es vetusta et antiqua, que ja es anticada am le havent aquela aprop tu aministras reduccio de lu e roman segon la sua disposicio, lahoras no es en aquela curacio de tot; e adonc no cove que en aquela sia fayta prosompcio.	However, the reduction of this dislocation is that you must consider whether the dislocation is old and chronic: if it has been like that for a long time and you administer reduction according to its condition, then it will not be cured completely; and in that case, there should be no prosomecio.
Mays en aquel del qual la dislocacio es recent, e es una de las quatre specias de dislocacio, lahoras te coyta ad aquo que volvas la junctura e extendas aquela a las partidas dedintz e a las partidas defora, e mau aquela a la dextra e sinistra, quar fort leu retorna e no indigeys de autra cura.	But with the patient who has a recent dislocation, and it is one of the four types of dislocation, then you must try to return the joint to its proper position and extend it toward the inside and outside, and move it to the right and left, for it will quickly return to its place and will not require any other treatment.
Mays, si no retorna en aquesta manieyra, lahoras cove que tu prepares ministre fort e extendas la camba de lu de la partida pus dejos, o am las suas mas, o am liament lo qual es liat sobre la camba desus le denol; e autre ministre extenda la ma de aquel desus enayssi que meta las suas mas dejos les titillics de lu; e aprop strenha am liament leon sobre la razit de la coyssa, e tengua autre ministre ters le extremitat del liament.	But if it does not return to its proper position in this way, then you must prepare a strong bandage and extend the leg of the patient from the lowest part, or with their own hands, or with a bandage tied around the leg above the knee; and another person should hold the end of the bandage while someone else pulls it down below the patient's fingers; then tightly bind the lion's tongue around the head of the femur.
E sia extencio de lu o de la partida dedintz a l’angonar a la partida de la furcula, o de la partida detras a la partida del dos.	And the extension should be from the inside to the groin, or from the back to the shoulder blade.
E sia la extencio de totz aquels en una veguada entro que·l malaute sia elevat am le sieu cos de terra e que romangua pendent.	And they should all be extended at the same time while the patient is raised from the ground and their leg hangs down.
E aquesta specia de extencio es specia cominal a totas quatre.	And this type of extension is common to all four types.
E donc si la dislocacio retorna am aquo que havem dit, sira bo; e sino, lahoras es necessari a tota specia aquo que dire de la propria curacio.	So if the dislocation returns according to what we have said, it is good; but if not, then it is necessary to use any method that one knows of their own cure.
En la reduccio de lu propria, quan es dislocada, e la dislocacio es a las partidas dedintz, cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu latz sa; e aprop pausa les liamentz sobre la razit de la coyssa en aquel loc le qual entre le cap de la coyssa e·l loc que es dejos le langonar; e aprop exten le liament en sus de la part del angonar a la pus auta partida de la furcula.	In the proper reduction of it, when it is dislocated to the inside, the patient should lie on their side; then place the bandages over the head of the femur in that area between the head of the femur and the groin; and extend the bandage from above the groin toward the highest part of the collarbone.
E aprop autre ministre fort prengua les brasses de lu, e amerme le loc gros de la coyssa malaute e extenda a las partidas deforo per extencio vehement, quar aquela retorna en le sieu loc.	And another assistant should hold the patient' leg firmly, press on the large part of the hip joint and extend toward the outside with strong extension, for it will return to its place.
E aquesta specia es de pus leugiera curacio am la qual aquest membre es reduzit que las autres specias.	And this is the quickest cure by which this member is reduced compared to the other methods.
Mays si es excusat sobre tu e no obezeys al entrament am aquesta specia de curacio de tot, lahoras cove que sian liatz les dos pes del malaute ensemps am liament fort, leugier, sobre amdos les talos e amdos les denols.	But if it is resisted and does not obey the treatment with this method of cure for both feet at the same time, then both feet should be bound together tightly, on the soles and over the instep.
E sia la longitut de quascun de son par la quantitat de quatre ditz, e sia la camba malaute extenduda mays que l’autre per quantitat de dos ditz.	And the length of each band should be the amount of four fingers, and the leg of the patient should be extended more than the other by the amount of two fingers.
E aprop le malaute sia suspendut sobre le cap del fust, e que sia en la mayso; e sia la longitut de lu de la terra la quantitat de dos brasses.	And the patient should be suspended over the head of the pillar, and it should be in the middle; and its length from the ground should be the amount of two yards.
E aprop comanda a un jove fort que minuesca le cap de la coyssa, e sia suspendut am le malaute autre jove, e l’autre jove minuent la coysa am fortaleza empellesca, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	And order a strong young man to push down on the head of the femur, and another strong young man should suspend the patient, and the other young man should push up on the hip with strength, for the joint will return to its place quickly.
Mays en la reducio propria, quan es dislocacio a la partida defora, cove que·l malaute jaga sobre pug segon que havem recomtat en le havent gelbozitat; e sia strenhut le liament sobre la camba malauta propriament e sobre le pietz de lu.	But in the proper reduction, when it is dislocated to the outside, the patient should lie on their back according to what we have recommended regarding frozen gel; and the bandage should be tightly bound around the leg of the patient and over the foot.
E aprop dos fustz sian pausatz, la un als pes de lu, e l’autre al cap; e aprop sian pausatz fustz ajustatz al mieg del pueg ficat sobre·l qual draps humitz sian envolopatz, per so que·l malaute no sia dampnajat per que·l fust sia entre las coyssas de lu, per que deves la extencio a las partidas dejos no sia atirat.	And two pillars should be placed, one under the feet of the patient, and the other under their head; and the pillar placed under the buttocks should be wrapped with wet cloths, so that the patient is not damaged by the pillar being between their thighs, so that the extension toward the lowest part is not hindered.
E aprop quascun ministre extenda a la sua part, e·l metge am la sua ma enguala la reduccio segon l’art.	And each assistant should extend their part, and the doctor with his hand should guide the reduction according to the art.
Donc, si obezeys a revercio, sira bo grandament; e sino, pausa sobre aquela diligentment e ayssi quo havem dit en gelbozitat per aquela engualment.	So, if it obeys extension, it will be very good; but if not, then pause over it diligently and in that way which we have said regarding congelation for that extension.
Mays cove que·l malaute jagua sobre les sieus latz sa quetament.	But the patient should lie on their side comfortably.
E quan la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras cove que la camba sia extenduda leugierament, e es segon aquesta meteyssa narracio sobre pueg; e le metge pause la palma de la sua ma dreyta sobre·l langonar malaute, e aprop coarte aquel am l’autra ma, e am aquela coartacio pausa aquel extendut a las partidas dejos a la partida del denol.	And when the dislocation is forward, then the leg should be extended more than usual, and according to this measurement, the palm of the doctor's right hand should be placed over the groin, and another assistant should pull that up with their other hand, and with that pulling, extend it toward the lowest part at the knee.
E si la dislocacio es a las partidas detras, lahoras no cove que·l malaute sia extendut a las partidas dejos, e es elevat sobre la terra; habantz cove que sia pausat sobre causa dura, ayssi cum cove le eyssament si l’ancha de lu es dislocada a las partidas defora, segon aquo que havem dit del jasement de lu sobre dos anchas; e es sobre la sua cara e les liamentz sian extendutz, segon que havem dit, no ha guayre.	And if the dislocation is backward, then the patient' leg should not be extended toward the lowest part, and it should be elevated above the ground; but it should be placed on a hard surface, just as the leg joint is dislocated to the outside, according to what we have said about its placement on two surfaces; and it should lie on its side and the bandages should be extended, according to what we have said, without pain.
E cove que sia aministrada compressio am taula sobre le loc al qual yeys la junctura.	And there should be administration of compression with a table over the area where the joint is located.
Donc cum la reducio es complida segon que cove — e·l senhal de la reduccio de lu no es amaguat a tu, e es que tu extendas del malaute doas cambas, e quan tu vezes aquelas enguals e le malaute extrenh la sieua camba e expandeys aquela ses excusacio, lahoras sapias que·l membre segon que cove es retornat — e lahoras tu ajusta doas coyssas e pausa empastre e extrenh am benda ayssi que la ancha no sia mauguda en alcuna de las partidas; e adheresca le malaute a repaus per tres dias o per quatre.	So when the reduction is complete according to what we have said — and the sign of the reduction of it is not hidden from you, and it is that you extend two legs, and when you see those angles and the patient stretches their leg and expands it without excuse, then you know that the member according to which it has returned — and then you adjust two thighs and pause with plaster and expand it with a bandage so that the joint is not bent in any of the parts; and bind the leg to rest for three days or four.
E aprop deslia le liament e l’empastre, e compara la una camba am l’autra.	Then, cut the ligament and the plaster, and compare one leg to the other.
Lahoras, si vezas aquelas enguals en vustament, lahoras sapias que la dislocacio ja es fermada, e adonc layssa le malaute anar.	Now, if you see these wounds in reality, then know that the dislocation is already healed and the patient can walk.
E si vezas alcuna causa de mollificacio, lahoras tu retorna e emplastra aquel, e extrenh aquel segon la tua primiera strectura, e layssa aquel en tres dias.	And if you see any cause for softening, then return and plaster that one, and stretch the other according to your first stretching, and leave it for three days.
E aprop deslia aquel, e fay aquel tardar en ambulacio sobre quascu per alcus dias, entro que sia confortat.	Then loosen that one, and make that one delay in walking for some days, until he is comfortable.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter 32.
De curacio de dislocacio del denolh.	Of the cure of dislocation of the jaw.
Le denolh es dislocat segon tres manieyras, quar es dislocat a las partidas defora, e a las partidas dedintz, e a las partidas dejos mays a las partidas detras; e a las partidas denant no es dislocat.	The jaw is dislocated in three ways: it is dislocated at the outward parts, and at the inward parts, and at the lower parts more than at the upper parts; and it is not dislocated at the frontward parts.
E le senhal de dislocacio de lu es que comandes al malaute que aplique la sua camba am la coyssa; lahoras sapias que·l denol es dislocat.	And the sign of dislocation is that you command the patient to apply his jaw to his thigh; then know that the jaw is dislocated.
E la restauracio de totas las manieyras de lu es que fassas cezer le malaute dreyt, enayssi que ja extenda la sieua camba, si pot sobre aquo; adherir le tieu dos a la cara de lu, e pausa le pe de lu entre les tieus pes; e aprop fay adherir le denol de lu am las tuas palmas, e rete aquelas entre les tieus ditz sobre le denolh de lu am fortaleza, e autre ministre extenda le sieu pe entro que·l denol retorne a son loc.	And the restoration of all these ways is that you make the patient lie down straight, so that he extend his leg, if he can, on that; adhere your two hands to his face, and place his foot between your feet; and then make adhere your jaw to his palm, and retain those between your teeth over his jaw with strength, and another extends his leg while the jaw returns to its place.
E senhal de reddicio de lu es que la sua camba adharesca am la coyssa am levitat no-laboroza.	And the sign of reduction is that his thigh adheres to the cushion with light non-labouring.
E aprop emplastra aquel e fay adhirir la camba am la coyssa, e aprop lia aquelas emsemps am una benda per tres dias o per quatre, e aprop deslia aquelas.	Then plaster that one and make adhere the leg to the cushion, and then bind those together with a bandage for three or four days, and then loosen those.
E no uze le malaute de ambulacio per alcus dias, entro que sia sanat e cofortat.	And do not use the patient of walking for some days until he is healed and comfortable.
Mays si la reduccio de lu a tu es excusada, lahoras aministra fort extencio am liamentz dels quals en la curacio de la hancha precedit narracio.	But if the reduction to you is excused, then administer strong extension with ligaments of which in the cure of the hip preceding narrative.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter 33.
De la curacio de la dislocacio del talo.	Of the cure of the dislocation of the ankle.
Le talo alcunas veguadas es remaugut per petita remocio, e alcunas veguadas es dislocat segon compliment, e la dislocacio de lu es fayta o a las partidas dedintz o a las partidas deforo.	The ankle some times is sprained by small removal, and some times it is dislocated according to complement, and the dislocation of it is made either at the inward parts or at the outward parts.
E le senhal de la dislocacio de lu es que vezes le talo imflat procedent a la partida a la qual es dislocat.	And the sign of the dislocation of it is that you see the ankle swollen proceeding to the part to which it is dislocated.
Mays la curacio de la remocio de lu es de leugiera reddicio, e es que sia extendut am facilitat am las mas e sia engualhat entro que retorne.	But the cure of the sprain of it is by slight reduction, and it is that he be extended with facility with hands and be bound while he returns.
Mays en la curacio de lu quan es dislocat segon compliment, cove que fasses cezer le malaute dreyt, e tengua aquel un ministre fort e valent de la partida detras del dos de aquel en le mieg loc de lu.	But in the cure of it when it is dislocated according to complement, you should make the patient lie down straight, and have one strong and valiant minister of the part behind the jaw of that in the middle place of it.
E aprop te tu am la tieua ma dreyta le pe de la pus sobirana part, e am la tua ma sinistra de la part pus dejos del pe en le loc de la cavilha.	And then you with your right hand draw the foot of the highest part, and with your left hand of the lowest part of the foot in the place of the ankle.
E aprop atira le pe a tu am la tua ma dreyta, e aprop am la sinistra per dos veguadas, e aprop exten am la sinistra; e empelleys le pietz del pe am la dreyta deves la camba ses trebalh.	And then pull the foot to you with your right hand, and then with the left twice, and then extend with the left; and press the foot of the leg with the right beneath the thigh.
E fay aquo doas veguadas segon que havem comtat.	And do that two times according as we have counted.
E aprop empelleys le pietz del pe a la camba la tersa veguada, e tu es a la cavilha.	And then press the foot of the leg to the thigh the third time, and you are at the ankle.
Donc si retorna en una veguada o en dos segon aquesta manieyra, e si vezes le pe engualhat, es bo; e sino, lahoras sobre lu itera la operacio, quar aquel retorna.	Therefore if it returns in one time or two according to this manner, and if you see the foot swollen, it is good; and if not, then repeat the operation on it, for it will return.
Mays si a tu es prohibida la reduccio de lu am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu dos sobre terra, e estrenh un paysel mot en terra fermat, e que caja entre las coyssas de lu, e tu ja has envolopat sobre lu drap per so que no ledesca le malaute.	But if to you is prohibited the reduction of it by that which we have recommended, then make the patient lie down on his back on earth, and stretch a stake in firm earth, and that box between his thighs, and you already have wrapped a cloth around him so that he does not slide.
E aprop le ministre de lu tengua las suas coyssas, e aprop autre ministre extenda le pe am las suas mas o am liament que lie sobre le col del pe; e aprop extenda aquel quascun ministre contre extencio del sieu par, e le payssel sia extant entre las coyssas del malaute retinent aquel, per so que·l cos de lu no sia atirat a las partidas dejos deves la sua extencio.	And then the minister of it have his thighs, and then another minister extend the leg with their hands or with ligament that lies over the neck of the leg; and then each minister extend against extension of his fellow, and the stake be extended between the thighs of the patient retaining that, so that the body of him is not pulled to the lowest parts beyond his extension.
E aprop le metge enguala la dislocacio am las sieuas mas, e autre ministre tengua la coyssa sana a las partidas dejos, quar la dislocacio retorna am la facilitat.	And then the doctor softens the dislocation with their hands, and another minister have the healthy thigh to the lowest parts, for the dislocation returns with facility.
E donc cum retorna la dislocacio e es declarada a tu la sanetat de la reduccio de lu, lahoras pausa emplastre e extrenh aquela am liamentz fortment, e ligua le pe am liament a la camba.	And therefore when the dislocation returns and is declared to you the health of the reduction of it, then pause plaster and stretch that with ligaments firmly, and bind the leg to the ankle.
E cove que temes o te guardes dels nervis les quals so detras sobre le talo, per que le liament sobre aquel no sia vehement e leda aquel fortment.	And you should fear or keep from the nerves which are behind on the ankle, lest the ligament over that be violent and lead it strongly.
E aprop layssa aquel per dos dias o per tres; e si le liament es mollificat, extrenh aquel.	And then leave that for two days or three; and if the ligament is softened, stretch that.
E aprop deslia aquel en le ters dia o en le quart, e prohibeys le malaute de anament per xl dias.	And then loosen that on the third day or the fourth, and forbid the patient to walk for 40 days.
Mays si es forsat de anar denant aquel spazi, no es fayta segurtat que la dislocacio no sia sobre lu dissolvuda e corrumpuda, e aprop aquo que no recipia curacio.	But if he is forced to walk before that space, it is not done with security that the dislocation is not dissolved and corrupted, and then that which does not receive cure.
E si accideys a lu apostema caut, lahoras cove que tu aministre en la cedacio de lu aquo en lo qual precedic la nostra narracio, en autre loc de curacio e de embrocacio, entro que sia remauguda.	And if there happens to him an abscess with pus, then you minister in the ceding of it that in which our narrative preceded, in another place of cure and of fomentation, while it is suppurative.
Capitol .xxxiiii.	Chapter 34.
De curacio de dislocacio dels ditz dels pes.	Of the cure of dislocation of the toes of the feet.
Cove que aquel qu’es dislocat sia engualhat am pauca extencio ses trebal; e aquo que no es dificil, abantz es leugier.	That which is dislocated be swollen with little extension without difficulty; and that which is difficult, beforehand is lighter.
Mays si la dislocacio es en alcus nozes del dos del pe, lahoras cove que fassas cezer le malaute le sieu pe sobre loc engual de la terra o sobre taula, e sia estant ayssi cum si anava.	But if the dislocation is in some part of the jaw of the leg, then you make the patient lie down his leg on even ground or on a table, and be standing thus as if he were walking.
E aprop tu sta de pes, e pausa le tieu pe sobre aquo que imineys de las juncturas, e aprop calca aquel am le tieu pe am vertut entro que retorne, e que vejas aquel ja engualhat e no aparesca en le loc eminencia.	And then you stand on your feet, and place your leg over that which protrudes from the joints, and then press that with your leg with strength while it returns, and see that which is swollen and does not appear in the place prominent.
E aprop pausa dejos le ventre del pe de lu una taula que prengua tot le pe, a la qual sian dos caps, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent e ferma per tres dias; e aprop deslia aquel e fay aquel repausar de ambulacio per motz dias, entro que sia estrenhut e de reddicio sia assegurat.	And then pause under the belly of the leg of him a table that takes all the leg, to which are two ends, and then stretch that with decent and firm extension for three days; and then loosen that and make that rest from walking for some days, while it is stretched out and of reduction is assured.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter 35.
De las specias de dislocacio que sian faytas am plagua o am fractura o am quascuna ensemps.	Of the species of dislocation that are made by plague or by fracture, or by any other impingement.
Quan accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, e tu te perforssas en la curacio de aquela e en la restauracio de lu, motas veguadas succezeys la mort.	When there happens any cause of those, and you are expert in the cure of that and in the restoration of it, many times you succeed after death.
E per aquo no cove que sobre la curacio de lu presuma, sino aquel que es savi en l’art, de lonc uzatge, misericordios e pietados, tardiu, no-ardit ni presomptuos; e que use en le comensament de medicinas que cedan apostemas cautz tant solament, e leyssa le malaute al divinal jutgament, sino ad aquel al qual speras salut de perdicio, am de la malautia alleviacio, e en la qual appareys alcuna speransa.	And therefore do not presume upon the cure of it, but that which is expert in the art, long-suffering, compassionate and pitiful, tardy, not hasty nor presumptuous; and use in the beginning of medicines that produce suppurative abscesses justly, and let the patient be subject to divine judgement, unless you hope for salvation from perdition, from the wickedness alleviation, and in which appears some hope.
E adonc esforsa te tantost far de lu la reduccio en le comensament de la causa, denant que endevengua apostema caut.	And then try as much as you can of it the reduction in the beginning of the cause, before that he receives suppurative abscess.
E adonc si le membre retorna segon que volem, lahoras aministra regiment le qual ceda apostema caut e cura la plagua am aquo que conveneys a lu dels enguentz desiccatius.	And then if the member returns according as you wish, then minister regimen which yields suppurative abscess and cures the plague with that which suits him of the gummed parts dried.
E si dislocacio es am fractura e accideys en le os satagias separadas, lahoras tu perforsa le stement de lor, e fay en aquo so que havem dit en las malautias simplas de aquo que es precedit en les locz de aquels.	And if dislocation is by fracture and impingement happens in the separated bones, then you be expert of that, and do in that what we have said in the simple wickedness of those.
E guarda e esquiva segon la tua vertut aquel del intrament en las vias de temor segon que a tu es precedida la mia predicacio; quar aquo es milhor a tu deves le tieu Creator, e mays permanent a la tua gloria, e mays saludos al tieu cos verays aquels en le tieu temps.	And observe and avoid according to your ability the instrument of fear as I have described it in my sermon; for by doing so you will better serve your Creator, more firmly uphold your glory, and bring greater health to your true body in this life.
Ayssi fineysso las paraulas de Albucasim perfieytament de las quals Dieus ne sia benezeyt.	Thus ends the text of Albucasis, may God bless it.
Amen.	Amen.
